Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: KFW
Reviews.Content: In the Desert Club Resort the "rooms" are small appartments with everything you need from dishcloth to dishwasher, washing machine and dryer! The whole resort is spotlessly clean and maimtained to a high standard. Its just off the strip and an easy walk to the main casinos and the big Fashion Mall with all the shops you could possibly need. In the Desert Club it is quiet and there are nice pools, recreational facilities small shop and cafe. Would definitely stay there again and send all my friends, and its great value.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I went!”
Reviews.Author: canadaontario1
Reviews.Content: Went with family, as one of my family members had a time share. I went in October of 2010, and would love to go back. The rooms make you feel like your at home, and are very spacious and nice. Like one of the other commenters said, it is very quiet so you don't even realize your staying in a hotel. It is located one road behind the strip, which is walking distance. Glad I went, and looking forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Betty-Lou P
Reviews.Content: Myself and 5 female friends just stayed at the Desert Club Resort for 5 nts. March 12/12. We were amazed! The condo was gorgeous, clean and very roomy. Our only complaint was the mattress on the sofa bed was not very comfortable at all but they did their best to rectify that. It was a different experience staying in a condo instead of a hotel. We slept with the windows open; enjoyed the balcony...not being cooped up inside all the time. The 24 hr pools and hot tubs are a big plus. The grounds were immaculate. The staff was incredible! The shuttles to and from the strip were great...even tho since Holiday Inn took over the property they have cut some of the shuttles. There is NO shuttle to the grocery store now...a big disappointment to us. What you can buy onsite is limited and pricey. The food at the bar and grill was excellent...and suppertime hours there would be even better as they close at 5p.m. We wish they had 3 bedroom units...or at least a 2 bedroom with 2 queen beds in one of the bedrooms instead of a king. Can't wait to spend more time at this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: SarahF1203
Reviews.Content: Large sized apartments, so quiet you wouldn't know there was anyone around you. Great facilities (pool, fast food restaurant, supermarket, games room) Excellent shuttle service that drives you to and from the strip, also the resort is just behind the Venetian so close enough to walk to the main part of the strip instead. Clean and comfortable, would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st trip to las vegas and stay at desert club”
Reviews.Author: garythestokefan
Reviews.Content: i believe the resort now is called holiday inn at desert club resort Best things about resort location as has been said in previous reviews the location is perfect if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip Best attractions or restaurants nearby so many to choose from Caesars Palace,belagio,venitian,wynn hotel, grand canyon Review we stayed here for 1 week in september 4 of us in a 2 bedroom apartment. kitchen excellent everthing you could want. The bedrooms very large and beds comfy good size bathrooms and showers.We had breakfast every morning in the apartment then ventured onto the strip . We walked but can be a bit hot took about 15-20 steady minutes walk but we could have taken one of the shuttles to 3 /4 hotels. We did use these to come back in the evenings. only downer on these are most shuttles finish at about 11.30 for some may be a bit early but taxi from strip only cost's approx $6 so thats easily an affordable option. We went on a heli trip to grand canyon and weston ranch would say this is well worth a trip. would i stay at the desert club for my next visit to las vegas you bet

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort...exactly as expected.”
Reviews.Author: slbutler81
Reviews.Content: We booked a week long stay at Summer Bay Resorts/Desert Club for Thanksgiving week 2011. We had a two bedroom/two bath with sleeper sofa for myself, husband, and best friend and then a one bedroom/one bath for my mother and her friend. Because we are timeshare owners and we like to experience the amenties of each resort under our parent company, we did take advantage of everything that Desert Club had to offer. Location - Sits right behind Imperial Palace and allows you to walk through the garage/back entrances of any of the casinos sitting next to Imperial. Like others have said, Vegas blocks are long and personally I don't like to walk but this was really close to me. Did I walk it? No, because of issues with my foot. So if you don't walk it and don't catch a shuttle it is a $5 to have them drop you off in the middle of Imperial Casino. Shuttles - The best service that Desert Club could ever offer! Having that shuttle schedule was awesome and soooo convenient! All of my family could go and come as they pleased and we knew what time to expect them back depending on how long they said they were going to stay. It really made me feel better (security wise) knowing that they were going straight from the resort to the casinos. My Best Friend rarely ventures out without me when we are out of town but she fest secure enough to catch these on her own. For the grocery store run/Freemont Experience etc. these spots fill up VERY FAST. Basically they told us that we shouldve signed up when we checked in! Why they wouldn't take another shuttle is beyond me..I know enough people wouldve signed up for two shuttles. We lucked out and got a spot on the grocery run but Freemont ended up costing us $20 going AND coming back. One hour is the grocery store limit and it just didnt seem like enough. Be wise and split your list amongst whoever you take with you AND DO take someone. The store that they take you too if wayyyy cheaper than going to Albertson's on your own (its closer but not cheaper). Pool/Grounds/In House Store/Restaurant - The pool was awesome. It looked so inviting that we got in a few times during the day when the sun was out (it was very cold in November but not so bad). The grounds are well kept and I always saw the staff hard at work. The in-house store is very expensive so you have to weigh your needs and wants or manage without something until making it onto the strip or the weekly grocery trip. Their new restaurant was pretty good...we tried the pizzas, sweets, frito pie, and nachos from there and all of them were good. Pizza was hit and miss...first try was good...second time was alright but not as good as the first. The Room/Customer Service - The rooms were awesome. As far as the design that everyone else describes...just about ALL of the resorts that we have been to have that huge tub and sink in the main room. If you tell the resort ahead of time that you need a lower floor they can accomodate you...we didn't and they still helped us out by putting us on the 2nd floor and also they put both of my rooms up front near the main entrance. We didnt find it at all noisy as our view was right in the middle of the street that leads into Imperial. The kitchen was really handy as we cooked our WHOLE Thanksgiving meal in there and all ate together. I do with that there was also a DVD player for the bedrooms as they only have a few good channels. Maid service came during the middle of the week and I don't know about anyone else's service, but she would not enter/clean the room until we got there and we got in really late that week. Don't know if this is policy or not, but it could be another benefit security wise..that in room safe can only protect so much. Front office staff was very helpful and we called more than a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ladies weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: Jaime P
Reviews.Content: Four ladies stayed in a 2 bedroom at the Desert Club to celebrate my Mom's Birthday. We had GREAT time during our stay. The grounds were beautiful and well kept. My only comlpliant was that a few of the pools and the fitness center were under construction. No biggie, we just walked to one of the pools that had a hot tub and pool that were working. The cafe had great food and we enjoyed a nice lunch poolside. The staff was very friendly and helpful and check and the unit itself was clean and very nicely decorated. We had more than enough room and enjoyed cooking some meals in our kitchen to save money. The walk to the strip was not far, although we took full advantage of the free shuttle that ran almost every hour. I would recommend this resort to family or friends who want a nice Vegas getaway without smoke and noisey casino.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family oriented place, decent location, a few annoyances”
Reviews.Author: jeffcarp
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this condo. Let's get one thing out-of-the-way first. Yes, this is a timeshare. If you come here and accept discounts or other free products, you may be subjected to an annoying and potentially pressure packed timeshare presentation. If that's not for you, then don't accept the perk. But I have little empathy for people that accept the perk and then complain about the presentation after-the-fact. The location of this condo is pretty good. While it is located just one block off the strip, blocks in Vegas are huge. It is behind Imperial Palace but will take approximately 15 minutes to walk to the strip. Because of the bend in the strip near this location if you are attending a conference at the Sands convention Center then this is a really nice location. You can walk to the Sands convention Center in a little over 10 minutes. The grounds are very nice and maintained well. You walk around on the interior of the complex which consists of multiple buildings that are three stories in height. The grass and shrubs are well-maintained and we found the paths to be well lit. There are nicely done pools as well as areas to grill. Our unit had an exterior patio with tables and chairs as well. Parking seemed abundant though it did appear that the resort was lightly I can pied when we were here. Every parking space is covered with an overhead sun shield structure which was a nice touch to keep the hot desert sun off the interior of your cars during the summer months. The complex is surrounded by fencing with only one way in and out and that path has 24-hour guard service. There is free Wi-Fi on the complex and we found the signal inside our unit to be very strong and very fast. We did not use a lot of the resort amenities or any of the activities so we can't comment on those. Now onto the unit itself. We found the unit to be well-equipped, in good working condition, and very nicely furnished. You walk immediately into a small living room that has a sofa and a single chair. There is a large flatscreen TV on the wall above a gas fireplace. In the same area, there is a small four-person kitchen table with a few extra chairs as well as two barstools at an L-shaped kitchen bar that also serves as part of the kitchen countertops. There are two bedrooms, both of which also have large flatscreen TVs mounted to the wall as well as large walk-in closets for both. This was a nice feature to keep all of your luggage completely out-of-the-way and to hang up all of your clothes. Our only disappointment was that the second bedroom had a single queen size bed in it instead of two separate twin beds as is common at many timeshares. This means that a family with two kids will either have to try to get the two kids to sleep in the same bed or put one on the sleeper sofa in the living room. The master bathroom is not separated from the master bedroom it is part of the same large room except for the toilet which is in a separate small space behind door. The master bath tub is massive. It is literally approximately 7' x 4' in size and you step into the tub to take a shower from the single showerhead. If you and your partner in the master bedroom happen to have different schedules then the lights from the bathroom sink will shine directly on the bed where the other partner is attempting to sleep. The bathtub is completely impractical after you get over your initial wow moment of seeing the size of it. The problem is that the water heater is not even close to being adequately sized to fill the tub. After a long day on the strip we thought it would be great to relax in the tub. After sitting in it and turning on the hot water we could get water only to the height of about halfway up our leg before we ran out of hot water. This is a completely ridiculous design. The second bath has a shower only, no tub. All things considered, we enjoyed out stay here and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice updated condos.”
Reviews.Author: kellykk
Reviews.Content: We had used RCI to exchange in for a 2 bedroom condo for a one week stay in August of 2010. At that time there was a lot of construction still going on. There were things missing from our suite and we found out later that our doorbell was not working. But once called down to report these, things were repaired pretty quick. Did not like that the small arcade at the time that we were there, that was not free to hotel guests (like club intrawests). We had a car, so only used the shuttle service once. But those that used the shuttle service in our stay were sitting out there in the heat for 20 minutes waiting for a shuttle. The suites are well equipped with slippers (nice touch), full kitchens and laundry rooms. The pool was small but okay. Would stay here again, if staying for a week or more with children. We used the nearby VON`s to get groceries, for when we weren`t eating out.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Proflyn
Reviews.Content: We have a one room suite with kitchen. Huge tub, heated pools, little market & bar/grill. They have a free shuttle to several casinos nearby and it is a 10 minute walk to the monorail. Overall, nice resort in a good location if you cannot stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Chantelle F
Reviews.Content: I traveled to this resort in March of 2011 and don't have a single complaint about it. The shuttle buses were an amazing feature to have as my friends and I didn't feel 100% safe walking the back streets of Vegas at night. The resort was under construction when we visited but it didn't bother us at all. The room was more amazing than we expected it to be. We had a 2 bedroom suite. The kitchen and dining room were beautiful. Our couch was comfortable. The HUGE tub in the bathroom looked amazing but I used it on our last day there and by the time to water got to the level I wanted it at, the water was running cold. But that's understandable. The suite was beautiful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for all the family”
Reviews.Author: Mel1933
Reviews.Content: We had 2 x double bedded apartments opposite to each other, although they were on the 3rd floor the stairs are easy and accessible. The apartments were very spacious and clean, the laundry facilities were excellent and the maid even left us some more washing powder foc when we ran out. Beware the onsite foodmart though, it is VERY expensive. The pools are great and heated all year round, plus they are open 24hrs a day. The shuttle service to various hotels on the strip is free but you can walk to the strip in 10 minutes if you prefer. All in all it was a very enjoyable stay and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “splendid place just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: sagara10
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 bedroom apartment for 5 member party. Bedrooms were just enough size for 2 pax. 2 full baths suited our style of living. Full kitchen with nice dining and hall areas. 3 LCD TV's but of course hardly needed to use being in Vegas. Nice settings outside, heated pool. Not too far from the strip, in fact if you feel like a walk, it is just 10 minutes from the venetian. Grocery , breakfast are on-site if you feel lazy about using the full kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Fam Lindahl”
Reviews.Author: caroll189852
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice but the service is very bad.. and we been stolen som juwerly on the room. House keeping dint even change the bed clothing, we did!!and we been here for 12 days. The most saddest part is they dint take it seriously that someone been on our room and take something, we just write a repport, thats it.. no sorry at all... to sad. the place was near the strip that the best of it.

Reviews.Title: “Best condo accomodations 10 minute walk from the middle of the strip.”
Reviews.Author: crazy_lazy_daisy
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at Desert Club Resort (formerly known as the Summer Bay Resort). We love the fact that this resort keeps all five of its outdoor pools heated through the winter months and that they are open 24 hours. The grounds are beautifully maintained with pleasant staff offering their pleasant wishes for the day. They will also offer you a ride to the front entrance on one of their golf carts if you're staying in one of the buildings at the back of the resort. Staying at this resort is very convenient if you want the action of the strip, but want to stay away from the smoke and noise of the casinos as it's only a 10 minute walk which puts you right in the middle of the strip. They now offer quite a few shuttles that run throughout the day from the front entrance that will take you to different casinos if you don't feel like walking or if you don't have a vehicle of your own. We were put into a nicely renovated room which boasted new furniture and appliances. The king size bed is incredibly comfortable which has a flat screen t.v. on the wall at the foot of the bed. The bathroom is off of the bedroom and it has the absolute largest Roman bathtub that we have ever seen. The housekeepers came in every day and brought fresh towels and replenished the supplies. We only had two complaints about our unit. The first one being that the carpets were filthy dirty. You would think with a newly renovated unit that the least they could do about the carpets is to shampoo them. You couldn't see that they were dirty because of the colour, but our white socks and the bottom of our feet were black not too long after walking around on them. I guess that's why they supply slippers to use while you're there. Our second complaint is that the hide-a-bed was a very poor quality although it was new. Our two girls slept on this and you didn't even have to lay on it to feel the srpings coming through the thin mattress. So we folded our thick bedspread off of our king bed into four and put that under the mattress pad. This did help, but in the future I would get a room with a second bed in it instead. I would not recommend anyone having to sleep on this poor quality mattress. I can't imagine adults sharing a room and two of them having to sleep on the hide-a-bed. I'm sure that they wouldn't get any rest at all. All in all we definitly recommend staying at the Desert Club and we will stay there time and time again as long as they offer the same great rate. We've stayed at another condo off the strip and a beautiful hotel on the strip, but this is by far our favourite place to stay while visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best off-strip accommodations”
Reviews.Author: lauraswaft
Reviews.Content: Loved that we were in a safe part of town, off the strip (but could walk to it), and in a condo type room. The gas fireplace made the room homey. Two big screen TV's in the room. Lots of security all over. Pool was not filled when we were there--game room required tokens to play. Did not like the room layout in that the bathroom was off the master bed area & no door to the shower (guess this depends on whom you're rooming with!). Bathtub was gigantic. Kitchen was a little squishy as you could not open the fridge without moving the kitchen table. Having said all that, will stay there again just for the location and room size for the money. It was a well-equipped room and comfortable. Love that you can park right outside your room & not have to walk 3 miles through a smoky casino.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the strip but very quiet”
Reviews.Author: Schwaca1
Reviews.Content: Clean spacious units. Friendly staff. Facility Is very pleasing to the eye and lacks nothing. Three stories no elevator, if steps Are an issue request ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “RCI timeshare close to strip. Nice rooms & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lynnkid
Reviews.Content: The condo was nicely furnished & clean. We had a 1 bedroom with fully equipped kitchen, living & dining area. Included a DVD player & i-pod docking station. The toilet is separate from sink & shower which is nice when staying with our adult daughters.....helps with getting ready in the morning. Also the bathroom was accessible via the living room & via the bedroom; bathroom had a very large tub / shower. Walk-in closet was actually large enough to walk in & change clothes inside. The king bed was extremely comfortable (unfortunately the sofa bed in the living room was not). The kitchen has a few extra items that are a nice touch such as salt / pepper and plenty of dish soap. Rooms also have washer dryer and balcony. They offer a shuttle with drop-off/pick-up points at Venetian, Bally's & New York New York. We walked to the strip some and took the shuttle when convenient; the drivers are very nice and helpful. We visited in December when chilly but sunny and appreciated the pools and hot tubs were available 24/7 since 60 degrees is warm to us! Staff are friendly & helpful. BBQ grills are available and they have a small grocery onsite. The only downside in my opinion is the 10am check out time....they come knocking at your door at 9:59. I should have asked for a later checkout. We would stay here again as the parking is easy, shuttles are awesome and the rooms & pool are very nice. Close to Ellis Island Casino which offers a great steak dinner for $7; includes a beer! Delicious prime rib is $13 with beer.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accommodation”
Reviews.Author: guykb
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews of this place are less than favorable. I can't really understand why. If you are wondering about whether to book here, I say, don't hesitate. It's really that good. First, the location. It's not on the strip but it's only one block behind it. It's a ten minute walk to some of the main places like Caesars Palace and the like. Next, the apartment. Huge and luxuriously furnished. When I checked in I wished I had booked for much longer! The beds are super comfortable, the bathrooms are wonderful. The apartment has a laundry too. Outside there is a heated pool and spa. The service from the front desk is impeccable and they are happy to drive you to your room on their little golf carts. There is also a shuttle service to the strip if you can't be bothered walking. Overall, this is amazing value. Very good.

Reviews.Title: “WELL it's not the Bellagio - but it was okay!”
Reviews.Author: HappyNudistCouple
Reviews.Content: They must have just been sold to another company - doing remodeling work so much extra confusion going on. The shuttle service helps a ton - and be ready to walk to the good stuff.... I guess you could take a cab - but the traffic is out of control in Vegas. WAY too many tourist and each brings their own style of driving to the roads. The main busses are nice and easy to handle. The "resort" is not much of a resort as you might imagine.... kind of your run of the mill TIMESHARES - where again you get what you pay for basically. Would NOT rush back... but if you want to save money for the shows and to gamble this place works - - - but so does the Motel 8!!!

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust817
Reviews.Content: My husband and mother-in-law and I stayed here on our recent trip to Las Vegas over the Christmas holiday. After reading so many great reviews about the property, we booked a two-bedroom, two-bath unit for two nights. I am SO glad we stayed here! It was basically like having our own apartment one block off the Strip. The apartment was roomy and nicely furnished and immaculately clean. We had a living room, fully equipped kitchen, dining area, a bedroom with bathroom on the hallway, and master bedroom with bathroom ensuite. The master bath had an enormous tub/shower. Beds were extremely comfortable. We couldn't believe how nice and comfy this place was, especially considering how little we paid for it. You won't find a better deal anywhere in Vegas for a place this nice. The property had a free shuttle that had drop-off/pick-up points at The Venetian, Bally's, and New York New York. This was very convenient and the drivers were always nice and gave good insider tips on restaurants and things to do. They don't offer a continental breakfast but you'll have a fully equipped kitchen if you want to make coffee or some meals. They do have a restaurant/snack bar on-site but we didn't eat there. Bring some coffee and creamer and sugar/sweetener if you want coffee in the morning because they only provide a small packet of coffee and one condiment pack with a single sugar packet and one non-dairy creamer packet (not nearly enough for 2+ people)! Not a big deal, but I wish we had brought some of this stuff with us. The ONLY negative thing I can think of with this resort is that the wireless internet is ridiculously slow. Overall, we had a wonderful stay at the Desert Club and I wish we could have stayed longer! This is the only place I will stay in Vegas from now on!

Reviews.Title: “loved it,loved it ,loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Elginia P
Reviews.Content: when i first stepped into the room,i was like wow!.room came equiped with everthing from the two plasma tv's stove ,fridge,dishwasher,sofa bed washer,dryer,big circular bathtub for two which has a shower too.a safe to put ur valuables was a BIG plus for me,balcony with 2 chairs,dining room table with 4 chairs. the bed will put u into a coma like sleep! i like the fact that the resort had shuttle buses to take u to the strip which was 1 to 2 blocks away.oh forgot to mention we were greeted with popcorn and thay also have two computers in the lobby for use.they have caddy service to take u from building to building or to their fitness center which has a jacuzzi.concierge service is in the lobby also.everybody nice.patrick is a great guy which made me feel welcomed on out first day there.we stayed 7 days and i wished we could have stayed a month! we will return in may for sure!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Las Vegas Apartment”
Reviews.Author: UKbanker33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Club on a several day visit to Vegas and were completely satisfied and positively surprised in some respects. I had booked a very low rate on hotelsdotcom and had some anxiety. We arrived on a Saturday and check in was quite busy, but we quickly found our fourth floor apartment. Anxiety dissipated as we opened the door to find a small but perfect one-bedroom apartment immaculately maintained and beautifully furnished. The living room had a huge sofa, a big flat screen TV and a fire place(!). The kitchen was a full one and ready to use, although we attempted little cooking at "home." The bedroom had a flat screen TV and a very comfortable king bed. The bathroom was luxuriously outfitted. We had a small balcony (not much view -- overlooking parking), with (surprise) an adjacent washer/dryer room and even complimentary detergent. The grounds were very well-maintained, although we had little spare time to utilize the pools or other amenities. The complex is one mega-bloc from the Strip, which we walked a couple of times...it is not a scenic hike past parking lots, building sites and the backside of Strip hotels...and late at night we took taxis. We had a car and easily accessed different parts of the city during the day. All in an excellent home away from home in Las Vegas for those preferring the privacy and independence of an "apartment". We will stay here on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Location was perfect; unit immaculate- Perfection in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Geonannie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Las Vegas Desert Club Resort, one block off the strip but in the middle of everything. Plenty of parking, the unit was immaculate and comfortable with everything we could need. The washer and dryer were really appreciated as we could pack less knowing they were available. A car was wonderful but without one yoiu can stille asily get around either walking or using the free shuttle service provided by the property. The Desert club is close to the Flamingo, Harrahs, the Wynn, the Palazzo, the Venetian and the Fashion mall. Plenty of restaurants were close by for a quick breakfast, however we chose to eat breakfast in our kitchen and there was no problem finding groceries nearby. We had a two bedroom unit and it was roomy and comfy---It had all of the advantages of being in the middle of everything but was nice and quite and out of the hustle bustle for a few minutes of relaxation. Although we didn't use them (too cold) there are 5 heated pools and a lovely pool area that includes BBQ grills. One of the nice things about having the car in this location is that there was easy access to everyplace without having to drive a lot on the srip- We used the back and side roads and avoided a lot of traffic and congestion. A stay here will not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent clean and very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: FkWenzel
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its recommendations. We stayed during the week in The Mirage and tried to avoid its overpriced weekend rates. So we were looking for something reasonable close to the strip. We couldn't believe that this resort received so many good recommendations, so we decided to see it with our own eyes. We have to admit that all the positive recommendations are warrantable. I'm German and as everybody know Germans will always look for complains ;-) Sure the was a cabinet door that could close better, but this place was so clean that you really had to search for items that evidently show that it was used more than once. This resort is untypically for the US excellent maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Fanfastic”
Reviews.Content: Fab rooms had 2bedroom apt.everything you need. staff very helpfull could not fault this place for the money.christmas decorations in reception area very nice.will use this resort again.near the strip.quickest way is to walk through imperial palace car park into casino.then out on to strip 5mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME service and tons of room!!!”
Reviews.Author: Becky Jo S
Reviews.Content: The place is amazing for the money. I do suggest having a car as you are not on the strip, but this will be my go to place ANYTIME I have shows at the Sands/ Venetian (it's right across the street) or even the LVCC as it's only a mile from there. I rented 4 rooms for a big group and they were perfect. In addition when there was a minor issue with something they went above and beyond to make it right!

Reviews.Title: “Formally Summer Bay Resorts - Get a Time Share Unit!”
Reviews.Author: 42forever
Reviews.Content: Get a Time Share Unit! They are spacious and kept very well. The one we stayed in with my in-laws had very nice furniture and was real comfortable! The service is outstanding and when we had a clogged toilet, the maintenance staff would not enter unless someone was there. They were very professional and quick. The grounds were really nice. A lot of Baby boomers and families, but that is OK because maybe that is why it is so nice and quiet. My in-laws agreed! The pool area was a good size and there is all kinds of activities going on during the day. The clubhouse is really nice and clean and had computers for use. They just opened a snack bar near the front pool and surprisingly, it was good for a snack on a late night. Save some money and get some groceries. Had a second level unit so had to get help with the 100 lb cooler, but it was OK. We had a full kitchen and dining room. We were a short walk from Imperial palace and harrahs, not bad during the day, but felt weird at night. Just be careful. Overall, I would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “las vegas weekend”
Reviews.Author: COMahoney
Reviews.Content: Great place if you need extra space for a large group or families. Full kitchen, 2 baths etc. Carpets are dirty and the walls are thin!

Reviews.Title: “honest, responsible employees”
Reviews.Author: Margaret M
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 2 nights at this resort and we were very happy with our suite. It was comfortable and clean. The resort is a short walk to the strip. The unfortunate thing that happened was that I left my small jewelery tote on the bed & forgot to pack it. I called the morning after our return when I unpacked and realized it was missing. I was put through to Jorge Cruz, security supervisor. He checked and called us back with the good news that my jewelery tote was turned in. They sent it to me via FDX. I very much appreciate the honest of their staff. The name on the lost & found tag was Roderick Nuckoles, and I thank him & Jorge Cruz for sending me my items.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, close to the strip -- nice place!”
Reviews.Author: brebear3
Reviews.Content: We swapped out my parents timeshare week for this one using RCI. We decided to have the family meet in Las Vegas for Thanksgiving. Overall it is a very nice place that is close to the strip. They have been in the process of updating and from what others in my group said it looks waaay better now. Cons: they were doing construction on the hot tub near our room and we heard a lot of jackhammering, not a great vacation noise. The rooms are dark, no overhead lighting in the bedrooms. This didn't bother me at all, but we were on the 3rd floor and there isn't an elevator. Luckily my grandfather was staying with my uncle who lives in town as he wouldn't have been able to climb the stairs. Internet was in and out -- called and they said they were trying to fix it. Pros: large, clean rooms. great location -- just behind the strip (behind imperial palace and Flamingo). Shuttles to various casinos available. Fitness room (it's okay, but for vacation it does the trick). Plenty of parking in front of the rooms. More of a condo style design, makes you feel a little removed from crowded vegas which is nice. washer and dryer, iron and board. no timeshare pitch pressure. we enjoyed our stay and i'd book this place again, especially via a last minute deal through RCI.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay and relax”
Reviews.Author: chance81625
Reviews.Content: stayed for a week in november and it was great. shuttles run downtown and to the strip. u r not pressured by salesmen and the concierge was good for any info needed. great place to vacation

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and a bit of a walk to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Jeff S
Reviews.Content: The night guy didn't seem to be all that into his job when we checked in but overall the people at the front desk were nice to deal with. Our room was at the back of the property and this added to our walks but if someone came by in a golf cart they were always nice enough to give us a lift. We stayed in one of the two bedroom suites that was in desparate need of updating. Clean but so worn you could hardly tell. We were only there for a weekend so time was of the essance. We tried to take the shuttle a couple of times but when it only ran hourly it was tough to make at times. The walking was good for us. It is in walking distance of the strip ( a good long walk)and you get to see the underbelly of Las Vegas while you walk. Service was good. The shower in the second bathroom was leaking and I called the front desk and it was fixed before we returned from dinner. I had a problem because the folks in the room above us was partying all night and I wanted at least one night of sleep while I was there so I called the front desk and said what was going on and it was suggested that I go and join the party. Not the response I expected but they did send someone to quiet it down eventually. For the price I would recommend it but I really thing we should have paid more and stayed on the Strip

Reviews.Title: “This place is even better now it is finished.”
Reviews.Author: Petali13
Reviews.Content: Choosing this timeshare resort for its off-the-strip quietness I was delighted to find that they have finally completed the re-construction of the main entrance and pool. This was a special vacation for a family get together and renewal of vows after 25 years of marriage. Having booked 3 units and promised everyone how nice, clean and comfortable this resort was I was a little nervous about what to expect. But we were situated together in the same block and all the units were fully renovated to a high standard. There is now a small shop and snack bar. I think the only complaint we did find was the shuttlebus was full a number of times and although we didn't mind walking my daughter was 7 months pregnant and we had to take a taxii rather than stand around for another hour. .

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: Larry L
Reviews.Content: A perfect place to stay within walking distance to the strip. Allthough playing slots on the strip isn't my choice. The machines are way to tight, better to play off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected retreat near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: uTravelTheWorld
Reviews.Content: As a family of more than 4 people you have a hard time finding a decent room close to the Strip. This is a timeshare property fairly well kept and a closed community. They have two bedroom appartements with a foldout bed in the livingroom, a kitchen and laundry. You can park close to your room, but no elevator if you are on a higher floor. Cleanliness is ok but not great. The only problem we had, happened with the internet booking service, that seemed to have transfered the kind of room we booked wrong and we had to deal with that problem. The strip is a paralell street to the Club. You are near the Venetian and the Paris. The Club has a Shuttle Service that takes you about everywhere you want to go, so no problem if you dont have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Jasonleongcm
Reviews.Content: We got a 2 bed room appartment for good rates. It's very near to the strip and provide free shuttle. Service was good but Internet was down on one of the days

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: bagladygee
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort through RCI timeshare and were hopeful but expecting to be disapointed as we usually are with RCI. All though we went to Vegas we were looking for something off the strip where we could relax and hang out. I wish I could pick up this resort and move it to other RCI locations I want to visit. The place was very nice and clean, the staff was great and the unit had everything we could want. We had a rental car so didn't use the shuttles much but alot of people did and they ran often. If I had to find one negative to say about staying here it would be to complain about the 2 families with noisy running kids that stayed in the unit above us. (Who brings kids to VEGAS????)

Reviews.Title: “Nice reprieve from the strip”
Reviews.Author: cotravelfan33
Reviews.Content: I did not mind the walk to the lobby each morning as one would have to walk no matter where you stay in Vegas. The property is fairly well kept and nice looking. One thing I would recommend, you should get a room on the third floor as it can be very noisy with people overhead. But, if you do get a nice room as we did it is a very quiet, peaceful stay. They have a shuttle that runs once an hour throughout the day and night to and from the strip. I was impressed with the staff and felt that most of them very friendly and accommodating. The gift shop has really decent fresh coffee in the morning that you can buy which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Happy RCI Member-Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ruthandvern
Reviews.Content: While we stayed in unit 2-204 this past week I read the reviews about this place and feel blessed to be among those with the magnificent Suite, including two bedrooms, (both King beds (not fitted sheets)) two baths (one shower only but we had the double size tub/shower in the Master) the room included a fainting couch, how cool!, There were LG flat screen HD TVs in both bedrooms as well as the living room. This place was wonderful! One city block separates you from the Monorail station at Imperial Palace/Harrahs, and moving through the casinos to the Strip is a snap. There are shuttles to about everywhere, [except the airport]. We stuck with the main pool by the lobby and small grill, and the water is heated enough even my aches allowed me quick entry. We basked in the Sun daily and were thrilled with our late October stay. The large living area, dining room, balcony and fully stocked kitchen made for cheaper living and a great base of operations. Really impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and a long walk to suite room!”
Reviews.Author: jasmine747
Reviews.Content: Decided on this resort after seeing all the great reviews here. Was very disappointed and switched resorts the day after arrival. Had to walk to building 9 from the lobby, was a long walk basically through parking lots. Suite looked decent except for the rip in the couch. Bed and pillow was very uncomfortable and was very loud at night. Almost like the plumbing in the wall was exploding. Ear plugs do not drown out noise that loud!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Value for Money, Average Service.”
Reviews.Author: Matt E
Reviews.Content: The reason I choose this hotel was because of the location (1 block from the middle of the strip) at a reasonable price. The rooms are of a decent size with full kitchen facilities and fridge in the room (although a bit dated). There is air conditioning and free wi-fi in the rooms, with a couple of pools and BarBQ facilities around the complex (seems very family friendly). There is a shuttle to several casino's on the strip but it is within a quick 5-10 minute walking distance. The restaurant is more like a kiosk and the food is average (I'd find somewhere on the strip to eat). The front desk and service was ordinary. It has a great location and value for money so would definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Club Resort, truly excellent for the price.”
Reviews.Author: david r
Reviews.Content: Please take note: ive just come back from 8 nights at summer bay or desert club resort as its now called, I stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment and was amazed how new and clean it was as i walk through the door, your met with a new kitchen fully kitted out with microwave big fridge waist disposal unit, cooker. the living room has a 50" plasma tv stuck on the wall and a nice sofa, Bedroom has a massive king size bed and again a 50" plasma on the wall, Bathroom has a huge 2 person bath shower unit sink and a separate toilet. The resort it self is immaculate and not a spec out of place. Whilst i was there, it was occupied by a lot of older people so no screaming kids, but i assume if you went the summer holidays you might get a few families in there. Location to strip, 5 min walk, you can see caesars palace from the resort. Free shuttle buses will take you to various casinos on the strip and also to downtown freemont street. you will have to book onto this though. almost forgot you have your own laundry room with washing machine and dryer. Some reviews on here are based on people who usually pay thousands of £££££$$$$$ to stop in top places and think this should be the same for a few hundred ££$$. Book it, i'll be there again next year, no more hotels for me.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Our Standards unless you are an "Owner"”
Reviews.Author: LlamaMama29
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort on the strength of reviews (somehow, it actually got an 8.7 out of 10!) and the fact that there were TWO king sized beds. We were traveling with my Brother-in-law and his wife, and they insisted on a king, and we thought a condo with kitchen might serve us well. There were others that found what we did- but all the propaganda claimed this resort had been totally renovated, so I chose to believe "shabby" and "outdated" were behind this place. We checked in just after midnight. I hoped upon hope that we would have a remodeled condo. Not so lucky. As others have mentioned... NO ELEVATOR. We were placed in #7 (there are MANY buildings) on the third floor. All the buildings look alike. I hoped that meant "remodeled". NOT. The furniture was green vinyl with huge rips in the upholstery. The cabinetry was 1970ish laminate with rose colored, tired Formica countertops. The carpet was dirty in appearance and shabby. The mattresses hadn't been replaced in a LONG while. For 4 nights, I slept at a 22 degree slant, rolling to the middle of the bed. One of the towels I used had (what appeared to be) dirty footprints. The gas pilot light in the fireplace was on all the time and REALLY noisy. The Contact paper in the cupboards was all peeling. I could go on. You get the picture. Sure, the location is nice. Couple blocks off the strip, easy to park, no death march to the ends of mile long hotel corridors. But again, luck of the draw. Our condo faced the parking lot. We had a great view of the rental car from our balcony, The bedroom window didn't stay open for long... folks arguing in the parking lot woke us up. Busses dropping off inebriated guests after dark made it real difficult to sleep. I felt mislead by webpages stating this place had been fully remodeled. Had I known there was a risk of getting the shabby room we got, I would have spent a few more bucks and gone somewhere else. We don't ever plan on returning to the Desert Club (Summer Bay) Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: joneksi
Reviews.Content: I booked my parents here on a stay in Vegas and was well surprised with the quality of the rooms (especially after reading a couple of reviews I was a bit intimitated). But actually the unit my parents stayed in was awesome with two huge TV screens, a big balcony and great kitchen and interior design. The king bed was huge, as was the bathtub. They must have some old and newer apartments and we just happened to get a room on the newer side, as it was completely awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good rooms (up to the money), NO service.”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderAn
Reviews.Content: We were staying there for three nights, two rooms: one with two bedrooms and one with one bedroom. Rooms were pretty old fashined and shabby, with tears in the furniture but way better than in some other hotels we were staying before (not in Vegas). Both rooms equipped with full kitchen (dish washing machine etc), washing machine, dryer and iron. Although very old but working and it was really nice to have this stuff in the middle of a long trip thru US. Rooms were very quite is aircon is turned off and acceptable if it is on. So I would say It was pretty comfortable for us. On the second day I found a source of a very strange annoying sound - they forgot to replace battery in the smoke detector. It happens. Anyway, for the money we paid - I would say rooms were very good. Shabby but good. As for location - it is very close to the Strip - like 10 minutes walk. Or they offer shuttle service to three main points of the Strip. Or you can take a cab for $5-10. Just be aware it may take an hour before you order a car and it arrives. If you're going somewhere to the far ends of the strip (to the Stratosphere for example) - it is better to take monorail as station locatied just in 7 minutes walk towards the Strip. Hotel offers no breakfast and has sole fast-food-style-restaurant on it's property. Actually it is not bad, pool-side etc. But I would recommed to eat somewhere else if you have time. The worst thing was front desk service. Normally I don't need anything from front desk but map. This time I decided to try to save some time and asked few very simple things like "how much monorail costs and what time it closes", "what time Stratosphere closes", "can you recommend me a place to start exploring the city with" etc. They've failed them all. The answer was like "you can find the map in that brochure... it is all there". I failed to order a taxi by phone from my room - "you have to go to the front entrance and ask bellboy to call it for you". I did. "taxi will be in 20 minutes". Came in 45. "we are not very busy hotel and taxies sometimes ignore us". Checking out took us an hour. Reception "specialist" had no skills to operate simple calculator (no kidding) so she had to ask senior specialist to explain why bills look that strange. Turned out they charged first night for both rooms to one credit card and then charged second card in full for three nights+some security payment and first card for three nights too. And charging first night to one card they put it in the bill of a second one. To make this story short - they completely messed up both payments. Senior specialist also failed and only in few hours after I got an email from her with proper receipt and corrected payment. It could be so much better with just proper manager on duty.

Reviews.Title: “Close Enough To Strip To Be Good But Far Enough To Be Better”
Reviews.Author: keiligh
Reviews.Content: My family has been an "owner" of a two bedroom unit with Desert Club (Formally Summer Bay Club) for over 20 years. We visit the property twice a year for a few days at a time. We have watched it grow from renovated apartments behind the Flamingo Casino into the jewel that it has become. Not a diamond mind you, but a beautiful jewel just the same. About a block and a half away from the Las Vegas "strip" Desert Club is close enough to the action to be able to get there by walking if desired, but far away enough to feel as though you are in some oasis in the desert. It boasts several pools (all with a different theme), activities for kids and adults alike (bingo for prizes and other games for the children), a gym with a treadmill, elliptical machine, stationary bike and a few essential weight machines, and a dry sauna in the men's and women's bathrooms of the fitness area (it would have been better to have one big co-ed sauna....it was weird when my fiance and I each went alone into a sauna). The rooms are really what is the best part of the entire club. This is what I look forward to after my long drive from Phoenix or from Lake Tahoe. It is spacious to say the least. I have never been dissapointed with any of the rooms of the current resort. Every one is very good. This last time we stayed in a room that had less than desirable views (parking lot), but we really did not care. The view inside was just fine for us. Each room (and I mean EACH ROOM: every bedroom in the unit and the living room) has a large TV. We have been lucky enough to have had flat screens every time we visited in the last few years, but I know that this is not the case for every unit...you might get a large tube tv inside of a wooden console with fake ivy on top. There is a full kitchen in every unit which I use every morning to fix breakfast. Speaking of food, there is now a little market on site where you can buy a few groceries for a very high premium markup. You can also go to the major grocery store in their shuttle...but you have to "sign up" for that and it is only one day a week. So if you have no car and you are not there during the shuttle day, then you just have to figure it out for yourself. That was a big thumbs down for us. Also, the on-site market really needs to learn how to stock smaller items for visitors...why would someone buy a full-size bottle of olive oil for a week or less? And what is the deal with the coffee for sale when you can brew the free coffee in the room? This should be a free offering in the lobby!!! Along with water and other refreshments for weary travelers waiting in line (take note Desert Club!!). All that aside, I do love the bedrooms. There were little details and needs that I really like: walk-in closet in the master (big enough for my fiance and me to put our clothes and shoes!) "black-out" curtains on the windows for times when you just want to sleep-in, a HUGE bathtub in the master, hairdryer, a LOT of space for things in the bathroom, extra towels galore, a big, very comfy bed, a full washer and dryer in a separate little room complete with ironing board, iron, a little bit of detergent and a small organizing area (nice! Came in very handy), and every appliance you could need (and if they don't have it, I bet they could find it for you!) OK..so here is the real downside and why I have given this resort 4 stars and not five.... THE SHUTTLES: In short, the shuttle situation is pretty bad. They give you a little sheet with all the drop-off and pick up times at the casinos they go to. And if you are one minute late, they are gone and you have to wait 2 or more hours for the next one. I have seen only 3 shuttles in operation for the resort and TWO of those are employed to shuttle people around the resort only! So that means there is ONE shuttle operating to shuttle people to the casinos. I remember the days when the shuttles for this resort were much more prolific in their offerings. Gone are those days....and don't even get me started on the grocery shuttle...We were once left stranded at the resort by a shuttle because it had filled up and had a taxi called. My iPhone was stollen from that taxi soon after we were dropped off and it most likely would not have happened had I left the phone in the shuttle. Plus, the taxi ride from the resort to Mandalay Bay where our convention was cost us $18!! Besides the abismal shuttle situation, I do love this resort and I enjoy returning time and time again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service is not a priority”
Reviews.Author: Justsayin2010
Reviews.Content: We traded our time share to stay at Summer Bay. We liked the location, easy access from Koval Lane, no need to drive down the busy strip. The grounds are well kept. We used the public barbecues several times and they were clean. However, we had trouble getting utensils from housekeeping as they do not give them out due to people stealing them. If you plan to barbecue, bring your own utensils, or buy them when you get to Las Vegas. Our condo was small, but functional. It sleeps four but I would not recommend more than 2 people in it. Comfortable king sized bed, two flat screen TV's. The walk in closet was great for storage of our clothing and shoes as well as our suitcases. There was a safe in the closet as well. The bathtub was huge but the vanity was small so no space to put your toiletries. We had quite a time getting service though. First of all we couldn't get barbecue utensils, then we needed maintenance to come as our toilet wouldn't stop flushing. We had to call three times to get the maids to come to do our weekly cleaning. One finally showed up at the end of the day while I was in the middle of making supper. Because the maids wouldn't come, we asked for clean tea towels and a dish cloth and they brought us bath towels. We have never stayed anywhere where the maid service is so poor! There is plenty of parking and the shuttle service is reliable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Comments about this resort”
Reviews.Author: Pistulira
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 3 business men coming to a Convention for 3 days. We rented the two bedroom suite that accommodated us perfectly with privacy and comfort. The living room with the big TV, dining table, full kitchen with icemaker fridge and dishwasher allowed us to share some relaxing time with snacks and drinks at the end of the tiring day. The quick breakfast with eggs and toast would allow us to start our day with all the energy and time to take advantage of a full schedule of meetings. In all of these, the staff was in charge of all the cleanliness of the rooms, putting away/washing our dirty dishes and leftovers in the kitchen, tiding up all the rooms, 24 hours of front-desk assistance, small convenient store in the hotel and towel service at all the the jacuzzies and pools. On top of this, the great and free shuttle transportation (round-trip) to many spots in the Strip made our stay PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay with older kids”
Reviews.Author: brebarg
Reviews.Content: We stayed Oct 9th thru the 13, and had a great experience. We rented a 2 bedroom, 2 bath in tower 3. Had a pool close by to enjoy. Although you could easily walk to the strip, we chose to drive to the parking decks of the various large hotels, so we wouldn't be so tired just getting there. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Sivetta O
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Summer Bay - Desert Club as part of a "Ladies" trip of six. The resort was only a block from the strip so we were able to walk. The resort also offered a shuttle that went out to select hotels on the strip and brought us back. Anytime we asked the front desk for anything they were so helpful and fulfilled our request. We stayed in a two bedroom/two bath condo with a full kitchen. The rooms were okay, but needed updating. However, the customer service made up for the room. I would definitely recommend this resort as it was reasonably priced, in close proximity to the strip and the resort staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “I had a good experience”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandOH_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights on business in October. I was pleased enough to write this review. Before doing so, I read some of the others and I will point you to one in particular for some add'l details. “Summer (Bay) of our (somewhat) Discontent...” on June 6. I did not experience the hiccups that reviewer did i.e. 1. the construction was done and not an issue. 2. There was no issue with the a/c, although it was a 1 bedroom unit and not summer. 3. the internet access worked seamlessly each time I needed it. The rest of the review pretty much reflects my experience also. Take away points are great location, very affordable (compared to what I checked on the strip), much more "elbow" room than a standard hotel room or suite. If you don't require 5 star resort, consider staying here. I will stay here again for both business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas trip with the family”
Reviews.Author: AllenMRegina
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 days at the Desert club, Oct 7 to 14. This was a family trip for our kids who are finally over 21. This trip included our kids (5) our vacation friends (2) and the father in law. we rented two, two bedroom units that were across the hall from each other. my wife and I have stayed here before and we are fans of the desert club and we are now BIG fans as this was our first big group trip and it worked perfectly. the desert club handled all of our request quickly and to our satisfaction. for those who do not want to walk there were plenty of free shuttles on the property and to the strip. The new check in building is finally complete that includes a small bar and grill. the only downside is the new grocery store is way too small and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: lnd4fun
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas for are annual Jimmy Buffett Weekend. We could not of found a better place to stay and the location was great right behing the Flamingo and Margaritaville. When we arrived the check-in was fast the and the clerk was very friendly and helpful, our room was clean and very comfortable. The pool area was so nice and we loved the food at the Bar and Grill. The shuttle to the strip runs every hour on the the hour, but the strip is only about a 200 yard walk for the resort. This will be our first choose from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Magic32_11
Reviews.Content: We recently completed a 5 night stay at The Desert Club Resort. Having previously stayed at The Ballagio and Treasure Island we were unsure until our arrival of the quality of "off strip" properties. Check In was easy, grounds were clean and neatly kept. The Unit itself was perfect for a party of 4, 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, balcony, full kitchen, living and dining area. Flat screen tv's in all areas, granite counters, full baths. Although the unit common area's were smallish, they were adequate, particularly compared to hotel units along the strip. Shuttle bus ran regularly to the strip although the walk was less than 10 minutes to the back door of the Flamingo, Westin or Harrah's. The areas along the way to the strip were level fenced areas, there were no homeless or "dangers" as suggested in some reviews. Pool area's were neat, clean and easy to find a chair, towels provided. BBQ areas were great with grills always found in spotless condition. We plan to stay here for all our Vegas visits in the future, great resort, quiet, close location.

Reviews.Title: “The best place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sas1976
Reviews.Content: We ended our vaction here in Vegas and we miss it a lot!!! It was the best place ever!!! From the moment we checked inn till the check out, everything was good organised. We stayed in a 1 bedroom appartement and had housekeeping everyday... The pools were very good maintained with pooltowels as much as you liked!!! If you wanted to do a BBQ, there were BBQ at the property. We would highly recommend this to everyone and when we come back to Vegas this will be our first choice!!! Thanks for the pleasant stay... Serge en Saskia Segers from Belgium P.S. we were also at desert rose resort which was also good because it had free breakfast but even that could not convince us ... desert club resort is super!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch property!! Tireless attention to detail; stayed 9/24-9/30”
Reviews.Author: ttime2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of spending six nights at this Time Share, with another couple (it was their RCI swap). We arrived prior to the others, but this was not an issue b/c of a prior arrangement and notes were made within the reservation. We arrived at about 10:30 am and checked at the desk, without the intention of getting a room, but just checking our bags b/c it was so early..Our front desk representative, Noel, said let me just do some checking to see what I can find. To our surprise she had a 2 bdrm suite available and checked us in right away. All the service personnel that we encountered during our stay couldn't have been friendlier, or more helpful, from the front desk (one exception) to the bellmen to the hard working laborers keeping everything spotless. I know there is still a small bit of renovation left, but the buildings, the 5 pools, and the grounds are all imacculate. Joe's Gold Mine Grill had recently (9 days ago) opened. This is a nice addition but still working out the kinks. The last full day we were there your Grab N Go opened...this should be a great addition, as well as convenience to your guests The many shuttles you provide to and from the strip (3 drop off points) virtually connect your guests to the strip without having to walk... I haven't said much about the suites themselves, but they are everything you would expect them to be, nicely updated, well appointed, and very comfortable. From the sofa and chairs to the king size beds in each room...not to mention the large flatscreen TV's. Suffice it to say, everything is top notch and if by some chance you encounter something that might not be, they are continually striving to correct it...We will look at this property again for a return trip sometime in the near future !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab place to stay”
Reviews.Author: EileenWonder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 10 nights. We had an older apartment but it was fine, very clean with daily housekeeping. The shuttle service is fantastic saved us a fortune in taxis and it was always dead on time. The shuttle drivers were brilliant and a special mention for Tony for rescuing us from Downtown and his good nature. Our apartment was right at the pool and this was great as we could make up our drinks and take them to the pool. The Kitchen was fully equipped and it was great being able to make coffee in the morning. Walking distance to the strip wasn't too bad. We walked to the fashion show mall in about 20 mins. My only complaint was that there are a lot of senior citizens at the resort and even though we are no spring chickens would have like more people in my age range. The convenience store an the grill had just opened and were very handy. Would I stay here again absolutely and would recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent well equiped apartment”
Reviews.Author: suziuno
Reviews.Content: Myself, my Husband, and our Daughter and her partner were looking for a good priced place to stay on a saturday night on our way back from the Grand Canyon. The reviews on TA appeared good, and the price was certainly very reasonable compared to other properties. We stayed in a two bed apartment for one night during late sept, and wished we were staying longer. We were all very impressed with the well equiped spacious apartment.There was a huge double sized bathtub in one of the rooms, and the beds were very comfy. The pool area was supplied with ample loungers and shades. The apartments are located only a short walk from the main strip, however a shuttle bus is available if needed. We would highly reccomend the Desert Club Resort for a stay in LV,

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: PattyBowcut
Reviews.Content: This was a family vacation, parents, one child, and grandparents. Our suite was clean and had everything you could want for a good family outing. We were only there for one night, so didn't get to use all the wonderful amenities offered. We did take the shuttle to the strip and when we got back, the employees were there at the front gate to offer us a ride to our room in a golf cart. The pool was lovely and the hot tub was nice after being in the pool, and towels were provided so you didn't need to take any from your room to the pool. We are planning a family reunion next fall and will stay at the Desert Club for sure! It will be nice to stay a few more days, so we can enjoy it more.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, inexpensive, close to Strip”
Reviews.Author: JWMichael
Reviews.Content: My convention hotel sold out so I stayed here 3 days and had a spartan condo for half the price of the Mirage. My room was quiet, clean, and more than adequately furnished for a short stay. The security gate was manned 24/7. Full kitchen and HDTVs with DVD players were a nice touch. Staff were very friendly but this is clearly a work in progress that is nearing completion. Housekeeping was inconsistent: none the first nigh: left wet, left dirty rags in the bathroom the second night: finally got dishwasher soap the 3rd night; never did get coffee packets. I didn't bother complaining because I was only spending a few hours sleeping there, but I'm sure they would have sent someone to make it right. It may be a block from the strip as the crow flies but it actually took me about 5 blocks walk to get into the Mirage, through loading docks past stinky dumpsters, although you can stick to regular streets if you're willing to walk further. The noise of other guests showering awakened me a few times each night, usually 11PM-1AM and then again 5AM-7AM. I think this is because the "wet wall" for the shower is one wall of the bedroom: an odd design choice. In the future, I'll ask for a third floor [top level] room so at most I'll hear the folks below. Overall, the newly named Desert Club Resort served the purpose and saved a substantial amount of money over the Strip. Avoiding the stale smoke from the casinos was an added bonus! I would definitely consider staying here on my next Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “USA & Canada tour”
Reviews.Author: lizziemartie
Reviews.Content: Great condos - got everything you need & more - ample space - many pools to choose from - loads of activities & just one block back from the strip. Vegas was hilarious - great fun - yes tacky, yes commercialised but the strip is immaculate & a scream - the casinos are vast & entertaining - loads for the whole family - not just gambling - stayed here 5 nights as a central base - went to Hoover Dam from here & Death Valley passing Area 51 - Death Valley was 118 degrees at Badwater Basin - keep this in mind if you go in July - fantastic to see & rock colours etc - the pools back at Summerbay most welcome on our return. Strongly recommend these condos. Our little boy the free popcorn!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay at Summer Bay”
Reviews.Author: Michelle1167
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Summer Bay Resort in Las Vegas for two years in a row now and love it. We already have it booked for next year. The rooms are spacious and comfortable for a family of 5. The ammenities are also wonderful, from several pools to organized activities for families. Summer Bay provides free transportation to multiple locations on the strip. The kitchen is fully equipped. Washer and dryer are provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families/friends on extended stays”
Reviews.Author: 54broke
Reviews.Content: Was a little hesitant on staying/lodging at a location other than the typical Strip or Dowtown but took a chance. Glad we did. First and foremost, we were really impressed on how close the Desert Club was to the Strip. Just look west from the Desert Club and the Imperial Palace, Bellagio, and the Venetian are pleasant sights to look at (without the grimy cigarette smoke). As a matter of fact, it was easier to access these resorts by driving the back way in rather from Las Vegas Blvd. Check-in was a breeze. Friendly staff greet you at the entrance and guide you through the locations of the FIVE pools within the resort. Each pool has a theme to them and are small enough to keep a watchful eye on your children (if you happen to bring them). Three of the pool locations have propane gas barbeques. You are probably thinking the bbq grills are nasty with burnt on left-over from somebody else's party. You would be wrong (I know because I checked with a fine tooth comb). The grills were extremely clean as well as the utensils they keep below the grills. The depth of the pools are from three to six feet so families with small children will find the pools an enjoyable luxury. The pools are also open 24 hours!!! The main pool (just behind the lobby) also has a small restaurant serving sandwiches, pizza, salads, burgers, and drinks from 7am to 10pm (11pm on the weekends). Good food and reasonable prices too. Now the room...once again we were very pleasantly surprised!!! The Desert Club may have once been (or still is) a timeshare property. Because of the economic downturn, I think the rooms are now rented on a daily basis. The one bedroom suite had a Full Kitchen with all necessary utensils and plates (full size refrigerator too), the living room was cozy with a fireplace and large flat screen TV, a balcony that has a separate room containing the ironing board and washer/dryer (no coins necessary), a european-sized bedroom with a comfortable queen bed and large screen TV, a HUGE bath/shower that could probably fit a family of four comfortably, and a walk-in closet with a wall mounted safe. The living room also contains a DVD player and AM/FM/CD/MP3 player. Planning a trip to Las Vegas for a week or longer and have small children??? The Summer Bay Desert Club Resort is a location you should definitely look in to. Don't think you will find a resort on the strip that contains a full kitchen in their rooms like the Desert Club. You can forego eating out at expensive restaurants by cooking healthy meals for the family right from your room. Save the money for other necessities like gambling to supplement you child(ren)'s college fund(s)!!! Skip walking through other resorts' casinos and coming out smelling like an ashtray. No slot machines or craps tables here. As mentioned earlier, the Desert Club is just east of the Strip but close enough to see all of the large resorts on Las Vegas Boulevard. However, the area is much quieter and gives you the chance to relax (your true reason to visit Las Vegas, right?) I would definitely recommend the Summer Bay Desert Club Resort. I hope to stay at this location again in the future but this time with my children. Hope this helps...

Reviews.Title: “Love Vegas and these apartments!”
Reviews.Author: sjmiller
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Las Vegas and the Desert Club apartments made it even more special! We had a two bedroom apartment in building 6 on the first floor. The lounge area was well equipped with very large flatscreen TV on the wall, above the fireplace that I can never imagine ever being used! Also a DVD player and stereo with iPod dock which was nice to see. Off the lounge was the balcony with the laundry room. Full size washer and dryer which was well appreciated and used. Kitchen area was very well equipped with full size fridge/freezer, microwave oven, hob, dishwasher and coffee machine. The bedrooms were huge, both with king size beds and were super comfortable. Both had walk in closet space which was great. The master bedroom contained the most amazing double bath with a shower and sink area. Also a separate toilet. There was also a second toilet with sink and large walk-in shower. There were a number of pools to choose from and all were excellent with sunbeds available and pool towels. In the smaller pool we used there was a hot tub open all hours which we used later at night when the temperature dropped slightly! The resort has recently gone through major re-modelling and this has worked really well. The new Clubhouse is great and all the staff are very friendly and accommodating. There is still some work to finish with an on site convenience store and snack shop coming soon. While it was only a 15-20 minute walk from the resort to the Strip via Harrah's casino, there was a shuttle bus service available, although not at regular enough intervals for us. If you don't mind a walk to the Strip then this is a great alternative when staying in Vegas. The apartments are clean, well equipped and very spacious. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay, if your expectations are correct.”
Reviews.Author: Carmollin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Summer Bay for one week...by the time we left the sign out front had been changed to Las Vegas Desert Club, which really confused the cabbies! Here's the thing about Summer Bay/Las Vegas Desert Club, they're almost done renovating the main areas. By the time we got there the new lobby and pool were done and they are very nice. Two days before we left the little quick-serve convenience food "restaurant" by the main pool opened, it's a nice addition. We never saw the little store open, but I bet it will also be a nice addition. The club's grounds are well maintained and the staff is nice. If you're working at the Sands convention center, you can easily walk to it from this club. If you're strictly there to gamble, there's a regular shuttle schedule. If not the staff is always there to call a cab. Here's the part you need to be ready for, if you rent from the site - the "rental rooms", are NOT renovated. Mind you, they're not horrible, but not luxury by any means. See my pictures. And for the price you pay to be so close to the strip, can you really complain? If you think you might luck into one of the nice owner's units with the flat screen TVs and granite countertops, you won't, so get your expectations straight. We had to be moved from the first one they put us in because it smelled so bad. The second one was much better, clean, but really worn out. If you want a nicer unit, find an owner who is renting and get it from them, if you don't mind what you see in my pictures, go ahead and rent from their website. It's a lot easier and honestly, once we got used to the idea that we weren't getting the upgraded units we saw online, we were fine with ours.

Reviews.Title: “Reunion Trip with old friends”
Reviews.Author: 5_Star_Linda
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to the strip via the Imperial Palace seemed very close. We stayed in a one bedroom suite on the second floor. Beds are super comfortable. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful, including shuttle bus drivers. Maintenance issues were resolved within minutes. Very good place to stay. The construction is complete, the store and snack bar were opening as we left. The in-room internet worked 95% of the time. There is a safe in the room. Ellis Island nearby for breakfast was great. Can't beat the price 4.99 for steak and eggs. Dinner -- ask for steak special. It isn't on the menu but 7.99 for a great meal including a beer. The BBQ outside Ellis was delicious. The gas stations nearby sell beer/wine. The VONS shuttle was great, they also had shuttle to Freemont St. for the evening. Take advantage, it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent off-Strip option for stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Oleksandr_Svyryd
Reviews.Content: We did not look for a typical Strip style of stay in Vegas. What we needed is a comfortable place to survive after really long flight and drive to Vegas. This hotel actually made it. We were given (as a free upgrade!) the apartment 201 in the 8th house. The apartment is nothing less but great: a studio with the kitchen and a fireplace; a huge bath, and a very nice bedroom with the main thing - a comfy bed. Did not use the pools/jakuzzi in the hotel because we had no time, but these options are a plus. What you have to keep in mind: it's a 10-15 mins walk from the Strip. You can use taxi, free shuttles or walk (as we actually did). Also, it seems not to have own meal options/restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A Different Way of Doing Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: robitude
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an extended business trip in mid-August after getting a room through Hotwire. The stay got off to a very bumpy start when I found out that (a) the wireless internet, which I desperately needed for my trip, was supposedly not working, and (b) the destinations on the shuttle schedule posted on Summer Bay's website had changed and shuttle frequency had been cut in half. But as it turned out, the wireless internet worked fine for my entire stay, even though I was told at the front desk that I probably wouldn't be able to access it and that I should use the wireless at the Westin a couple blocks away. The changes to the shuttle schedule (which still haven't been reflected in the schedule shown on the resort's website as of this writing) were still a pain--I hadn't rented a car because I thought I could rely on the shuttle to take me right to my conference hotel--but I did alright with some cabs and a few scorching one-block walks. I got over my frustration with the front desk very quickly once I saw the room itself. I got one of the "rental units," which are not as nice as the timeshare "owner's units," though I believe they have the same floorplan. They certainly have the same gigantic bathtubs, a nice and surprising amenity. The room was a bit worn (as I understood the rental units to be), but it was clean, and you can't argue with the room's size or amenities.
