A room like this would go for hundreds of dollars if it were one block to the west. A good size bed, full kitchen, patio, two TVs, DVD player, walk-in closet, etc. I bought groceries before I came (though they have a weekend shuttle to another grocery store) and saved a ton by using the room's kitchen. I even did laundry with the washer and dryer connected to my room through the patio. In a city where you can hardly take a breath without paying a fee, the amenities in my room felt like a secret weapon. Construction appears to be finished here. The pool at the front of the resort had just opened, and though it's not Mandalay Bay, it's a nice feature to have. It's also one of five pools at the resort, so you never have to go far to take a dip. The small grocery store next to the pool was complete but not yet open when I stayed there. Though I didn't use the shuttles as I had intended, I still took advantage of them when coming back to the resort at night. I don't think I would recommend staying here for business if you need to get work done during your stay. Others had expressed that the WiFi is spotty, though I didn't have this problem. The resort's business center is small -- it's made up of two computers and an older printer that's functional but not suitable for high-quality printing (I went to a Kinko's that's not too far from the resort). But for the other 95% of people going to Las Vegas, this is a very solid place to stay. The resort is a terrific budget option for couples or families that would like to be near the Strip but not right on it. You can be pretty self-sufficient here, a rarity in this town. Even though it's a block away from the Strip, the resort was an oasis of quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: BudgetGirl101
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 8 day vacation in Vegas. Yes 8 days! We stayed at the Summer Bay / Desert Club Resort and it was awesome! Since we were staying a long time we wanted to have a place that was a little off the strip and was more relaxing than anything. We stayed the first two nights in a 2 bedroom first floor condo that was very nice. We then had more guests coming so we moved to a one bedroom (that had been remodled and was a great price) first floor. This was basically the same just smaller but the one plus was that there was a HUGE 2 person soaking tub in the bathroom. No jets but Super nice and was very relaxing. We then moved back into the 2 bedroom to finish off the vaca. The pools are nice because they never were really crowded and we used the BBQs 2 times. We had a car but took taxis from the strip and it cost about $6. I would recommend this to people that are looking for a Relaxing quiet place to stay that is close but not on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good but a few staffing problems”
Reviews.Author: RichardHawkins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from August 20th - 1st September. I booked this months ago through Touchdown Interline agents as I work for an airline. We arrived a day late as our flight was full so we had to come via LAX the next day. By the time we drove there after a slight detour to Hollywood to see the sign, it was around 19:30 and we were tired as we had been up at 6am UK time and it was now 03:30am the next day in UK. We just wanted to get in and sleep. Unfortunately reception was manned by what appeared to be 3 trainees and a couple of regular staff. We got the trainee. He seemed to think we had only booked 1 week but we had booked 2. Once he established that it had come through as 2 seperate weeks via RCI he assured us we would not need to change rooms and that the booking was continuous. He asked us if we prefered ground or top floor. We asked for a quiet room on the top floor. We ended in 8-306 which although it had a view of the car park vs the pool was quiet The appartment was fully equiped with most things you would need. However the only thing you get for the oven, is a cookie tray. I would advise anyone who normally uses an oven for things like oven chips, potato wedges, chicken kiev to bring a high sided metal tray with them as there is nothing suitable for cooking in the oven. Otherwise fat spills onto the oven base which then burns and fills the whole room with smoke Also bring a decent scouring pad. The pans are alluminium and if you try and brown any meat in them it sticks to the pan. They provide a flimsy plastic scouring pad that wont get any stains off. There were plenty of sunbeds but none of them have shade. However there are two or three tables per pool with 4 chairs and they have a shade. The pool never got so busy we could not find a bed. We did get the odd rowdy lot who decided to bring their own massive speaker and laptop to entertain us all with music in the 2nd week. We swithced pools (as there are 5) The pool areas very kept clean and there were plenty of towels. The pool by the clubhouse is missing quite a few tiles, but perhaps they are waiting for low season to drain the pool and repair it. Our daughter used the kids club for a couple of days and really enjoyed it, making a few projects like a piggy bank and oven mit. Apparantly Lauren & Eddie were fab !!! There was a free shuttle to Von's but they have a wierd rule they don't tell you about on their website that only two people per room can go due to space. There was no way we were leaving our young daughter alone, so luckily we got permission to have 3 people that day,although it was a battle as the concierge girl did not want to know and we had to get the bell boy to sort it (which he did via radio) When we got the bus there were too many people and the driver had to ask people to get off. One lady said she had been trying to get on for 3 days as it was full. Can't comment on that, but you would think they could run a couple of busses if it gets that busy. We were not too impressed by the driver. He was young, dark hair and I think he thought he was cool blasting out the radio and having a party. On the way back he made a great show of fanning out $1 & $5 bills in the ashtray. He then pumped up the music and set off. A few yards into the journey there was shouting from the back, we could not here due to the loud music, but after more yelling it turned out the back door was open. He had to stop the bus in the middle of the road, get out and go and close it. The drivers dropped you outside your block and we tipped him. The hotel also does shuttles to New York, Ballys, Venetian and the Freemont Experience. We only used the New York & Venetian. But we had the same guy a couple more times. Now not everyone tips and plenty of people got off without tipping. We did not tip him after one trip and he seemed a bit sarcastic as we got off the bus. Again we had the disco, this time early evening back from New York. Luckliy he seemed to work days, and in the second week we started going out in the evenings so we did not come accross him again. The other drivers did not seem so "tip orientated". They were all polite and helpful, but did not seem upset if you did not tip them. They seemed to be content with the fact they had a job and were earning a wage. We did tip but not every single journey as usually you got the same guy on the return leg anyway. Our favourite was Tony. He was really friendly and very informative about Las Vegas and the sights. We did not get the room service. Having arrived a day late the room was then cleaned the day after our arrival (which would have been our 3rd day). On the 8th day were were woken by a knock at the door. The chambermaid was enquiring why we were not out of the room. We explained we still had a week to go, Not content with this answer she came back later trying to evict us. I went to reception and explained she wanted us out. The booking was still in two seperate weeks, hence the chambermaid wanting us out. We were well into our 2nd week and the sheets had not been changed + the room had not been serviced since day 3. I asked reception if a service was due and was told tomorrow. The maid did come but did not change the sheets. I again rang reception and asked if normally they changed the sheets in the 2nd week and was told yes. So they had to get the maid back. I can only assume she still thought it was our first week. I did not find the bed as comfortable as a unit we had in Florida. The matress protector was attached to the bed on each corner by elastic and it kept coming loose and all the sheets would then ruck up. To be honest we sheet seemed to small. Normally there is plenty to tuck in top and sides but you either had lots at the side and none at the top or visa versa due to the shape of the sheet. The room bedroom itself was large enough and had enough drawers + a walk in wardrobe. The main room again was adequate in size. The property seemed very well maintained, staff would say hello as they came across you. Each pool had a bbq area with two gas bbq's. We made good use of these due to the nice weather (we are now back in UK - And yes it is raining again). Again the staff seemed to clean these, if not every day, then every couple. Overall it was a pleasant stay, just a pity about the mix up over the room and disco guy

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate”
Reviews.Author: lilorchid82
Reviews.Content: My mother in law had booked this resort through her timeshare. I come to find out that it has recently been bought by the Orange Lake Resort and by Spring of next year, it will be part of Holiday Inn Club Vacations. Excellent for me since I bought into that timeshare and this will make it easier for me to book. Even better that after of week of being here, I really like it. Other reviewers have done an excellent job mentioning all the amenities and updated features. I'd like to add that a maid service does come by on Tues.; in a lot of other resorts, you pay for this. WiFi has recently been installed in the buildings, and it is one of the strongest connections I've experienced in all of my travels. i stream hulu as well as if I were at home. Congrats to the resort of getting this difficult point right. We got a two bedroom unit facing the parking lot. I like it this way since it means that it's more quiet. I don't know how much the unit lets out for, but there was a significant number of young (early 20s) ppl. I'm not old myself but am just used to resorts where my husband and I are one of the few young couples. At one point the unit downstairs had a party going on, but they got quiet before it got too late. People have mentioned security...yes, it is lax. This made my MIL uncomfortable, but I figure it's not a big deal. The resort is a 10-15 walk to the Strip. I don't mind walking, b/c I don't glam up for the casinos like most of the ladies I see. So it's easy for me to walk in flip flops and sneakers. If you do like to strut, then I recommend the shuttle. It does not have the most frequent schedule though, so you might have to consider a taxi. We rented a car, b/c Vegas is a lot more than the Strip. I'm very happy with the resort. The only reason it does not get 5 stars is b/c the location. I don't mind, but a 5 star should have excellent location, too.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Bay Resort LasVegas”
Reviews.Author: phylee3
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this time share condo resort. Staff very friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Really, REALLY nice!”
Reviews.Author: jesantinez
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights over Labor Day weekend. The Resort is a VERY short drive from the Strip - close enough to be convenient, far enough away to be peaceful. Our rooms were clean, well stocked (extras of everything, towels, blankets, etc). The only problem we experienced was with the shuttle driver who picked up guests for a scheduled late night pick-up at Bally's. After allowing WAY too many people onto the shuttle, once we were all seated and ready to go, the driver announced that only 20 could fit and that about 5 people would have to get off the shuttle, this separated our group (we volunteered) and when one of our party stepped off the shuttle, telling the driver clearly, "I'll be right back, I've got to get the room key from my friend.", the driver promptly closed the door behind him and drove away. We were shocked! Once we arrived at the hotel, the last group on the shuttle told the driver they thought it was the shuttle to Rio. (something he should have ascertained BEFORE driving away.) Last I saw, the ladies from Rio were walking through the parking lot to get back to Bally's because the driver kicked them off! Otherwise, this was an amazing place, friendly staff (except for Joel the bus driver), beautiful pools and facility! LOVED IT! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value”
Reviews.Author: johnnyredster
Reviews.Content: We are in the middle of a 3 week road trip across California and headed over to Vegas for a 3 night stay. We booked the summer bay resort based on reviews and a tight budget. Having paid $136 for the 3 nights I wasn't expecting much, but I have to say I was amazed at the apartment we had. Fully fitted kitchen area, king bed, bath you could drown a horse in, and full ac. The pool area was great in the 110 deg c heat. With clean towels for guests. Probably about a 20 min walk to strip through the Imperial palace, which is fine in the day, but you have to walk through a bit of wasteland , which was a bit unwise with our kids after dark ( even though we didn't encounter any problems). However the hotel runs a free shuttle to various points on the strip which was fab. To summarise Caesars palace it ain't, but for the money you'll have to go a long way to neat it. Recommend it to anyone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Family Vacation; Highly recommend it; Recently Upgraded”
Reviews.Author: 4realguy
Reviews.Content: This place is a real home away from home. We came to Vegas for our family vaction and truly enjoyed our accomodations. I have a 6 yr old son and 10 year old daughter. My mother in law joined us on this trip. The one midweek cleaning went pretty well and the staff was great in every aspect. This place will only get better as the main pool finally partially opened during our stay. It is really beautiful and when the clubhouse opens it will be even better. Yes, this is an older resort but the upkeep is tremendous. I was in an owner suite because of RCI exchange, but I hear that the rentals are nice as well. My suite looked just like the nice one on the website photos. I got a handicap suite to get in sooner and didn't really have use for the enormous tub that comes in the regular ones. Besides, it put me on the first floor and the master shower was really nice with the removable shower head. The hall bath had a rain shower. The living room had 55 inch flat panel tv while the bedrooms had 42 inch flat sacreens on the walls. We rented a car and visited the Grand Canyon, Lake Mead, and Hoover Dam as well as other hotels and Freemont street. We also took advantage of the complimentary shuttle a few times. The shuttle works perfect. The activities for the kids were great and the activty staff was great. One morning they were outside cleaning our windows; I was impressed. The property was kept very clean and the workers were doing a great job. We used three of the pools and they were all pretty decent. They were open 24hrs but we used them during the day and late evenings, and they were kept clean and organized. I did use the barbecue grill one time and it went okay. Hawaiian Night was a great show of Hula dancers and fire eaters Tuesday evening and the mid-day pool party on Thursday was alot of fun. The bed in the master bedroom sunk in pretty bad on one side and we let the staff know at check out. Sleeping was not unbearable and hopefully they will fix that issue. The only other issue was the phone was not working. I used our cell phones so it wasn't a problem. If they charge to make local calls I would not use it anyway. The internet was not working because of the phones, but when I called the front desk I was given the access to the internet via staff access so I commend the staff member for that. This place is located a long block behind Harrahs and the Flamingo. You could walk it within 15 minutes, but if you moniter the shuttle times you can get further down the strip and faster to one of the stops (Venetian, Bally's, or New York New York). Go to Downtown Las Vegas to Fremont Experience to truly enjoy your visit. The shuttle goes there. Also , it goes to the grocery store. We drove to Walmart for groceries and it helped with food expenses. I could go on and on about this place away from home, but what you should know is that they are on the way to greatness and I would not hesitate to come back. Thank You Summer Bay Resorts Las Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “The best accommodations I've had in Vegas for the $”
Reviews.Author: davidkath
Reviews.Content: I've visited Las Vegas numerous times and usually stayed in the Bellagio for $300+ a night. This visit was with my whole family of 5 and I was able to stay in a 2 bedroom suite with 2 baths, kitchen and laundy room for about a third of that. Yes, you're not on the strip, but you're only a block or so back from it. Plus, they have a very accommodating shuttle fleet that takes you to several places on the strip as well as picks you up until around midnight. I only had 2 complaints; their wireless internet is not working and their cleaning staff threw away my daughter's retainers when cleaning the room. That will run the cost up to the Bellagio range.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay but Will Be Better in a Couple of Years”
Reviews.Author: PSS_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Summer Bay for an exchanged timeshare. We had stayed there two years ago. The two bedroom units were well equipped and the laundry this time was next to the kitchen instead of being outside on the balcony area. There were flat screen televisions, a nice walk in closet, and a large tub. The main pool was not open the entire week, which was over 107 degrees most of the week but a few others were. We didn't visit the others for they were spread out around the complex. There was construction two years and ago, and I guess it will finally be done in two years with an activity center at the pool and other services. The security staff was available round the clock, especially at the entrance. There is a shuttle but it wasn't close to our building so we were glad we had rented a car. All in all, the staff was helpful, the unit was clean and comfortable, and there are activities for children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite and Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: SeaKayaker53
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently spent 5 nights at Summer Bay and totally enjoyed our stay. It's within easy walking distance of the strip and a free shuttle service is also available. The suite was modern, spacious, well equipped and very quiet. The beds were very, very comfortable which allowed us to be well rested for the busy days we spent in the area. Will definitely return to Summer Bay if we visit Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy 2 bedroom suite near the strip”
Reviews.Author: kelsm808
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew straight to vegas from Mexico and stayed at the summer bay resort with 2 other friends. The 2 bedroom suite was very large with a kitchen, washer & dryer, flat screen tvs and many different pools. I loved the huge tub in the master bedroom =) The only problem we came across on this trip was that all the soda machines that we went to were either broken or not accepting coins, it was very hot so we needed to drive to a corner store to buy water. Other from that the hotel was a very nice place to stay and we will definitely be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for a family”
Reviews.Author: G H
Reviews.Content: Our 2-room suite was spacious and clean. The beds were comforable, but the sofa bed was not. There was plenty of parking. We were so busy that we could not take advantage of the offered activities. I asked several questions by e-mail, and the responses were very prompt. Most of the information was accurate, except that I could not find out what types of filters the coffee makers used until I arrived (fyi -- they use basket filters, not cone filters). I would definitely consider staying here again, so long as I intend to rent a car. The walk to the strip is a bit too far.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: occasional_traveler2
Reviews.Content: My family (2 teens and an 11yr old) stayed at Summer Bay LV for a week recently. We stayed in a 2-BR owner suite. The room is very spacious with all the amenities you ever needed just like your own home. We all felt very comfortable and never felt crowded as we all had our own "space" so to speak. It is not very far from the strip but in the summer heat I would not recommend walking to the strip. The complimentary shuttle service is very convenient. We used that a couple times but drove our own car mostly. The property will be even better when the club house and a bigger pool are completed. The staff seems friendly and ready to answer questions. If you want a comfortable and quiet place to rest up, don't hesitate to stay at Summer Bay. Wee

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, perfect for what we needed, will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: livindownunder
Reviews.Content: We booked about 20 rooms for a week in the Summer Bay Resorts for our teams and parents attending a basketball tournament in Las Vegas. The accommodations here were perfect for what we needed, kitchenettes and laundry facilities, barbeque grills, multiple pools open 24 hours, gathering areas, shuttles and walking distance to the strip. We walked to the strip in the evening without a problem, many of the kids and families took the free shuttle offered to the strip and shopping areas. The staff was very helpful and accommodating to all, even the mulitiple kids and teenagers we had with us. Our rooms were the older style and nobody from our group had a complaint, they were clean, tidy and well cared for. I had many compliments from all members of our party regarding what a great facility it was and perfect for what we needed. We will definitely be back here for next years tournament!

Reviews.Title: “"A great place to stay."”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Summer Bay for a week in July. We really enjoyed everything about the resort. We had a great room that was comfortable for all of us. We were traveling with our two kids (ages 14 and 10) so being away from the strip was excellent for us. Our kids enjoyed the pool. The shuttle service was excellent. We used it daily and did not have to rent a car at all. Thanks for an excellent week Summer Bay!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: CliveP-T
Reviews.Content: The apartments are great and spacious. Service is good, and when the construction work is complete, it will be a superb place to spend a week. Regular shuttles to various parts of the strip and also for supermarket shopping and down town, are a great convenient service. nice pools...great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Two different worlds: Summer Bay Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HoopMom50
Reviews.Content: ~~Our family of 4 wrapped up our vacation in Vegas at Summer Bay. We are RCI time share owners, but did NOT make this reservation through our timeshare company. We only needed a few nights, so we went on-line and used "Book-it". ~~While all the units have the same floor plan, there are two vastly DIFFERENT levels of accomodation at Summer Bay. If you rent online (ie: Expedia, Orbitz, Book-It, etc.) - expect an older, dated unit. If you are okay with a trip back to the 80's and a hodge podge of well worn furnishings & decorating styles, their rental units will meet your needs. They have @ 150 rental units. (There are over 500 units on this property) ~~Don't be fooled by the lovely photos the resort posts on-line! When we asked the front desk, they explained that they have TIME-SHARE units and RENTAL units. They explained that on-line booking sites do not guarantee what the rooms will look like. The only way to get one of those updated timeshare units is to pay $50 more per night. ~~ One of the biggest drawbacks was the constant hum of the outdoor air conditioning units. Since the property was initially condos/apartments, each unit has a separate air conditioner. From our unit, with all the AC always running, there was never really any sense of quiet. Made me wish I was in a high rise to avoid the noise! ~~ While not far from "the strip" - we were advised by the staff not to walk from the resort to the strip at night. Seems an area they call the "desert" (currently undeveloped land between the resort & the strip) is known for homeless folks sleeping there at night. ~~ The fitness center was quite small - eary in the morning folks lined up for machines. There were no free weights. ~~AGAIN----- BEWARE of the two different worlds of Summer Bay. If you are a time share trade-in, seems you are okay. If you rent using on-line search engines, lower your expectations. It probably will NOT look like the pictures on the website!

Reviews.Title: “Resort excellent, design of some condos, not good”
Reviews.Author: Lady1216
Reviews.Content: Best things about resort: The condo furnishing was very nice and the decor was outstanding. The resort is somewhat close to the strip and it is in walking distance. The shuttles were very convenient and the staff very accommodating. The staff that rode around in golf carts always offered you a ride if you were walking. Best attractions or restaurants nearby: I always go to the George Wallace show, which is outstanding and we rented a car and went to LA for the day. That was somewhat tiring, but I truly enjoyed myself. We've been coming to Summer Bay for the last few years, but this is the 1st time we were very unhappy with the condo we had. The condo itself was beautiful, the decor and furnishing were excellent. The problem we had was the design. The shower and sink were in the bedroom, but it did not have an enclosure (19-201), therefore if one of us wanted to sleep in you could not do it if the other one wanted to take a shower or perform normal hygiene. This was unbelievable! I just think what if you had children running around and you wanted to take a shower/bath, where would you disrobe? You would have to put the kids in a completely different room and hope they did not come back in the bedroom while you were undress, getting out the shower/bath, drying off, etc. I don’t know who design the room, but it’s horrible. We arrived in the evening therefore by the time we reached the room, we did not have the energy to go all the way back to the welcome center to change rooms. At least when I go again I know what type of room I do not want. This is the one thing that ruined our vacation, but we dealt with it. The mini golf course is a joke - six holes and right next to the pool. All the land the resort has they can build a better mini golf course. One other thing: we rented a car through the concierge but the concierge should provide more information without you trying to pull it from her. The concierge took our information then told us a shuttle from the rental car place would pick us up to get the car. That was it. So I ask her if there was a deposit, she said yes. I then had to ask her how much, she said if you use a debit card it would be about $350. So I said OK. If I did not ask she would not have given me that information. What she didn’t tell us was if you use a debit card the car rental place would also pull a credit report. We did not know this until we got there. It was OK, but what if it wasn’t? The concierge should be required to give out this vital information. I really enjoyed the gym, sauna, hot tub and the dance performance they had one evening. I’ll be glad when all the construction is completed so we can get something to eat on the grounds without going elsewhere. I rated my experience as a 4, but my complaints above stopped me from rating it a 5. I’ve been here previously so I know things are not always the same. If this was my 1st time coming to the resort I might have rated it differently

Reviews.Title: “Recent Improvements”
Reviews.Author: Floridagator
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times while on trips to Las Vegas. The spread out nature of this resort makes it easy to get outside a little, which is nice compared to the bottled up feeling you get in the big casinos. New clubhouse makes this an affordable and close to the stip alternative to the big casino hotels.

Reviews.Title: “room was the only good thing”
Reviews.Author: hockeybandit
Reviews.Content: Wasn't a block away from the strip. Either you took your car or the shuttle. Construction was done for the parking lot, so you had to follow all the signs to be able to park. There was no no real check-in office or check out. no real conceige office. They were building a restaurant a gift shop and and an office. The main pool was closed. No life guard on duty. A bunch of people were at the pool with drinks and cursing.Thank Gd I didn't have any children with me. The main pool could have been kept open.

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion = Success”
Reviews.Author: ILUVTULIPS
Reviews.Content: We had our family Reunion here and we couldn't have picked a better place, every room had a kitchen equipped with dishwasher also there was a washing machine as well. I liked the fact that we could use any of the pools and that they had activities set up daily for adults as well as children. A nice bonus was that there was a bus to take to the strip which was convenient. Be aware that some rooms have not been upgraded as is seen on the sight, make sure that you ask for a new room.

Reviews.Title: “The Bomb”
Reviews.Author: ChefRameses
Reviews.Content: The pictures posted on this resort are very deceiving. We stayed in a two bedroom and completely reminded me of a section 8 apartment. The sofa was torn, the kitchen counters burnt, the rug very stained and dirty looking, etc, etc, etc...The pools are open 24/7, you would think that they would have a person to keep the pools looking clean! nope, all pools were cloudy. The only good thing about this place was that it was close to the strip and market. If you don't mind swimming in murky waters among everything else mentioned, then this over priced, so called resort, is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: SunBlitz42
Reviews.Content: I did some extensive review reading on TripAdvisor before I decided to book our surprise(to my husband) anniversary stay at Summer Bay. I chose it because the reviews were much less scary than the hotels on the strip in our price range. After booking I continued to read more reviews and started to get a little worried, but all of those worries were for nothing. Here's the play by play: We flew in at 7:30am and Check-In time wasn't until 4pm, but we decided to try our luck. After picking up our rental car we arrived at Summer Bay about 8:30am. We had no trouble finding the entrance, or temporary front desk, and barely noticed the construction at the front of the complex. At the front desk, they told us they had a room ready for us, no problem. I tried to hint around, hoping to get an upgrade to an owner suite, mentioned our anniversary, then flat out asked if they were booked up. She said they were full. Oh well, can't blame a gal for trying! We got to our room (Building 3, 207) and loved it from the moment we walked in. Spacious living room and kitchen, nice big king size bed, and huge garden tub. Everything was clean, and, despite a little bit of wear on the couch, very welcoming. This was a One Bedroom rental, so there was just a small two person table in the kitchen, and 'old-style (read:non-flat-screen) TVs. Worked for us, who goes to Vegas to watch TV?!? However, all the remotes were missing batteries, one call to the front desk and that was fixed. I've read complaints on these reviews about not enough towels, and not enough, and too small pillows. There were plenty of each, with extras under the sink and in the closet. Check out my pictures to see the room, and the great view from the balcony. We did visit the concierge, and she was helpful, though we didn't end up going to any shows. We also used the free shuttle, which was great! They pick up at the back of the property, so it was a little walk from where we were, but I think a golf cart went by and offered a ride everytime. The shuttle always picked up and dropped off right on time. And remember it's FREE, so even though we had a rental car, we used the shuttle so we didn't have to worry about parking. The times were very convenient, and the drivers all very pleasant. The grounds are beautiful. We walked around once, and probably didn't see half of it. The pool closest to us was under construction, and we didn't have much time so we didn't swim. The only very, very minor complaint I have is, we didn't get maid service (our choice) so I asked for an extra packet of coffee for our second morning, and they wouldn't give it to me. Like I said, very minor! The free popcorn at the front desk totally made up for it! In conclusion, I don't think we'd stay anywhere else if/when we return, and I've already recommended Summer Bay whenever I hear anyone mention going to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchair? Don't stay there.”
Reviews.Author: luisjcc
Reviews.Content: First af all the ac seems to work only in the livingroom. If you are in a wheelchair the bed is to high to transfer, the chair doesn't fit in the restroom and has no hand rails, can't reach the sick to wash hands and brush teeth, and the tub not good for people in a wheelchair. It has wheelchair accesible parking in front of room but no ramp. Ice machine not working. People there need to check hotels in the area maybe the circus Circus restroom.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 does a better job”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNR
Reviews.Content: I checked in to the hotel and the beds were un-made and dirty towels were on the floor. I requested that houskeeping come and make up the room a total of 5 times and they never showed. At 10:30pm I finally asked to move to another room. This place is very run down, but it does appear that they are trying to correct the many problems. If you want to save some money there are better options. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love Summer Bay”
Reviews.Author: danielaureliano
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Summer Bay because it is affordable the rooms are nice and I really enjoy staying there. Last time we went to Vegas my wife wanted to stay on the strip at a hotel (I wont mention their name) and be on the actual strip. We end up paying more and their rooms were not nearly as nice as the rooms at Summer Bay. My one complaint is usually it takes forever to check in. I have stayed at Summerbay over 10 times and I can only remember one time it being a quick and easy check in. One thing to know if you book a room at Summer Bay do not expect it to be like a hotel and have your room cleaned daily. The rooms are on cleaning schedules. I usually have to call for more towels because it could go three days before your room is cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Great place & staff too. We'd go back in a flash!!”
Reviews.Author: franb51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a Timeshare Exchange. We read other comments before deciding where to stay in Vegas. This property is 3 storied and does NOT have lifts which was a big consideration for us as I have a mobility problem and stairs are a nightmare for me. In addition the hotel is located a bit further away from the Strip than the others that were also available. We chose this one because it sounded niver and indeed it was. I emailed the hotel direct and requested a ground floor room and also asked the same question from our Timeshare group. Needless to say, we didnt get one!!! But, after checking things out they managed to find us one. However, it overlooked a car park which I also wasnt happy about so I requested to move rooms. Eventually, this went ahead but we had to wait till 4pm till all the Check-in/out had gone through. The Check-in process itself was a bit of a nightmare as the power had been off for quite a while and they had to do everything manually. Plus they were still operating out of a couple of the units as the main Reception still hadnt opened and the front of the hotel was still blocked off. In fact, when we arrived, the taxi driver dropped us off out the front and we would've had to walk a very long way to get around the back entrance except that one of the shuttles appeared and picked us up. The unit itself was very nice - very clean, comfy bed, nice kitchen (if you wanted to cook :) They provide a very good shuttle service to various points on the Strip both to drop off and pick up - very convenient. Also a daily service to the local store to get groceries (except Sundays) and the store even gives you a good discount. My only complaint was that there was very little shade around the pools and spas to the point that we didnt use them as it was so hot. They need to consider this and put in more daybeds and umberellas or shade trees. They had popcorn free of charge available in the main building which was a nice touch. As with most Timeshares there were various activities available but nothing that interested us. We went to the Timeshare sales blurb only so we could get the "offer" even though we had no intention of buying any more. They were fine with that and weren't too pushy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, wonderful people!”
Reviews.Author: travellover929
Reviews.Content: The condo was beautiful and comfortable. The only negative thing was that there was no room cleaning everyday. You basically rented the place. But on the plus side every place was clean and great. The shuttle service was great as well. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: cabinchicken
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights in a 1 bdrm deluxe suite at Summer Bay. !st time not staying directly on the strip, so I was a little nervous as what to expect. We loved the place. Shuttle service was excellant, no charge. We were on 1st floor, overlooking the bbq area by the pool. They have 2 new huge grills, and plenty of shaded area to eat. Our unit was very clean, and newly finished. We were only a couple blocks off the strip behind the Flamingo. Very close to everything. One thing I'd like to mention. They do not have elevators, we requested 1st floor. No problem. If you're looking for some quiet after being on the strip, this is the place. Another thing, the shuttle also will take you downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel229
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Vegas and had a great time. The Summer Bay Suites are differently the way to go. The one bedroom suite was everything you needed for a perfect stay, and felt just like a home away from home. When checking in the staff were friendly and asked if we had a preference of buildings and told us ahead of time about the paving going on so that helped with our decision. When walking to move our car to our room we were asked if we needed a ride. Great service and will come back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Property”
Reviews.Author: Maineroadtriper
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6/15 thru 6/22 yeah there is some construction going on, but it didn't effect our stay at all! and we found the staff to be wonderful! We had a Beautiful full size 2 bedroom Condo suite. all the comforts of home, just a block off the strip. flat screen TV's in both bedrooms and the livingroom. fully equiped kitchen. Washer/ Dryer etc. Beautiful Grounds, Pools, BBQ Grills, Hot Tubs, Saunas, etc. when the construction is complete there will be a Deli/ Sandwich shop, a Bar by the main pool, a small grocery store etc. this is a timeshare complex, so if you are looking for daily maid service, room service etc. this may not meet your expectations. if you are looking for a beautiful quiet complex to call home while in Vegas just a 10 min walk from all the action this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Loud construction and indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: EagerOwl
Reviews.Content: I'm staying at the summer bay right now. They started cutting pavement outside our room at 8 am this morning. I called the front desk and was basically told to just deal with it by a woman who couldn't care less. Our pool has been closed for two days. I can understand the need for construction but i didn't expect to be woken up by it and I'm shocked at the lack of compassion from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SUITES AND GROUNDS”
Reviews.Author: Travler84
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas with another couple for a weeks vacation. The suite had 2 bedrooms with king size beds and 2 bathrooms, full kitchen, laundry, three flat screen TV's, etc etc. We also enjoyed lounging by the pool (several smaller pools to chose from) palm trees (felt like a tropical vacation) We liked the location, easily walking to the strip - but great shuttle service also provided. Very much enjoyed our "home base" for this vacation, we also had rental car as were doing alot of sightseeing/shopping in the area-enjoyed not being on the strip all the time. Renovations at front end did not bother us..will stay here again in the future - quiet and great security.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find, close to the strip & clean.”
Reviews.Author: tctrippy
Reviews.Content: This location was undergoing a lot of construction this spring 2011, but we were placed far from the noise. The one bedroom was nice, but a tad small, but fine for two people. We were pleasantly surprised and enjoyed our time there. The rooms were clean and comfortable. FYI, the pool areas are small & fill up quickly. Also the gym was very, very basic and lacked free weights and other things normally found in a hotel gym

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE, EXCELLENT PRICE!!”
Reviews.Author: lydarryl
Reviews.Content: This place was great, tons of space, 2 bedrooms, full kitchen, laundry! perfect place for a family trip or to stay with a few couples, you can save $ on food by making your own meals in their fully stocked kitchen, you can pack less (save on those pesky luggage airline fees!) because you can wash your clothes, they even provide detergent and it's all conveniently in your suite. these suites were perfect, HUGE awesome bathtub in the master 2. choice of I think 4 pools and on site entertainment as well. just a short walk or shuttle ride to the strip, 2 blocks away and the price was amazing for a vegas hotel on a weekend!!! I would recommend this place to everyone. when we were there they were doing some construction to enhance it, so some of it was tore up and the pool closest to us was closed for remodeling, but I can't wait to go back when it's done and even nicer :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: AZinEurope2009
Reviews.Content: We visited over Memorial Day weekend and there was a lot of construction going on (with the main entrance was closed so we had to follow a detour). The construction was a bit of inconvenience, but not a big deal - the staff did a great job at directing guests to the temporary check-in area. They also handled the big holiday weekend rush of many guests arriving at the same time very well. The property itself was very nice and relaxing - it was nice to feel safer and away from all of the craziness on the strip. There is free covered parking, which was great for a hot summer day. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. Appearance-wise, there were a few blemishes inside (a rip in the arm of the couch and a wall hanging that was resting on the floor below instead), but to us this wasn't a big deal. The phones in one of the bedrooms (we had a 2-bedroom suite) didn't work, but the others were fine. In a nutshell, the property had a few minor flaws/inconveniences, but we got a fantastic rate and great value. We were only there for one night before continuing our road trip, so we were pleased with our stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rlogan41
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about some of the reviews I had read but found this to be a nice place. We had a one bedroom unit which was clean with a comfortable bed. Had no problem with the fact that the main entrance was closed. Found the alternate easily. Check-in took 5 minutes or less. Having owned time shares and stayed in many, this was as good as any and much better than some. Will stay here next time

Reviews.Title: “Summer (Bay) of our (somewhat) Discontent...”
Reviews.Author: Tha_Duke
Reviews.Content: We arrived June 1 for our four-day trip to Las Vegas. Since we were five people in a family, we wanted the home-like environment of a timeshare/family suite-style lodging. From the pictures on the website, Summer Bay looked like what we wanted. So much for a picture being worth a thousand words. Location: The location was ideal, just two (largish) blocks off the strip on Koval Avenue. It was trivial to get to most of the places on the Strip you would want to go to. Plenty of parking (due to it being a large establishment, and that there were many, MANY empty rooms there) as well. There was construction that required a detour from the "real" entrance that Google Maps or Mapquest will lead you to--the entrance is temporarily BEHIND the establishment, off of a side street from Koval. This is due to construction work on the facility. Room. The room was spacious, with a full kitchen, a laundry room with large-capacity washer and dryer (good, as I had to wash my clothes for a business trip I was going to from the vacation), and two bedrooms and a living room with balcony. The establishment was a bit dated, with older furnishings, and a carpet that has seen better days. Also, the A/C made the smaller bedroom and the living room absolutely frigid, while the master bedroom barely got below 80 degrees throughout our stay. They really need to fix that--we dodged a bullet in that the weather never got above 95 degrees, but you'd be baking otherwise. Amenities: My kids really liked the pool, which was a short walk from the room. However, the dust from all the work found its way into the room, unfortunately. Also, the the wifi internet access was free. This was good, as I'd be even more upset that it didn't work any of the days we were staying there. The conversation went like this with the front desk: "I can't get onto the internet or get a code from the automated system." "Yes, we know-they're working on it." "When will it be fixed?" "We don't know." Not cool, especially nowadays when nearly everyone brings a laptop or tablet along. Housekeeping does the minimum to keep the room livable. They're very miserly with the towels and extra pillows (don't know why--more than half of the rooms were empty, so it isn't like they don't have some spares!!). Bring your own extra blankets or pillows if you need such things. Price: You can always get a deal to stay here--the price was decent. Conclusion: If you don't need internet, extras, or are generally an undemanding traveler looking to stay a few days in Vegas on the (relatively) cheap, Summer Bay Las Vegas Desert Club wil do. However, there are better, more up to date and fully functioning suite resorts/timeshares out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. I will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHockeymom
Reviews.Content: First off, I am not an owner. I reserved a room through Expedia for two nights. I was attending an event at the Sands Expo and wanted to be as close as possible. My first reservation was at the Venetian for $525 because the Venetian is attached to the Sands. I heard about Summer Bay and found out it is the same walking distance from the Venetian rooms for much less money. My two nights at Summer Bay cost $240. My room was a two bedroom owners unit that was absolutely beautiful. (I heard the "renter unit" was not as nicely decorated but same layout) It was on the 2nd floor, no elevators here but the climb was not bad at all. The rooms had every single amenity you would find at home. We were only there for the weekend so we didn't do any cooking. If I was staying longer and if my whole family was with me, I would have stocked the full size fridge and saved some cash by eating in. Free wi-fi. Yes, you have to log in each day but it takes like two minutes. The walk to the front of the Sands Expo took about 10-15 minutes. Had the back doors of The Sands been open, the walk would have taken less than 5 minutes. Yes, there was a lot of construction going on but I knew that when booking. There is a guard at the entrance who will not allow you to drive in unless you show your parking pass. I liked that I could park my car and be in my room in a couple of minutes. Not like the big hotels where it takes 15 minutes to get to your room after you park. The pool was nice, there are three pools (one was closed during construction). Service at the front desk was average. If you are in Vegas to party or you want to walk everywhere on the strip this is not the place for you. This is for you if you are with family or friends and want to stay in the same room. If you are staying for 3 or more days this is a great way to save money on food and lodging. The room I stayed in was large and comfortable and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DONT EVEN LISTEN TO WHAT THEY SAY”
Reviews.Author: misleaded
Reviews.Content: I signed to buy a membership in January 2011. They promised heaven and stars. When I called to make reservations and use my membership, "You need to pay extra 600.00 dollars for that weekend. The week you have is in other month. So, after paying 5,5400.00 for initial payment and monthly payments of 525.00 I couldn't even book a room. What is this???? MISLEADING INFO SO YOU CAN BUY AND LATER YOU CANNOT FIND A SOUL TO COMPLAIN.... I really hope that someone can do something about all of us who believed in their words!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ROC4234
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Armed Forces Vacation Club $324.00 for 7 nights. one bedroom, very nice room, clean, great location, very helpful staff. i really enjoyed my stay so much that i have already booked to stay here again for 7 days in july 2011. Thanks Summer Bay Resort and Armed Forces Vacation Club.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: hisgrl4ever
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay! Rooms were great! Even with the construction it was no biggie! Only a short walk from the strip or a shuttle ride. Make sure to call a week prior and request a owners unit. The only down side was the extra $60 mid week service fee and we did not get maid service once. We only got fresh towels when i called the front desk but no trash pick up or any cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Ruined It!”
Reviews.Author: MundoTraveller99
Reviews.Content: I travelled to this hotel with some friends that are RCI owners so I didn't know what to expect as I've never been to this type of property before. The rooms were quite nice. (We had a two bedroom) with all the amenities required to eat comfortably in your room. The downside to the resort is the construction at the front gate. You have 3 options to get to the road. 1) Taxi - Your fee will be $4.70 just to get to the front gate of the hotel 2) You can get a ride on a golf cart to the front of the hotel. Unfortunately it was often difficult to get a ride. Nobody was available to drive the carts. If you arrive late at night just try to flag down the security guard at the front. You simply have to walk back to the hotel because the golf cart person simply does not show up. Additionally we had bad experiences with drivers making us feel uncomfortable about how much we tipped them. 3) Walk -- It's a pretty long walk to the front of the hotel through an industrial section of town. The construction starts at 9:00 a.m. so all day you can listen to Bobcat's moving bricks throughout the consruction zone. Very very dusty as well in the construction zone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay, Home sweet home.”
Reviews.Author: Jbkacovit
Reviews.Content: I will definitely stay here again, Since I discovered this hotel last year. I had recommended this to all my friends and family and as the result of my recommendation they loved it. The resorts has all the amenities that you wanted in your room. Fully furnished house. the pool is definitely a plus and the pool is open 24 hours wow!! loved it. my kids had fun and most of all it is far from smokey area like casinos.. but it is driving distance and 2 miles from Flamingo Casino. I would 100% recommend this once again.. it is a hidden gem.. loved it..

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: sanababeets
Reviews.Content: I am an owner and we stayed in a 2 bedroom unit. Very nice and spacious. Helpful to have the washer dryer available. We loved everything about the place. fireplace, flat screen tv's in every room, etc. We loved the large tub in the master bath and the walk in closets were great. The only downside as an owner are the fees. There are booking fees, split fees, etc. With the amount of money I pay every month plus the maintenance fees it shocks me when the tell me how many fees I have to pay on top of what I pay them already. It's painful. And when you do stay there, they try their hardest to sell you a unit. As a current owner, I advise you NOT to do it. It's a great place but not worth it unless you travel A LOT. Enough to make their $538.00 annual maintenance fee plus $59.00 reservation fee plus their $59.00 split season fee, PLUS your monthly payment worthwhile. I'm stuck in it and at this point to try and sell it is doubly excruciating for me. I'm just crossing my fingers and hoping that we get bought out REALLLLLL SOON

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Exceptional Room”
Reviews.Author: jonbr
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week May 13 - 20th, had a pool view 1bd room owners unit on the 3rd floor of the 16 building. The room was well equipped, a full kitchen with all the neccesary appliances including a blender and icemaker. The unit had 2 plasma TV's, full size washer and dryer and a very comfortable King bed. I had wanted a 3rd floor unit as I have read it can be noisy in a lower unit. (No Elevators) We took the timeshare tour and receved discount tickets and a $75.00 Visa gift card. Once we took the tour and told our guide we were there for the "freebies" we were quickly let go. The location is great, easy access to Harrah's, Imperial and the Wynn etc. The bus service to Freemont St. was handy. They have at least four buses running regular scheduled drop offs and pickups to various Casinos on the strip. Coffee available 24hrs a day at reception, pool towels supplied pool side. We also had free wireless internet, good signal strength.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Disappointed with Everything”
Reviews.Author: MaryKLe
Reviews.Content: The resort neglected to tell us that the resort was under construction, so it took us 30 mins longer to walk around the contruction area. The maids NEVER came during our visit, internet was not working half the time when we needed it, and the shuttle never came to pick us up, and the walk to the strip takes 40 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money - relaxing and enjoy !”
Reviews.Author: Fireblade49
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Summer Bay resort in early May 2011. We spent three weeks in the US in total - starting and ending in Vegas. We stayed at the Venetian for the first three days, and the Summer Bay resort for the final three. Of the two, despite being far cheaper, and a couple of blocks from the strip - we much preferred our stay at the Summer Bay. You can relax and enjoy yourself without feeling that you are missing out on something (as the 'in your face' strip can sometimes make you feel). It was not all good news of course (it never is !). There is building work going on at present (due to be completed in July 2011 they told us) at the front of the development, which means you have to follow a long divertion around to the back of the complex to gain access. I wish the reception staff would have told us at the start of the stay that if you ask the security guard who is on patrol on a night where the building works are taking place - he will ring for a golf buggy to come and pick you up and bring you round. In three days we certainly kept fit !! The building work will only impact you if you're in a block close to the work - ask about that when you book. The rooms are great - really spacious. They have a kitchen, small dining room, lounge, large bedroom with walk in wardrobe and the biggest bath we saw anywhere in the US (two people can lie in it side by side - excellent !). Some of the furniture (settee etc) were a bit tatty, but overall it was a really quiet, comfortable place to stay. The facilities at Summer Bay are good. There are four pools (a larger one also being built right now) with plenty of towels and recliners, a gym (free to use for guests - no free weights but two running machines, a stepper, bike and others) and a games room. The grounds staff are very helpful - but the concierge was quite the opposite - go elsewhere for the best deals on tours and attractions. Overall, I would definitely recommend the Summer Bay Resorts !

Reviews.Title: “Two Visits, Same Favorable Opinion”
Reviews.Author: iluv2go2
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Summer Bay Resort within a year. Although situated a long block behind the center strip hotels, I have walked to Harrah’s within ten minutes from departing the main entrance. I wouldn’t recommend doing so after sunset, however. The units have a spacious layout with an abundance of closet and drawer space; something I have not seen often in my years of travel. The units have a maximum occupancy of six; that number can comfortably stay at this resort. Summer Bay has one of the best housekeeping services I have experienced while staying at timeshares. All appliances are newer and in excellent working order. Large, mounted, flat screen televisions are a fantastic touch. If you’re a light sleeper, I do recommend requesting a second floor unit. The employees do everything they can to make your stay a pleasant one. I attempted to use one of the grills on two separate occasions. Both times I needed assistance getting the gas grill started. I called the front desk and within three minutes someone was there to the rescue. I used the transportation service on my previous stay here and the shuttle drivers are fantastic. The schedule service takes you to various locations on the strip, downtown and a grocery store. It would be nice to have an on-call driver (for a set fee, of course) to pick up after 11:30pm which is around the time of the last return trip to Summer Bay. I had the unfortunate experience of an irate, verbally abusive, cab driver who, at 1am, did not care to take two women the short distance to the resort from the Flamingo Hotel. It was one of the most frightening experiences I have had in life; when we attempted to get out immediately, he refused to release the door locking mechanism. (He was reported to his supervisor.) Over the summer, I sent e-mails to the resort suggesting an on-call driver and relayed my experience, but have not received a reply to date. I think most guests wouldn’t mind paying extra to avoid the hassle. This trip, I rented a vehicle, which is something I usually do not do when vacationing in Vegas. There is ample complimentary parking at the resort; most spaces have carport coverings. This trip, I utilized one of the swimming pools; small, but a nice layout. Considering there are clusters of pools, hot tubs and chaise lounges in the courtyard of 3-5 low rise buildings, it was not overly crowded and fairly quiet. The scheduled activities were plentiful; I watched a classic movie. Snacks were provided, the setting was comfortable and the TV was large. There was only one other guest, but the resort did not cancel the movie due to low attendance. That was very much appreciated. Great staff, well-kept resort, responsible guests, very nice, comfortable units. As long as Summer Bay’s service remains awesome, I will return again.

Reviews.Title: “great quiet place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Meljarinka27
Reviews.Content: Pros : - huge bathtub - beautiful fully furnished suite - price - location - we had a very quiet night - slept so well that we overslept for our check out. The staff was nice about it and did not charge us extra. - good staff the only con was accessibility because of construction and remodeling

Reviews.Title: “Avoid until Construction is over... if it ever is.”
Reviews.Author: FredUnderscore_
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Summers Bay.. and it was a completely different experience. When we came in September, we were told that the construction would be done in a couple months. When we booked for May, they said it would be done by April. Guess what? Its not done and won't be soon. The front entrance is completely shut down. Expect a lengthy detour to get into the development, and don't even try to walk back through the front gate (they won't let you). You have to walk around to the back or wait 20 minutes for a ride. The rooms are nice, but this one was not as clean or nice as the last one we stayed in. The shower curtain was pretty nasty and the bed had an indent in it like someone sat on the edge of it for 2 years... it was strange. Our pool was packed with un-supervised kids most of the day. One day we tried going to a different pool, but it was also packed. The best thing I can say about the place is that the people that work there are great and friendly - especially the security guards and front desk. If you are going before the end of the summer, I would not expect the construction to be completed, no matter what they say.. so I would avoid this place at least until then. They really should give the people they lied to about the construction a free weekend or something once the construction is done...

Reviews.Title: “Great location with the comforts of home”
Reviews.Author: MandyPlymouthEngland
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice, we had 2 en suite bedrooms with a lounge, kitchen and laundry room. I would recommend a top floor though as we could hear people moving around quite loudly at night above us. The location was excellent - just a 10 minute walk - we cut through the hotel opposite the main gates rear car park across the road which bought us out onto the main area of the strip. You could also get the free shuttle bus to and fro which was an excellent well timed service (different times for various drop offs) A trip to Freemont Street in the evening is a must to watch the laser shows and enjoy a great atmosphere and I recommend Viva Las Vegas but get your tkts on the day from the TKTS discount stalls (there is one just outside the Circus Circus and other locations too - we got ours for $34 and because they were quiet they moved us forward 20 rows to the $120 seats!) make sure you wear good walking shoes too!

Reviews.Title: “good service and pleasurable stay”
Reviews.Author: lillyssa
Reviews.Content: There were 7 women from ages 13 to 50 in my travelling party. We were ALL satisfied with what this resort had to offer us. The service was quick and friendly to respond and the location was convenient. Yes, it's off the strip but the free shuttles to the strip and major hotel chains were SO helpful! They were on time and scheduled comfortably. It was so great that the pool was open 24hrs vs 99% of the pools on the strip that close at 6pm - what is that!? For the price and location, our stay was very pleasurable. The suite was big and spacious and the balcony overlooking the pool was a nice touch! I would recommend this place for families with young kids or couples just wanting a getaway and break from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bextraveler
Reviews.Content: A group of 5 of us stayed here for a weekend break, in a two bedroom suite. We loved it. It did take us a long time to check in, due to a long line of people waiting, but that was fine. We didn't arrive til after 5pm so the 4pm check in was also fine. Our room was clean, if a little worn. Great TVs in both rooms and the living area, we made full use of the washing machine and dryer, equipped kitchen. The pull out sofa bed for our 5th person was a little on the thin side but she slept fine on it. The construction was a little annoying, the pools near our room were closed. Would definitely stay again and recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great except the service...........”
Reviews.Author: FrugalBella
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are new timeshare owners of Summer Bay Resorts Las Vegas. We stayed there for our first time April 15th~17th (Fri.~Sun.). Our overall stay was pleasant with the exception of the service that we received. Here are the positives and negatives of our overall experience. PROS: *Great quiet and convenient location, directly behind Harrah's Casino (10 min. walk). *Our 1 bedroom suite was clean, comfortable and had a wonderful spa bath. *We stayed for free using a certificate we received when purchasing our timeshare *Great shuttle service to the supermarket and downtown (Freemont Street). CONS: *We waited 33 minutes to be checked into our rooms! *We were told that check out was at 11:00a.m. when making our reservations in Jan. and then we were surprised that we actually had to check out at 10:00a.m. *The check in time was at 4:00p.m., so be warned. *When we purchased our timeshare, they said that the construction would be finished by Nov. 2010 but it was still ongoing when we arrived. *An associate who checked us in said that she would give us some paperwork we requested in a few minutes. We waited 5 minutes and went back inside and she had left without giving us what we requested. **The condition of our free stay stipulated that we had to attend a 90 minute presentation from 11:00~12:30. This was not a problem but my husband and I were extremely frustrated and agitated that the presentation lasted from 11:00~1:25!! That was 2.5 hrs. of high pressure sales that tried to convince us to upgrade to a 2 bedroom because this deal wouldn't last..........yadda, yadda, yadda. *Also, during the check in process the group ahead of us were a group of parents and chaperones. They had requested that their suites be located next to each other since they had many minors. For whatever reason, Summerbay dropped the ball on this and placed their suites very far away from each other. The clients were not too happy and said they would contact management to complain. Overall, the stay was pleasant and the ammenities were nice. However, they need to train their staff how to deal more professionally and efficiently with the public. After all, this is hospitality and the customer is always right. Additionally, there is a huge banner once you enter the premises and it states "5 stars Greatly Satisfied". Come on Summer Bay, live up to your words.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for both Strip experiance and relaxation.”
Reviews.Author: Pweb44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into Summer Bay on April.8th until the 15th which was the 2nd week of a 2 week trip to Las Vegas. The evening we arrived we were a little concerned upon first impression of the resort since you are entering through the front gate, that was still being worked on as part of the renovations and the first building we saw is what I think will be the new welcome center which also is still being finished. The woman working security that night was friend and stopped the cab to verify we were on the list for check in which made us feel secure that not anyone could drive into the property. They presently have the registration area in a couple of the units in Building 1 but I can understand this is only a temp location. It was a little confsusing at first since the door we entered brought us to someone who I think was more for setting sales tours but we were directed to the back bedroom that was set up as the registration area. Moe was working that night and he is very friendly and made check in a breeze for us. We were off quickly with our keys in hand. Outside building 1 was the pick up spot for the shuttle service which is under the covered areas for the parking spaces as you see around the property. Also in this area they had golf carts waiting to help people get to their room if they did not have a vehicle. The drive loaded our bags into the cart and we jumped in where he took us to our unit, Building 8 rm 109 and helped carry our bags to the door and ensured the lights were turned on and the temp settings were correct. The units were very clean and well laid out. We were told that the resort was a housing community at one time, so the layout of the rooms is designed as such. The bed was lovely but I do wish the had more pillows. The bathroom had the largest tub I've ever seen in a resort bathroom. The living room and kitchen area was very spacious and the fire place was a nice touch. The pool areas and BBQ's we're located just outside out unit and made for wasy access which was nice. I did try to use the BBQ's twice but I found them to be a great disapointment. They were difficult to get lit and never did reach a cooking tempature to my liking. There were times I had the setting as high as I could and I could still hold my hand over the grill and it would feel warm at best. Both times I tried to BBQ i ened up finishing off by using the cook top in the unit. Also we did find the noise from the unit above to be a concern as well. You can hear people walking or using the showers quite easily. Also the person above us the first 2 days liked to play crappy rap music fairly loudly in the evenings, but once they left it was enjoyable the remaining time there at the resort. Every morning you would see the maintance staff cleaning the BBQ's, pool area and common areas around the unit which was nice to see. These people work really hard. The best aspect is the shuttle service, it really is the best in Vegas. The free shuttle ran on time all the time and you could count on them to leave to the strip on time and be at the pickup spots on time. Also while checking in we mentioned to Moe that we were there for our Honeymoon, as my wife and I married the day before while in Vegas for our planned wedding. The next day after we checked in, a wonderful basket was delivered to our unit with a note of congrats from Moe and the Staff. This was a lovely surprise and truly increased our satisfaction in the level of service by the staff. All in all, our stay at Summer Bay helped add to one of our best vacations my wife and I have taken together. We look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place! Cannot wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: HGinNJ
Reviews.Content: We travelled with another couple and had two units for a week at Summer Bay from March 20-26th and were not dissappointed. The apartment was clean and had every convenience for a wonderful stay in Las Vegas - having a washer/dryer was a great plus. Also the mini walk in closet was great. Only surprise is that the bathroom does not have a door connecting to the bedroom, just an open arch - but closing the bedroom door was an easy fix to that privacy solution! The toilet is in it's own little room off the bathroom. Tub was absolutely HUGE. It could easily fit 3 average size adults!! The location is conveiently only 1 block away and behind Harrah's which is pretty central on the strip. The monorail is also easily accessable from behind Harrah's. The walk is only about a 7 minute walk through the employee parking lot of Harrah's and is safe. I highly reccommend Summer Bay Resorts, Las Vegas. We are planning another trip in 2 years, and will definitely be staying here again. Even though we were there during spring break AND March Madness, the noise level was less than we expected - which was also another great surprise! Front desk personel were friendly and efficient. The golf carts were also an added plus, they pick you up at your room and deliver you around the property as needed. We also rented a car to get around - there is a lot to do off the strip. There was plenty of parking for cars too.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Carpet, Bad front desk staff, BIG Hard pillows, run while you can!”
Reviews.Author: travleforJessnJohn
Reviews.Content: I booked this place as my hubby and i were traveling with friends and wanted a nice 2 bedroom condo like place to all stay together. Check in was in a makeshift room and they hustled us out and would hardly answer any questions. I think they are used to owners and don't like weekend bookings, just a guess as to why they were so rude, the resort is so big they have to send golf carts to get you to and from rooms, which half the time they never showed up so we hoofed it suitcases in tow, and when they do show up you are expected to tip, for everything here! Pillows were the worst I have slept on, bring your own. Front desk staff never did send anyone to fix out fireplace until the last day when i cornered a maintenance man myself. Carpet had ridiculous stains, and soaker tub was so filthy I scrubbed it before I would even shower in it. Basically I woudl never stay here, until the remodel is 100% done and make sure you don't expect good service, they are so not there to please. Upon check out i asked two different clerks for the name of the hotel manager, and they would not tell me, just referred me to a 1-800 customer care line. Which is disconnected. Every other guest we chatted with had similar stories, maybe it has gone downhill lately, cause the reviews looked pretty good. ONE nice thing 24 hour pool and hot tub were good to us after a long day hitting Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The best service we have ever received.”
Reviews.Author: MaineOconnors
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful facility to utilize. Our first with a resort and it was fantastic. We were a little apprehensive when we pulled up, since it is under going an expansion, and the construction was obvious, but once we began interacting with the staff, we realized the commitment they had to the guests. Only a block off the strip, but with the feel of being secluded and quiet. The units are fully equipped and extremely clean. Four pools provided plenty of accessibility and the security staff allows for your comfort. Whenever we were walking the property, we would be offered a ride on the golf carts that the staff drove around the facility, or even picked up by a shuttle as they passed. First and foremost, was the hospitality of the entire staff, without exception, we had positive interactions with them; however, we would like to highlight Pat P. who drove our shuttle and was always extremely friendly and helpful with suggestions and answering questions for us. A great ambassador for Summer Bay. Thank you for making us converts to resorts from hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Very roomy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Ellestar
Reviews.Content: We booked a 6 night stay at Summer Bay Resorts through a private owner at www.myresortnetwork.com. I got the entire stay for $500.00 (including tax). I could not have been happier with the price I paid and this resort. The room very very clean and updated. We had a King size bed in the spacious bedroom and a pull out sofa for the two teenagers. The seperate living room provided lots of space for the kids to have their area and us to have our own room. Each room had a TV and the bathroom was divided to allow access from the living room as well as the master. The full kitchen was a welcome addition to help cut down on food costs. We at all of our breakfasts in the room. The free high speed internet access a plus also. The kitchen had dish soap as well as dishwashing detergent. The full laundry area (off our private patio was nice complete with detergent for one wash. We found this room to suite all of our needs and then some. The fireplace was cozy but not necessary. Each of the 6 buildings in this resort have their own pool and our pool was never crowded. One afternoon our pool was completely shade so we walked to another pool for more sun -- we found this pool to be as nice as our own. The front of the resort was under construction and made that area a complete mess. I can't wait to visit again when the main pool (with lazy river) is finished, it should be very nice. I would highly recommend this resort. As a side note, I read about roaches in these reviews and made a point to look for them. I never saw them and my kids did leave food out (not advised but kids will be kids). I never had a problem with any bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding facility but it would have been nice to be a bit closer to the strip but shuttle service was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Reitz-08
Reviews.Content: The rooms and the whole resort was very clean. We had a newly rennovated room with a fireplace, new dishes, new appliances, new furniture, big bathtub, king size bed in a separate bedroom which had a second 40 inch TV on the wall. It is quiet and has a pool, exercise room and hot tub so you can get away from the noise and busyness of the strip. The shuttle takes you to a grocery store at 830 in the morning if you need to go and is back within the hour. There are several activities planned for every day of the week so you have options if gambling and long periods of walking around are not your thing. The shuttle takes you to quite a few hotels on the strip if you don't want to walk appoximately 2 blocks to the strip. It is centrally located just behind the Flamingo on the strip so you can make your way to the other hotels quite easily. I personally like staying on the strip but the price is right at this resort and you get a suite. I would stay here again. This is a good place to stay if you have children or extended family with you. Part of the resort is under construction. This is also a time share but you can book the suites like a hotel as well. The shuttle service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Husker2
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Summer Bay, I bought the timeshare unseen. I was a little worried since there are a few bad reviews. Those worries were for nothing as this is a great place. It was clean, roomy, updated, location convenient, shuttles were great, beds comfy. It is a long 2 blocks walk to the strip, but easily walked and seemed safe to us. There is a lot of construction going on but I never was bothered by any of it, the resort will be even better when the resort is finished. I was called previous to arriving about "looking at the resort", I was offered $100 to attend, we declined and were never bothered again. I was impressed with everything about the resort and had lots of fun, can't wait to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable aside from being noisy”
Reviews.Author: Covince
Reviews.Content: We booked this condo as a hopefully quieter and more spacious alternative to a busy hotel right on the strip. Although the decor is somewhat dated, everything was clean and comfortable enough. The construction at the entrance was a nonissue for us as our room was near the back of the complex, and we had a rental car so had no need to use the shuttle. But...the noise was a major problem.
