The walls are paper thin and the pool and hot tub were just below our 3rd level room. (There are multiple little "pods", each complete with their own little pool and clubhouse in the center) I could hear our neighbor's conversations and television next door well in to the night on our first night there. Then for the rest of the week, I knew that our new neighbors got in the shower every morning promptly at 7 a.m. when they turned on the squeaky nozzle - it was like an unwanted alarm clock for me after being kept up late the night before by folks outside my window. The pool and hot tub down below were open 24 hours and are heated. So though the temps were only in the 50s, the hot tub was often utilized and occupied well in to the middle of the night by drinking and loud talking/laughing occupants. One night out of desperation for some sleep, I opened my window at 2:30 a.m. and yelled down to the people in the hot tub to "please stop yelling so that people up here could get some sleep." I finally got my first and only good night's sleep after a week on our last night there. So because of the noise issues, I could not recommend this condo except for those people who either are going to stay out all night anyway, or have the ability to sleep through just about anything. Other than that, it's a reasonably nice place. I really did not enjoy stumbling through each day of my vacation in a constantly sleep deprived state.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Tfisheresq
Reviews.Content: We rented here because of the favorable reviews and were quite disappointed. We booked through bookit.com, and when we checked in and asked which room we would receive, the agent almost laughed and said "you booked with bookit.com, you're getting a rental unit!" Nevermind the construction, we spent the next three days in a dump. Old mattresses, sofa-sleeper nearly falling apart, dirty showers, the icemaker in the refrigerator didn't work, bad smells, horribly dated and worn out decor, etc. We did all we could to stay away from the place. I'm sure the rennovated rooms are nice, we never saw one (never will, I promise). The sneer from the desk agent at check-in said it all. Lesson learned about this place.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: homebody94
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed at this resort and wow is was amazing, even though they are still doing construction it was so quiet you wouldn't know it was going on. You are maybe a 10 minute walk from the strip but they do provide a shuttle too and from the strip and Fremont Street which I highly recommend going to see. When we finally arrived we were starving so the front desk person(Andrew) recommended Ellis Island up the street it looks a little divy but oh my god the food is amazing so good we went there a few times to eat. The rooms were clean and all the comforts of home the only downfall is no elevator and we were on the third floor. Liked it so much we bought a timeshare there while we were there. We went for a Nascar race and Ladies they have massage services that actually come to your room and it is well worth the money to have one of these done

Reviews.Title: “Always will come back to Summer Bay Resorts”
Reviews.Author: 808shelli
Reviews.Content: ok, I want to set the record striaght on some things. On the website they CLEARLY state that there are 2 types of units, renters untis and owners unit. Having stayed in both, I'd like to write a review based on my stay in the rental unit. I had a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom. It was spacious and clean. The maid service came by daily. All the water ran hot, AC/heater worked, dishwasher worked, all the trash got picked up daily. Bed was made, clean linen, clean dishes, clean bathroom. Granted the owner units look much better! they have stereos and better amenaties, but these are for people who are using timeshare points and/or exchanges. for the money you pay, if you get upgraded considere yourself lucky, but the rental one I had was just fine. Plus members in my party utlized the free shuttle and even one night one of the drivers saw me and my huge party (about 19 women) and offered to take us all to the Mirage since it was one of the stops. Some of my party complained about minor things but I believe they were addressed because I didn't hear about them again. The construction might be a problem for some, but I stayed in blg 3 right next to the construction and I don't remember hearing anything unusual. We had a great time. Thanks Cindi and AJ for taking care of everything for my girls getaway and making our stay pleasurable. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place.”
Reviews.Author: L0rna
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2-bedroom condo for us and our friends. It was perfect. Didn't take the shuttle much as we preferred to walk but it was convenient when we wanted it. I've recommended this place to lots of people.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: tbrutus
Reviews.Content: We have a family of 6 now including our new daughter in law. There are NO rooms in Vegas for 6 people. You have to get 2 rooms and then feed them. We loved Summer Bay Resort. Full kitchen was easy and furnished. A grocery store just down the street. They have a very convenient shuttle to/from different locations on the strip, but it is very easily walkable, and safety was no issue. Just say no to the sales pitch for the time share presentation at checkin and they won't keep buggin you about it. The only negative we had was the hot water runs out quickly. For the price we were very pleased, especially since the option is 2 rooms anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: brofam
Reviews.Content: Summer Bay makes its mark in the details. What a fantastic shuttle service. The pool access is great (and some strip resorts don't even heat their pools). But the staff...that's the clincher. The gardener laughed with my young kids as the got in his way and then stuck flowers in their hair. Staff roams the resort on golf carts looking for ways to help you. They even have arts and crafts activities and more for the kids to stay occupied during the lulls of our vacation. Both times I needed help )once with outdoor grill, once locked myself out) staff arrived promptly and solved my problems. And all for a song of a price. We're so glad we chose a place we could be comfortable with kitchen, laundry, space! Highly recommend. Looking for other Summer Bay properties to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, just book it.”
Reviews.Author: rmorgansd
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel, it is a condo complex with all the facilities of a home. Our two bedroom place was $99 per night and had two huge bedrooms each with their own bath, a full kitchen, a patio, living room, dining room table, TVs everywhere, a patio, and a short walk to a jacuzzi. There was a laundry room with a washer and dryer, a microwave, full size fridge with freezer, dish washer, I mean it's the full deal. It's a short walk to a game room with pool and pinball. It's ridiculous that you can get this for such a low price. I think they are renting these out while they are working on a time share facility. It is a wonderful place to stay about a block off the strip. I felt like I was in a home, not a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Content: This is an good place to rest and get away from the strip. The service provided by all departments is excellent. We had some minor problems that were rectified immediately. Saying that the housekeeping could have been better. Our maid was wonderful, but the floors needed to be swept and mopped and there was mould in the shower. The free shuttle service to the strip was excellent, as well as the pick up by golf cart available within the hotel itself, this is a huge facility. Amenities such as hot tub and pool were refreshing when we came in from a hard day of walking the strip. Grocery shopping to Vons was superb (ask for the discount) there is currently no food services on the site. The 2 bedroom/bathroom fitted our group of 5 quite comfortably. Heard some plane noise and but you get use to it. Well worth the money you pay........very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: California Dude
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week and we look forward to coming back. Pros: - Very close to the strip - Security on site 24/7 - Our 2 bedroom place had 2 bathroom ( very nice when travelling with little kids ) Cons: - Construction on going - Check in service was good, but not great ( they did not tell us about the shuttle service ) - Pool is open 24 hours, so it's possible someone will be using it at 2am and making too much noise Overall, very good resort.

Reviews.Title: “great location to gamble and relax”
Reviews.Author: AllenMRegina
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to summer bay and my wife and I enjoyed our stay. The resort still has some construction happening at the entrance but it in no way affected our stay. once the construction is complete the added amenities will make this place even better. we booked a one bedroom which was clean and comfortable. we actually enjoyed one evening in front of the fire place. Staff were polite and helpful and there is a shuttle service if you don't want to walk. the walk to the strip is 6 minutes, we used Harrahs employee parking lot and had no security issues. Most of our trips home were at 3am. anyone who has stayed in a hotel on the strip will know that the morning walk for coffee is a long and usually expense adventure. having a full kitchen makes those Vegas mornings a lot easier to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Bay - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WashPA0214
Reviews.Content: When this baby is finished, it will be "the" place to stay unless you really want on the strip. Clean, and all that you need. 3 levels of rooms and we were on the 2nd level. You could hear the people up stairs and their water ran forever, but they may have been filling the garden tub for 2. 2 bedrooms for 4 would be great, 6 people would make is crowded. Just depends on what you like. When all down there will be 5 pools - 4 now and they were clean. Hot tubs too. Work out center was nothing special, bu there if you want. Game (activity) room - typical. The place looks great. The folks were nice. The timeshare presentation - well, beware and read the fine print if you go. And, if you do, you get $75. Overall - very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: BGGast
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location - wonderful suite with clean, comfy bed, fully loaded kitchen and a washer/dryer in unit. Exceptional shuttle service to grocery store and central hotel locations. Helpful staff available to obtain rental car or area information.

Reviews.Title: “Hit the Jackpot off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Shopping4fun
Reviews.Content: We chose Summer Bay Resorts Las Vegas Desert as an exchange through RCI Check in & out was fast & easy and we were pleased we could check in early & also have a little later check out. A few days prior to arrival I called and requested a lower floor due to walking/back issues and no elevator. We were given a unit on the 1st floor a crossed from the pool in building 13 Rm 107. We had a 2 bedroom that slept 6 there were 4 of us so we plenty of room. Both bedrooms had comfortable king size beds and walk in closets & flat screen TV’s. The master bedroom had a chaise lounge, sink vanity area large soaker tub and a private toilet area. The second bathroom was off the hallway with a shower. The kitchen was fully equipped will all that you would need and glass top dinning room table with 6 chairs a snack bar with 2 bar stools. There was a welcome basket with coffee, tea, coco and a sm salt & pepper shaker, dish soap, paper towels enough to get started. The living room had 52 in flat screen, a Sofa bed, 1 chair, coffee table, CD player with IPod dock and a gas fireplace. There were 2 chairs & a table on the balcony and an astray was provided. All unites are non-smoking except on the balcony. Right off the balcony is a laundry room with washer/dryer, vacuum, broom & dust pan, sm box of laundry soap & softer. Free wifi was slow but better than having to pay for it & you could still keep in touch. Maid service is once a week. We checked in on Friday. They showed up on Mon afternoon we really did not need them and just asked for bath & kitchen towels & garbage bags. They also gave us more laundry soap. The grounds are well maintained. There is construction going on @ the gate and the club house. But this was no bother to us we did not even hear it. Shortly after check in the timeshare call came. I told them we were busy until Wed and to call next week. When Wed came so did the call. Suzan was not pushy when I told her we were not interested. Prior to our arrival she had called our home several times. We came a week early & staying with a friend in Summerlin near the Red Rock Casino. So she sent an email saying that she could not get a hold of us to set up appointment for the TS pitch. She was just doing her job. She was very nice and easy to talk to. We made a point of stopping to say goodbye and she gave us 2 goodie bags. All the staff and security were friendly. We loved our unit and the closeness to the heated pool/hot tub. The only compliant we had was the couch was old and uncomfortable. They could use a recliner or ottoman. That being said we did not want to leave our home away from home and will be back. On Super Bowl Sunday they invited us to a SB party with food it was BYO. We did not go because we had our own party in the condo. The Summer Bay is located behind the Imperial Palace. It was a short drive to the strip s and we valet parked @ the Flamingo or Harrahs. Shuttle service is provided how ever we did not take advantage of it. The back road from the IP or Flamingo will return you to the entrance of the Summer Bay. If you get a chance go off the strip go to Ellis Island on 4178 Koval Lane, & Terrible’s on 4100 Paradise Road & Koval, reasonable priced good food & drinks fun was has by all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience and we want to come back.”
Reviews.Author: Joy1949
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 weeks and found the staff friendly and helpful. The shuttle to the strip and for groceries were on time, effiecient and a wonderful bonus. Any small problems we had in the room (the pilot light went out on the fireplace) were fixed immediately and the desk phoned back to ensure that we were satisfied. The only issue we had was people partying in the hot tub outside our room and waking us up but we called security who responded immediately. Amenities surpassed our expectations as did the service, if Gary cleans your room you are in for a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Bay resorts isn't a very good place to stay with a group”
Reviews.Author: AngiManzutto
Reviews.Content: February 3rd, 2011 we arrived at Summer Bay resorts to celebrate my thirtieth belated birthday and we were to stay until Sunday. We check in, the people are nice and friendly. I think after my day that's good. We get into the room and it's colder in there than it is out side so we try putting on the heater and the fire place and the room is filthy and there is an annoying chirping sound. We wait to give the heater and fire place some time to warm up, but call the front desk to ask about the chirping and they came up and put in new batteries. After and hr and a half we have them come up to fix the other problems, they did come back up to fix it, but after realizing it was not fixable, they gave us another room which the fire place didn't work in it and we called 2 complain they were supposed to send someone up, we waited for an hr and called again, my friend got hung up on and it was too late in the nite to care so we went 2 bed. in the morning we tried takin showers and the water was freezing cold, so i went to talk 2 management and was given a upgraded suite. This one had no problems in it, it was clean and nice and everything worked for us. we enjoyed the free shuttles, they were very helpful and we enjoyed being picked up at our rooms to be taken to the free shuttles. The place was under renovation, which didn't bother us, but the problems on the first and second nite make me and my friends not want 2 ever stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't find any faults with this property or my stay”
Reviews.Author: johndfffff
Reviews.Content: This is located walking distance to the Sands Expo Center and an $8 cab ride to the Las Vegas Convention Center. I stayed here for the CES show and have bookmarked as a favorite Vegas place to stay. My condo was completely furnished, including a fireplace. It was really a great place at an outstanding price! At the time I was there they were remodeling, so that was a mess, but still I give it FIVE stars all around. Can't wait to see it after it's remodeled. I will definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem Off the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: donped
Reviews.Content: Wow, I was quite surprised by the quality of Summer Bay Resorts in Las Vegas. It was great for the amount we paid and the location it was in. (As a note, we paid as regular customers, and were not in a timeshare program.) First things first, don't let the entrance scare you off. Although construction is going on at their front entrance (and their clubhouse), which makes the place seem run-down, it actually is not. I was pleasantly surprised by the rooms they had for an off-strip location (then again, a timeshare resort may be the reason). For a three-person room, the place had a fully functional kitchenette, one king-sized bed, a fold out bed/couch, two flat-screen TVs, a working fireplace, and a decent bathroom. They were clean, and everything looked new; we likely got one of the newly remodeled rooms, and we sure aren't complaining. It was quite nice hearing silence when we went to sleep, versus the hubbub that was still out there on the Strip. Definitely comfortable, great facilities, and the location is not detrimentally far away from the strip. In addition, service was nice (we got daily custodial service), and the staff was pretty friendly, even when we had to check in very late at night. All in all, I highly recommend the location, as long as you don't mind being away from the Strip for a while. There are daily buses that leave from the resort to the Strip, so there is available transportation for those that don't want to brave traffic on the Strip itself.

Reviews.Title: “great customer service, nice suites”
Reviews.Author: amandawillis
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with pricing, location and accomadations. Customer service was off the charts. We will be staying here again. We were able rent a confrence room for a very affordable rate, and the marketing director was phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Jayne122
Reviews.Content: Even though it is still under construction, this property is beautiful and a very good value. We rented a one-bedroom unit. It was spacious, well laid-out, and nicely furnished. The service from check-in to check-out was great! Shuttle to the Strip was nice, but we also walked there several times with no problems. Had a few maintenance issues, but they were very promptly addressed and remedied. We were attending a trade show being held at the Sands Convention Center, and this was the PERFECT location. Our adult daughter (flight attendant) joined us for a few nights and she slept on the sofa bed. She said it was comfy, and we all enjoyed our stay immensely. I hope they won't go up on the price once construction is complete! We plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: Arleneisok
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Summer Bay Resort Las Vegas Desert Club worked for us! Although there is a major rennovation happening at this resort that we were not aware of before we arrived (could be why we got such a good deal), our stay was still great. Having a two bedroom, two bath unit allowed two couples to share a space easily. I believe we got an updated unit and it was very nice with comfortable king size beds and big screen tv's in each bedroom. It was very clean. The location (the parallel street behind the strip) was very convenient and made it easy to either walk (although a bit of a hike) or drive to all of the strip activities. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Wait to Come Back”
Reviews.Author: elwitty
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on a 1 bedroom for a New Year's eve week at this resort from a timeshare owner. I am a frequent guest at Mandalay Bay and Monte Carlo, have stayed at the Wyndham Grand Desert Resorts, and just recently purchased a 2 bedroom timeshare at the HGVC Flamingo. I had not heard much about this place, so my expectations were not high. Upon my arrival, yes, there was construction in the front (and I've been told it will be done by March 2011). Check in was smooth and I got a ground floor room next to the pool (Unit 8-105). The room itself was renovated, had large flatscreen TVs, granite countertops, a huge bathtub, and all the amenities of home (and some I wish I had at home like the automically timed fireplace). The grounds were clean, the staff was friendly, and I found out that all the pools throughout the resort are heated - pretty awesome. I had to leave after 4 nights but after experiencing this place I decided to buy a 2 bedroom week timeshare at the Summer Bay Club on ebay. I prefer this place over Wyndham and the spaciousness and apartment style options make it more attractive than the strip hotels. Overall, I love my timeshare at the HGVC Flamingo because of the strip location, the access to all the Flamingo pools, and the excellent Hilton timeshare exchange program. However, the Summer Bay timeshare program is more flexible (you can break up your 7 nights for multiple trips). I also like the fact that the rooms are only steps away from the parking lot and that it has frequent shuttle service. If you frequently travel to Vegas, it is a good timeshare to own (personally I would buy resale to save a lot of cash). Also, as I rented from an existing timeshare owner, I got a renovated unit (I'm told that all the owner units are renovated and the separate "rental suites" are not). There are solid deals on this place (to both buy and rent) on ebay (just take the standard ebay precautions if you go this route). I've got big hopes for this place (like everyone says, it will be great when it is done).

Reviews.Title: “The best choice ever!”
Reviews.Author: Bea25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fabulous! We rent a one bedroom suite for 4 adults and two kids. The suite was absolutely wonderful, you have a fully equipped kitchen washer and drier machine room (next to your balcony), a huge bathtub, two flat TVs and a gorgeous fireplace . On top of that, the room service is really good! , and the location is the best!.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - will be perfect when building is done.”
Reviews.Author: Hambafrika
Reviews.Content: Stayed August 2010. My wife's 40th birthday treat...... A big complex in the process of being renovated. All the negative observations regarding the walk back from the Strip are not valid. All the houses have been flattened so that empty lots seperate the complex from the strip. I believe that there is a hope that the land will be used to build a stadium for an as yet unpurchased basketball franchise? Rooms are large, clean and cool. Cant fault anything really. We did not use the resort's facilities as it was too hot! It makes a wonderful break from hotel after hotel to relax in an apartment. We did not do anything more complicated than breakfast, though meals are obviously possible. There is no facility on site to purchase food, but little stores are 1 block away, easy walking distance for basic provisions. Location is fantastic for 'Vegas - really easy access to all the fun. The Harah probably the closest. Definitely do not need cabs to get to the strip, though getting to Mandalay Bay or Fremont Str is obviously a taxi journey which the resort will organise for you. Try get to the Voodoo Lounge at The Rio for a sundowner - the views are incredible and as the sun sets the lights come on! Quite magical.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Summer Bay”
Reviews.Author: Bug12
Reviews.Content: My sister and I both seniors stay together in a 2 bedroom suite. Everything was excellent and looked exactly like the pictures on line. We used the concierge to booked shows and tours to Hoover Dam and Grand Canyon. We especially liked the bus service to the casinos and shopping as we did not rent a car. It was always on time and reliable. We totally enjoyed our stay and will stay again. Even though it was under construction in the front it did not bother us at all. Staff was always available and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quiet Place Close to Strip”
Reviews.Author: TouristGlobal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights on Thanksgiving in a one bedroom suite. We liked it, and the value was good, we found the deal on Expedia. The building was quiet and pretty. The pool was heated and close by. We could walk to Strip but it's kind of far if you go with kids, but for adults it's fine. We cooked in the kitchen and there was everything we needed. The only bathtub was too big. We didn't really use it at all, just took showers. So overall we are very satisfied for the price we paid (about $74 per day plus tax).

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: KenBlu
Reviews.Content: Loved the accommodations at Summer Bay . The grounds were very clean outside of the construction going on at the entrance. The rooms were spotless and very well appointed. The kitchen had good quality utensils. The Resort is a 10-12 minute walk to the "Strip". A nice quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Not for toddlers”
Reviews.Author: edtpa
Reviews.Content: No lock to keep kids in apartment-unlocks when you turn handle (no chain), gas fireplace was missing glass trim-just steel mesh-so we could not use it, dishwasher leaked-never fixed, disposer kept tripping, couch and chairs ripped, no coffee. Location was OK, 2 bedrm/2 bath nice, just in sad shape.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK for the price, good location, so-so rooms, construction site until well into 2011”
Reviews.Author: t0x
Reviews.Content: We are vegas experts, having visited perhaps 25 times over the last 10-15 years. This was one of our annual trips to watch NFL football with a group of 6. We are used to renting off-strip 2br units in timeshare buildings, like this one. We were attracted to the location (one block behind the Imperial Palace and Harrahs) and the price (about $120 a night for the 2br suite) The 2br we rented clearly had not been renovated/refurnished (old tube TVs, ripped couch, worn kitchen counter). Our friends had a 1br in another building, which had newer counters and flat TVs. Considering this property has only recently become a timeshare (2006), the furnishings we had seemed quite old and dated. The construction seemed cheap, with no soundproofing (you will hear your neighbors). When compared to other, similar units in Vegas, the Summer Bay just does not compare -- the Tahiti Village or Wyndham properties are much, much nicer all-around. If you want anything more than basic off-strip accommodations, go elsewhere. Now, if you are looking for basic accommodations, this place is perfectly adequate. Parking was plentiful. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. 24 hour pool/hot tub access is great. Free wifi worked well. When you turn off the lights, almost every room in Vegas looks the same, including this one.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: colintt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November and were a little apprehensive as to the quality of accommodation and facilities on offer but we had no need to be worried. The rooms were excellent , clean and extremely well furnished. We used the shuttle bus service on a regular basis which proved to be of great use. The timekeeping was excellent and arrived and departed at the scheduled times. We used the local stores for some basic provisions and were able to get up to a 20% discount (they even gave us discount of 3cents a gallon off gas) once we mentioned where we were staying. The only minor criticisms was that there was no public access to the internet (which I understand will be addressed with the new reception area) and that there was access to the hot tub 24 hours a day...which some people accessed at 4 in the morning. Otherwise highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “prefer over Ceasar's Palace”
Reviews.Author: frogmoretiger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ceasar's the first 3 days and Summer Bay the last four days of our stay in Las Vegas. Summer Bay's staff is more helpful,and eager to help. the check in was much better at Summer Bay (at Caesar's we were given the wrong type of room and given the run around four hours the next day, our tower at Caesar's was not much closer than the walk to the strip from off the strip Summer Bay, kitchen at summer bay with coffee supplied, coffee maker at caesar's was four cups for $12,Summer Bay has a free shuttle to 4 stip locations, Fremont, and a store. Of course the rooms are larger at Summer Bay. Most amenities are free at Summer Bay, bring the bank to Caesar's .More marble and lion statues at Caesar's though. I would recommend the slots off the strip and would especially stay away from the luxury casinoes on the strip and also away from the Harrah's affiliated casinoes being that they are tight. Some of the off the strip casinos have shuttles and the buses go everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for our vacation plans”
Reviews.Author: JosefGP
Reviews.Content: This location and resort was convenient for our particular plans in the Las Vegas area. We planned to rent a car and explore Las Vegas area plus a little time on the strip. The convenience of parking the car and walking to a room without going through a casino was our goal. This resort was a good choice for our trip. We were not located near the construction area, so it was very quiet. Our balcony was near the grill area and we used the grill on several occasions. The maintenance people cleaned the grills every day.The room was nice with black, comfortable leather furniture. The kitchen was stocked with useful dishes, pots/pans,etc. We did use the laundry and did not have to worry about running out of clean clothes. The cleaning service was not on a planned schedule, we had to call a few times for room cleaning, but it was taken care of immediately. The shuttle was very convenient to the strip. It is a bit tricky to find the pick up spots until you become familiar with the locations. On the weekends, the buss is crowded.The shuttle drivers and office customer support people are great. It would have been better to walk to the strip,or have a monorail stop nearby. It is not far to walk to the strip, but the walk is in a not too safe looking area. We did walk to the Palms resort and that was not bad. Overall, this was a good stay and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Bay is just ok as time share for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: buckranger
Reviews.Content: We just stayed a week at the Summer Bay Resort Las Vegas Desert Club. It was just ok, nothing special. The staff were nice and the shuttle drivers were very nice and helpful. We stayed in a 2 B/2 Bath unit on the north side in building 15. If you wanted to sleep in, forget it. There is a large lot of construction equipment and plants that they begin work at 4:30 and 5:00 am. Back-up alarms on trucks etc, woke you up. The carpets needed cleaning and they need to get rid of all the dusty fake silk flower arrangements. They were very prompt on their shuttle service to and from the casinos and grocery store. It was no luxury place to stay and I do not see how people buy these units. We used our stay as a gift from a relative. It was nice to have a washer and dryer and full kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “I was very, very disappointed !”
Reviews.Author: melinda57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Summer Bay Resort last year about the same time as an "time share owner". It was so nice. The one bedroom we had was really beautiful. The service was great also. We decided to come back this year but couln't get in as a "timeshare owner" so I booked through Traveocity. I expected to have the same type of room as we had in the previous year.....BOY WAS I WRONG! When we walked in the door I looked in to see that the green leather looking couch arm had a huge gash running down the whole side. It smelled like no one had been in it for a long time. We walked into the bedroom and the carpet was frayed and coming apart all the way down where the tile and carpet met. The carpet was also filthy in the whole unit. The garden tub had large cracks running up from the drain with black stuff inside them. The tub itself was dirty too. The were very few pictures in the unit and just a general lack of amenities. When I called to complain about the room and wanted to move they told me that this was room that they rented to the travel companies and not to the owners! I knew what the rooms looked like because I had been there the year before! I told them this and they asked me if I would like to contact my travel company and I told them I wanted to be moved! They moved us to another room a little better than the frist.....no rips in the sofa and the tub was a little cleaner but I wore my shoes the entire time I was there. They were required to clean the room each day but after the first day they missed 2 days and finally on the 3rd day they showed up to clean the room and leave us some towles. Only becuase I called each day and complained. When I go to a place and stay and go back the next time I expect to find the same caliber of room that I did the last time. I would NEVER stay at this place again even though I could stay as an OWNER and have a beautiful room. NEVER.

Reviews.Title: “You're going to LOVE this resort!”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaDoverDelaware
Reviews.Content: Summer Bay Resorts in Las Vegas is an exceptional place to be your home-away-from-home. Located about 2 long city blocks from the center of The Strip with incredibly easy free shuttle service to and from the resort, there is no need to rent a car to see Vegas. Shuttles run to several different spots on The Strip and also once a day to Freemont Street. The shuttles are free, unbelievably punctual and comfortable. They return you to your unit in this rather large resort which is really nice after you have walked The Strip for hours! There is a "grocery store" run every morning at 8:30 so you can get whatever you need at the local Safeway (Von's). You have an hour to shop and are returned to your unit. The shuttle driver will even help you with your bags. Be sure to give at least a small tip - the drivers are so worth it! We had a one-bedroom unit not facing the pool. It was much quieter and we actually could see the hotels on The Strip from our balcony. The unit was newly redecorated and was beautifully stocked with everything you could possibly need for a relaxing stay. We did not participate in any of the resort activities but know there were plenty offered. The pools (there are 4 or 5) were beautiful with ample seating, tables with umbrellas and nice gas grills available. A couple of tips: Ellis Island is about a ten-minute walk from the resort. There is no shuttle service to it. It's an old and small casino with several great restaurants and ATMs with the lowest fees in Vegas. It was a great place to eat on our first night in Vegas after a long flight. Use the shuttle to the Flamingo Casino as it is the shortest distance from the resort and will put you right in the middle of The Strip. Shuttle runs every hour on the 45 and takes about 5 minutes. It's GREAT! The resort is still waiting for the completion of their new clubhouse that will have a small store, ATMs, a larger pool and fitness center. Definite progress is finally being made and it looks like it will be finished by early next year. Construction in the area is not an inconvenience - just don't be surprised by the entrance to the resort as it is part of the construction. It'll be fabulous when finished. Other good places to eat on somewhat of a budget - California Pizza Kitchen in the Mirage; Cheesecake Factory at the far end of The Forum at Caesars; and Grand Lux in The Venetian. Also in the Venetian there is a wonderful authentic Italian restaurant on the canal that has a $20 3-course lunch that is to die for. In The Wynn right beyond the entrance to their shopping area there is a wonderful inexpensive place for lunch that serves deli sandwiches and pizza but the bonus there is the outside seating that's along a series of beautiful waterfalls with lush tropical planting - really nice. Be sure to catch "Human Nature" show at The Imperial Place - fabulous Motown music by one of the best groups in Vegas. Get 1/2 price tickets at Tics4Tonight. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good people, Poor quality construction”
Reviews.Author: tcornel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in building 19, unit 306 and did not attempt to use resort facilities so these comments relate to the front desk and the unit itself. This is a resort that was remodeled in the last couple years so we expected new or like new units with no problems. Front desk staff was friendly and efficient. Give them 5 stars. This is a third floor unit with 3 flights of steps of 19, 9 and 9 steps. Quite a climb if anyone has even a moderate disability. No elevator. The unit was generally clean except for carpet. Slippers are provided (nice touch) but please use them to avoid getting black feet from the dirty carpet. The lcd tv's are a nice touch as is the fireplace. The door to the second bedroom would not latch. The master vanity door was falling off of its hinges. The springs in the king bed in the master on the window side sagged to the point where you had to lay on the outside edge to keep from feeling like you were going to roll off. The oversized tub in the master was installed without any support beneath it and had a 10 inch crack in it around the drain. We did not use it as a tub but I have my doubts if it would hold water without leaking. The bottom of it flexed each time weight was put on it. The walls in the unit were paper thin with no attempts at sound control. The 2 bedrooms shared a common wall and we carried on a conversation through the wall with our friend in the other bedroom. So there is no privacy in the bedrooms. There are no towel bars in the master bath. Bath towels had to be hung in the closet to dry. Not even a little one for a face cloth. The bath fans are the loudest I can ever remember hearing. They are switched with the light so there is no option to turn them off. Bring a nite light because the bedroom is pitch black with no visibility. The closet wall sticks out by the end of the bed. Without light one can run into the wall very easily. I have a bruised arm to show for it. This resort looks like every possible corner was cut during construction. There are better places to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: beamerfour
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited/stayed at this location for almost a week. The place was clean and very modern, I really enjoyed the location as it was just outside of the main stripe. I would stay there at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt meet expectation as described and shown on the internet.”
Reviews.Author: elise66_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Summer Bay fro the 17th to the 25th of September 2010 as guests of a time share owner. Although we enjoyed our stay immensley and would definetly return, there are one or two points of view we would like make, some good and some not so good. Unfortunately our luggage didnt arrive with us and after making several phone calls and numorous trips to the reception from the friday, evening of arrival, until the sunday morning we were advised to check Mcarran airport lost luggage......only to discover ONE of the missing suitcases..... the other, had in fact been sent to sumer bay on the saturday morning and had actually been in the store room all of the time, but we were informed by reception that it hadnt arrived, apparently it had a tag with the name Barrow on it , one would have thought that someone would have "twigged on" that a guest called Barron is missing a suitcase, and they have an unclaimed suitcase with the name Barrow on it.......................hardly rocket science. The description and photographs on the internet show a gross misrepresentation of the resort .........when I booked, it stated that the work would be finished by june 2010, we were expecting a small store, a coffee/ bistro type cafe and new reception area,only to be greeted by dirty dusty gravel paths and heavy plant machinery.......no where just to "pop out " for breakfast, or a coffee and a chat to other guests................not everyone wants to cook on holiday............ but still like to given a choice. Now a couple of negative comments on the "Housekeeping", the rooms were on the whole, immaculate, but, there was a very greasy strip between the kitchen unit and fridge /freezer, and although I cannot comment on the other units, the glider rails of the sliding door onto the balcony hadnt been cleaned , I would say since the units were built, it is "little" things like these that can contribute to the "Star" rating of a resort.......also the stairway landings could do with a "lick of paint" or a good scrub a little more often. Having said all of that , we have had a fabulous holiday at Summer bay , the units were well furnished , well decorated and immaculately clean, it had lovely bathrooms and showers with an abudance of soft white towels. The beds and bedding were "spot on" and unbelievably comfortable, but, the pillows although nice and soft, should be much bigger. The location is exellent only 10 minutes walk from the strip, if you can cope with the heat, but then there is no need to walk if you dont want to, Summer bay have a very efficient shuttle service. The staff were really nice from all areas of work, the reception, the shuttle drivers, and not forgetting the Trolley cart drivers. We would most certainly return to this resort for a holiday, and I would definetely recommend it to others. OH .........I forgot , We had three huge flat screen TVs in our unit..............brill. Guests Macintosh and Barron England / UK.

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem which will only get better.”
Reviews.Author: geordie22
Reviews.Content: 3rd time in vegas and having stayed at BELLAGIO AND PLANET HOLLYWOOD this place came as a major surprise.It provided us with every facility in the 1bedroom suite with excellent furnishings throughout,full kitchen,wide screen tv.in bedroom and lounge. When the renovations are complete will be a strong alternative to all the big hotels. Would have no hesitation in promoting this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous value and clean without all the commotion of the strip”
Reviews.Author: ColdAndSnowy14
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights recently, 1st-timers at this RCI timeshare resort. We do not own a timeshare, we just found many great reviews on tripadvisor and other sites so we chose to do a weekly rental. Check-in was a breeze, Rokishia was an expert and a conscientious professional. We requested a 3rd floor room with a balcony overlooking the pool. We received exactly that. Beware - the pools are open 24 hours and this is Las Vegas, we had some 4am partygoers on occasion and you will hear them unless you have earplugs. Didn't bother me much, I just snored a little louder to compensate for it. :) My wife had a different perspective, but she did ask for the room by the pool. As far as the room goes, generally very clean and as advertised but with some cheap effects. It should be noted that I called to inquire about an upgrade to a recently renovated room and I was told that would be an additional $50 per night. Considering we were quoted about $95 per night averaged, this would have been a significant addition even though at $145 a night it would have still been a bargain. I did not discuss a room upgrade at check-in. Cheap effects in the room? This is being rather nit-picky, but these would be the flaws I saw, if you will - 1. cheesy dishwasher - it was VERY noisy and the detergent dispenser door did not open once while we were there and we used it on a daily basis 2. old-school TV's - we heard about the flat screen HD's but they were not in our room (my point was that who gives a hoot?, we're in Vegas, baby!) 3. the icemaker in our freezer was broken and it took a slew of people to finally replace it 4. pillows on the bed were the size of couch throw-pillows 5. the vent in the master bath restroom automatically turned on when you turned on the light switch and it was as loud as a lawnmower - which would positively wake up the person that was not getting up to pee 6. the shower stall in the smaller bathroom was aged and permanently soiled plus the temperature of the water was terribly inconsistent, frequently switching from hot to cold and back Now that I covered the bad - everything else with the room was great! Large, mostly very clean and comfortable. The kitchen was a blessing to have. We did not use the washer/dryer. The master bath had a ridiculously gigantic bathtub. It was so large it was gawdy. But it was kind of fun to take a shower, you could dance and spin in there if you wanted to. The closets were many and very large. My one design complaint would be that there is no door separating the shower/sink area from the bedroom in the master bedroom. Daily room service was adequate. The pool was great, although on some days it looked like the filtration system wasn't exactly running well. One day the bins of clean towels were empty and I called the operator to let them know. We then watched as three different staff members looked into the bins and walked away. The fourth eventually restocked the towels about an hour later. I did not use the hot tub, it was 103 degrees one day we were there. Dry heat - baloney. There is music at the pool, but our sound system wasn't working too well, you could just barely hear it. We used the next pool over which had some good tunes playing. There were two large and nice stainless BBQ grills outside the pool. One would not light. A maintenance guy happened to be near me one day so I mentioned it to him. It was never fixed. The grill was a great option to have. We grilled some chicken and hot dogs on a few occasions. Leading me to... The shuttle service is a fantastic perk. The shuttle to the Von's grocery store at 8:30am gets packed and you have to sign up for that one and the shuttle to Fremont St in advance. I think they need to organize the shuttle system a little bit, there were almost always more people than the shuttle could handle. Perhaps they could hand out tickets for each ride? I know that it would require a lot of management. Overall, it works, just not so smoothly every time. There is an arcade and game room which we stopped by to check out. It has a couple of decent pool tables, but we didn't play. I would highly recommend staying at Summer Bay Resorts. The location is a brief walk away from the strip and after a while, you may find that a welcome respite.

Reviews.Title: “Ants in my pants!”
Reviews.Author: Hergules
Reviews.Content: OK The Good - Great rooms, 4-star layouts, new & clean The Bad - Had ants in my bed the first night (switched rooms the next day) - They neglected to mention that the hotel is under renovation and major construction is ongoing - No business center (due to renovations - I was counting on this feature) - On my day of departure, they lost my luggage (they gave it to another guest.... I was lucky that my cell phone # was on the bag and the guest was kind enough to meet me at the airport to return my bag).

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Zebra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I exchanged through RCI and were assigned to a two bedroom B owners unit at Summer Bay in August 2010. Our unit was located on the third floor in building eleven overlooking the pool. Our condo consisted of two bedrooms with king size beds, full equipped kitchen, two full bathrooms, living room, dining area, laundry room with full washer/dryer and balcony. Other amenities included a gas fireplace, DVD player, three large flat screen TV’s, storage area off the balcony, closet organizers/drawers in each walk-in closet, in-wall safe and an abundance amount of storage space. Whoever designed this condo did a great job. The color scheme and décor flowed beautifully from one room to the next. I was really impressed that every detail was carefully thought out and not overly done. The furniture was comfortable, unit was well maintained/clean, layout was great and spacious. I was extremely impressed how meticulously organized everything was. The housekeeping staff really takes pride making sure that everything is in the right place and just so. Construction - The resort does have construction going on in front but that didn’t affect our stay. Once completed, it will be really nice. Check-In – We arrived a few hours early and were able to check-in immediately. There was a line but it moved quickly and efficiently. Since we were assigned a B unit, I asked what units were available at that time. Only one by the pool but luckily it was on the third floor which I hoped for. I was a little hesitant since the pools were opened 24 hours but I didn’t want to drop to a smaller unit with a parking lot view. Since my husband I like to sit outside we preferred the pool unit and hoped for the best. Staff - The staff was amazing and everyone that we dealt with was friendly and accommodating. Their goal was to make sure that you were enjoying your vacation and having a positive experience at the resort. A special thanks to Carla (Customer Care Dept.) who spent a significant amount of time answering my questions prior to our stay. Everyone was great but Carla was exceptional. She went above and beyond her duties and I’m very grateful for all of her help/time. Thanks Carla!!! Pool - The pool was clean and peaceful during the day. No matter what time we went, we were able to obtain a table/chairs with umbrella. At night, however, was a different story. Three nights we had people at the pool partying. The first night I called security around 5am since after two hours I got fed up. Yes its Vegas, yes people want to have fun but there’s a limit. Security did arrive within minutes, it quieted down but the party animals got even and all six of them let out a huge scream before leaving the pool area at 6am. Needless to say we didn’t sleep well. The party crew was back on Saturday and Sunday night so we ended up wearing ear plugs to bed. During the week around 1am there was more yelling going on and this time it was a family with kids. They were running around the pool, jumping in, yelling back/forth to each other, tossing a ball back/forth and were wild. The hopes of sitting on the balcony at night to unwind from the day were impossible. Having the pools open 24 hours is a huge mistake. The units that have a pool view are close to the pool area and if you get a rowdy bunch of people, you aren’t going to sleep well. Since the buildings are in clusters, each with a pool, the noise echoes throughout the area. The resorts on the Strip close their pools at night and I think the same should be done here or by 10pm the latest. Grounds – Very well maintained, nice landscaping and clean. Shuttle - One of the main reasons for staying at this resort was the shuttle service. Taxis are very expensive and since we liked going to the Strip during different times of the day/night this suited us. The drivers are on time so make sure you arrive early at the pick-up location. Once they load up, they are gone and don’t wait. Also if there is a line you may have to wait for a back-up shuttle. We experienced this a few times during our stay and luckily got on the first shuttle. One night the driver contacted the resort and requested for a back-up shuttle ASAP since there was a long line of people at the Flamingo. He informed the guests that due to safety reasons, you were not allowed to stand in the shuttle. The second time the driver let everyone on. People were standing (including kids) from the very back of the shuttle to the door. To me this was very dangerous especially since the driver had to make two sharp turns from the Flamingo back to the resort. Even though he proceeded with extra caution anything could have happened. Walking To The Strip - You are within ten to fifteen minutes of the Strip depending on how fast you walk and what route you take. If you plan on walking back at night take Flamingo Road to Koval Lane. It’s well lit and safer. The other streets that are closer to the resort aren’t well lit, homeless people may be lurking and you need to proceed with caution. Timeshare Presentation - Prior to us leaving for Las Vegas we received a call at home asking to attend a breakfast on Saturday morning for a timeshare presentation. The conversation started with confirming our reservations but then the sales pitch began. I indicated that I didn’t want to commit to anything prior to the vacation and wanted to speak to my husband first. The saleswoman said that she would contact me on Thursday around dinner time. I informed her to not call late since we had to get up at 2am the following day. She called our house four times on Thursday up to 9pm our time. That really annoyed me. My husband had to work late and I didn’t get home until late due to a last minute situation. I understand the timeshare presentation since we’ve gone through that many times during vacation but to obtain calls prior to us leaving… I was not pleased. Of course we received a call in our unit very early Saturday morning but I didn’t bother answering the phone. Even with some issues we still enjoyed staying at Summer Bay and I would go back in the future. This resort has a lot of potential and overall I think they will do extremely well!

Reviews.Title: “What happened here?? Everyone got service BUT me.”
Reviews.Author: Vactionswest
Reviews.Content: While reading the most recent reviews on Summer Bay LV I was wondering why this Cyndi Rieger Director of Sales or anyone else for that matter never contacted or called me during my visit Aug 29 to sept 6 2010--I am an owner and left a list of repaires that needed to be done --nothing--I was told housekeeping would be in Thursday--no one showed up --I reported it fri--still no call back--The pool was so filthy with a scum and grease line on the top tiles--several guests complained about the volume of music at the pool and the dirty tiles--the fellow bringing towels etc was right on top of it and the pool company DESERT OASISS was scubbing it the next day--NOT a good job but better than it was--Having a conversation with the Pool company employee --he said he scrubs it twice a week--NOT true--Time for a New maintance company--SO I would be very interested to see if anyone CALLS or EMails me back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service, good proximity to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Sarah154960
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Summer bay on a RCI certificate we won at a charity auction; and yes, they are undergoing significant construction at the main gate. However, we could not hear it and aside from the non-resort shuttles not wanting to drive into the resort itself, our stay was not affected. We arrived well over three hours early and were able to check in. The one bedroom condo was clean and tidy; the bed was decent, and the kitchen had all the necessities. We were in an owners unit and were pleased. Everything was in good working order and remained that way with the exception of an interruption in water service the Tuesday of our stay. It was quiet, the pool was never crowded, the golf carts came and got us within minutes of calling, and the shuttle service to and from the strip was on time, clean, and friendly. THis is not a five star, but it is decent. Little things like cheap fixtures in the bathroom and the carpet bleeding into the kitchen tile gave them away, but overall as long as you have managed expectations, you will be happy.Don't forget to tip if you are happy. A Big shout out to Tony who was our initial bell man, gave us a stellar recommendation for food and drink at Ellis Island, and everyone else who carted us around. It was definitely a memorable honeymoon, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Cool staff awesome condoms and I got a...”
Reviews.Author: klopez509
Reviews.Content: Cool staff awesome condoms and I got a free upgrade when I got there would stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “"Amazing unsung Jewel of Las Vegas"”
Reviews.Author: happycamper369
Reviews.Content: I recently organized a family reunion at Summer Bay Resort in Las Vegas. We reserved about 10 rooms at the resort. First of all the accomodations were excellent. The amenities in the room were first class. The rooms were spacious and well equiped. I remarked to the management that I could live here comfortably. The staff did all we asked and then some. The facilities we utilized for the reunion were comfortable, and accomodating for a group of 60 people. I can not praise the staff at Summer Bay Resort enough for all the assistance they extended to my family to make the reunion a success. They went the extra mile to accomodate us on several requests. The resort location is easy access to the strip and there is no need for a car as the shuttle service will take you to locations on the strip, downtown and even grocery shopping. This resort is an unsung jewel of Las Vegas that more people need to know about. I look forward to my next stay and suggest anyone looking for a great resort to stay at and have a family reunion at or any event that this is the place to go. What I liked best was how friendly and helpful the satff was. What I like least was that the reception building and main entrance were not completed yet (but that will be remedied by the end of 2010)

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: miktee1
Reviews.Content: My youngest daughter has never been to Las Vegas. But from all the she heard from Mom and Dad over the years, she just knew she had to get married there. That said we headed for my time share at Summers Bay. I have been an owner for many years, back even before it wad Ramada. Needless to say, the service was, as always great, I took 8 members of my family out with me for the wedding. And each used a piece of my time, they all had a wonderful time. I know in time when all the work is completed it is going to be even better... I always expect better each time I return, and I have never been disappointed....Mike Tarallo ::::owner since the early 90's

Reviews.Title: “New condos great - still construction!”
Reviews.Author: canEHdiancouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights & when we checked in the 1st night, we were given an older 1 bedroom suite - older furnish, old-school tv, small kitchen etc. We called down to the front desk & asked for an upgrade (& basically said if we didn't get one, we were going to a hotel on the strip)...they upgraded us to a renovated/new 1 bedroom suite which was wayyy nicer! Way better kitchen, 2 flatscreen big tvs, etc. We were happy with the room. The resort itself is still under construction...while it didn't really phase us too much (although we would have liked a bigger pool, which apparently is coming soon), it does not look nice at all from the road & seeing it at 1st, we really wondered what we had gotten ourselves into..but it turned out good. The pools are 24 hours (we used them), there are bbqs (never used), full kitchen (saved us lots of money), free shuttle buses to the strip, grocery store etc, free golf carts around the resort to help you get around etc....while the resort itself is not super fancy, apparently they are going to make it better...I was happy with our stay, but we also didn't pay for it (timeshare)...it was also a close walk to the strip - we walked several times and it was fine - less than 10 minutes...if you go, make sure you get an upgraded room...

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: nanasally
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at this resort for one week. The unit was very spacious with big comfortable beds, nice big closets, and a huge tub. Really close to the strip but quiet. Security at the gates, so felt very safe. Found the Target, Albertsons, and Vons nearby. Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste money on the big hotels on the strip”
Reviews.Author: tammy033
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply amazing. There was shuttle service to certain parts of Vegas every two hours till midnight so why waste the money on the big hotels? Our suite was huge, with all the amenities you need down to ice in the icebox and detergent above the washing machine in the porch. Fully equipped kitchen (not kitchenette) - bedroom and living room, huge jacuzzi bath, all the towels you could need and always you could ask for more. We would definitely recommend staying there when in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “This place is AMAZING and we don't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: ARodman
Reviews.Content: Wow. I read MANY reviews before deciding to stay here. We've been here for the past 5 days and leave Thursday. This place is beautiful--the grounds are so well maintained. The staff are VERY friendly, the pools are great. Yes, there is construction when you pull in, but who cares! Our suite is a 2 bedroom. Everything works great and was super clean when we checked in. From the moment we walked in our whole family was in awwwwwe! We are traveling with 2 teenages and 2 kids about 10 and they are having a blast. We've not had one single problem with anything since we've been here and really don't want to go back home! Definitely chose this place. It's less than 5 minutes from the strip, but far enough away for peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: stammie1
Reviews.Content: Resort was more like apartments converted into a timeshare destination. We drove from Tucson and had no problem finding the resort. Even though some front end construction was going on it was not a distraction. We parked a good size van under the covered parking and did not have to drive once while in Vegas. We opted for a room on the 3rd floor and we had a great view of the pool from the covered patio area. The room was amazing, when we first walked thru we thought the second bedroom was actually the master suite because it was so nice! The entire two bedroom unit was furnished and decorated very upscale. There is LCD t.v.s in each bedroom plus of course, the living room. The kitchen had every possible appliance you could want. There were IPOD docking stations in each of the rooms and WIFI as well. The master bedroom had a giant bathtub/shower so definitely throw your bath stuff into your luggage! Everyone slept very well and comfortable including my 16 year old who slept on the couch. It is a pull out but he slept on the couch itself which he found to be more comfortable. The resort offers a very extensive shuttle service which takes you to major stops on the strip, Freemont street and the supermarket. Once we were dropped off at the Flamingo, which is closest stop, we bought monorail tickets ($12 each) which takes you to each end of the strip with 7 or so stops in between. We only had to cab it three times costing us less than $30. The resort shuttle was always there for drop off and pick up. Pool is open 24 hours although crowded during the day, night was very quiet. The staff was accomodating and when we checked in she gave us a preference to 2nd or 3rd floor and offered us the pool view which was also by the arcade, which she thought my 3 teenage boys would like. After searching the internet for show tickets to Le Reve we ended up calling the concierge at the resort we found the least expensive tickets ($97 for premium seating) offered. The show was amazing...different review... Oh yea, the location of Summer Bay Resorts was about a half mile off the strip, probably half way between Stratosphere and MGM. Excellent location. So if you happen to miss the resort shuttle times to take you back, you just get off the monorail at Flamingo and it is about a $5.50 cab ride to resort. (or less) The only downside to any of this was we could only stay from Friday to Sunday...we were unable to use the entire week. We were so bummed after we got there to know that we had to leave such a cool place so soon. Thank you Summer Bay for a very nice weekend getaway with my family! We will be back and we will stay longer! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing, quiet, beautiful place that will only get better!”
Reviews.Author: educ8or15yrs
Reviews.Content: Our arrival didn't start out well. We had been told that we might be able to check in early, but they couldn't tell us over the phone whether our place was ready. Annoying, but unavoidable. I stood in line for about twenty minutes to "check in" but I was not given keys (not really checking in, then, right?). I was told I would be called when our two bedroom unit was ready. Check in was at 4, so when 3:30 came around and no one had called me, I called them. I was told they had called when the unit was ready. Lie. I had no "missed calls" on my cell phone. We went to the resort and I then had to stand in line for ANOTHER twenty minutes to get our keys. There, I was told they had gotten too busy to call me. I was fuming. Of course they were busy. I waited in line twice for a LONG time EACH time. I knew they were busy! They, too, knew they were busy; so why tell me they will call? Why tell me to come in to find out if our unit was ready? Why not just tell me, "Ma'am, we're sorry, but check in is at 4." I would have preferred that IMMEASURABLY compared to the wasted time we spent trying to get into the condo early. It wasn't just the 40 minutes spent in line, but also the three hours that we spent trying to stay close to the resort so that we would be able to go there quickly and get settled when it was available. However, when I saw the condo, I quickly calmed down, and I can honestly say that checking in was the only real frustration we had all week. About a week prior to our arrival, I had requested a pool-side room on the first floor, and that was exaclty what we got. It was newly remodeled and clean. It was exaclty what I saw in someone else's review pictures. One of the reasons we chose Summer Bay was because of the 24 hour pool, and we loved it! I was afraid we sacrificed quiet for convenience, but I was surprised how quiet it was. Even when people were swimming and being loud at 2 or 3 in the morning, we heard nothing in the bedrooms. (We were swimming with them and thought we would be disturbed by them when we went in, but happily, we couldn't even tell they were out there.) One negative thing about the pool was that it was cloudy at times. Another negative was that all guests didn't keep their long hair in ponytails, so frequently we fished stray hairs out of the water. Gross, but not that big of a deal. A better filter could have solved both problems, I think. The last negative about the pool was that the chemicals gave four out of six of us sores on the bottom of our feet. The four who spent a lot of time in the pool had places on the bottom of their toes where the skin was wearing away. Some were red, others actually bled. I can only figure the chemicals caused it. My youngest, a two year old, and I were the only ones not affected, but I assume that was because we didn't spend almost all day every day in the pool. My three older boys just put Band-Aids on the affected toes and continued to swim. Typical boys, not fazed at all. We had our car, so we loved the shaded parking spaces. When Summer Bay got more guests, we sometimes had to park farther away and in the sun, but most of the time, we were only a short distance from our door. This made taking in groceries very convenient! (Of course, the full kitchen made USING the groceries even more convenient. :) The golf cart and shuttle service looked good, but I was glad we had our car, mostly because of the kids. We didn't have our rooftop carrier on, fortunately; otherwise, we wouldn't have fit under the car port. The entrance construction detracted slightly from our stay, but we were in building 19, so we didn't see any of it from our "pod". The main pool is going to be spectacular when it's done. Someone in another review complained that the walk to the Strip was 20 minutes and looked like a war zone. The block (yes, only one block) was fenced off and undeveloped, but it wasn't a "war zone" and it took us (with four kids, one of whom was a slow-walking six year old) only 10 minutes to get to the Flamingo. We belong to a vacation club, so we knew not to expect maid service daily. What's the big deal about making your own bed on vacation? I would rather do that instead of looking at the mess and hoping the maid comes soon. (Then again, I also prefer to be able to clean as we go anyway. I love having a broom and vacuum to keep the place tidy. With four boys, lots of things fall on the floor.) We didn't really need her when she came mid-week, but it was nice to get the floors washed. The washer and dryer in the unit were wonderful, and I used them daily. Knowing these were there, I was able to pack lightly on clothes, which was nice. All things considered, we loved our stay so much that we extended it by one day (taking a three day drive and turning it into a two day drive). We probably would have extended out stay even more days, but my husband absolutely had to be at work Monday morning. Once the construction is done, it will truly be the PERFECT place to stay (if you don't want to be on the Strip). We loved it, and if we ever go back to Vegas, we will stay at Summer Bay. RECOMMENDATIONS: 1. Request a remodeled room. Pay the extra if you have to; it's worth it. (Vacation club or time-share owners always get the remodeled units.) 2. Request to be near the workout room if that matters to you. It's open 24 hours. It's okay for a vacation place. It's not the gym, but it's good enough. 3. Get Summer Bay's comprehensive list of things to do in Vegas. They have a list of free things to do as well as a list of "not free" activities. Both lists are helpful and accurate. We stayed very busy without ever stepping in a casino to gamble (we spent a lot of time walking through them, though!) 4. Go to Hoover Dam. The Generator Tour was great, and the Dam Tour was better (but kids 8 and under aren't permitted because of their size and the potential for them to fall through a few small openings). The tours are pricey, but worth it. 5. Eat as many meals at Ellis Island as you can. What they save on decor, they more than make up for in portions and taste. Their specials are delicious and ridiculously inexpensive. It's just down the street from Summer Bay (on Kovol). Don't be turned off by how seedy it looks. 6. If you have young kids, make room to pack the double stroller. Our 14 year old was able to do all the walking with no problem, but our 10 year old and 6 year old would have appreciated taking turns in the open seat of our double stroller if we had had it. As it was, only the 2 year old got a free ride in the umbrella stroller. 7. Pack dark shoes/sandals/flip-flops. The streets are filthy and our shoes quickly looked disgusting with all the walking we were doing. (Only the "baby" had white gym shoes when we left because he was always riding in stroller.) 8. If you don't have a car, get the three day pass to the Monorail. Between that and the shuttle you will get anywhere easily. 9. Don't waste your money on the gondola ride at the Venetian. It was short and the gondolier never stopped talking, giving tourism advice. It was much more fun to watch from the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let the Construction Bother You”
Reviews.Author: Fromak
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night while on a trip through the Southwest. Had to stop and check in with a security guard before entering the premises. Was a little daunting at first but help keeps unwanted individuals out. When you enter the resort, there is a lot of construction going on as many reviewers have noted. A new entry way and club house are being constructed and there is construction material stored under carports and adjacent to the driveways but this resort has a lot to offer. The people are very helpful, the location is great, and the accomodations are excellent. The front desk person checked us in promptly and was extremely helpful, expecially noting the shuttle service that was available. She pointed out that there was a covered area just outside the door where the suttle would pick you up and provided us with a schedule with the pick up times for the various locations. Our unit was in building nine towards the back. The unit was one of their rental units so it did not have the upgrades that many reviewers talked about, but it was exteremely clean and very comfortable. We decided to drive to the casinos rather than take the shuttle. If you drive a couple blocks north on Koval, you can park in the Harrah's or Venetian's parking garages and have easy access to Harrah's, Venetian, Treasure Island, Mirage, and other casinos in the area. Check out was quick and easy. The resort is a couple of blocks east of Interstate 15 gving you easy access to go south to Hoover Dam and the Grand Canyon or north to Zion and Bryce Canyon Natl Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful time at Summer Bay!”
Reviews.Author: RS626
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas for our honeymoon and stayed at Summer Bay from June 27-July 3. Once the woman at the front desk found out we were on our honeymoon we got upgraded to a deluxe suite and were able to check in right away! We were very impressed with our room, which has a complete kitchen, 2 big screen tv's, plenty of closet space, a huge bathtub, and a washer/dryer. We were on the ground floor, and never heard any noise from any of the upstairs apartments, it was great. There is some construction going on, but we were gone most of the day so we never heard any noise from it, and our building was also in the back of the property. I believe they are building a deli/convenience store, which will be really nice to have right on the property. There are complimentary shuttles that run pretty frequently and drop you off at 3 different points on the strip. I believe the stops are the Tropicana, Flamingo, and Stratosphere/Circus Circus. The shuttles were never late, and saved us a fortune on taxis! If you don't want to walk to the front of the building where the shuttles you are, you can call for a bellman, and they will take you to the front. They always came quickly when we called, sometimes only 2 or 3 minutes after we hung up the phone! There is complimentary coffee available, which we had every morning before getting on the shuttle! There is a dvd kiosk where you can rent movies, and they had a pretty good selection. Overall we had a fantastic time at Summer Bay, and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fifth trip to Vegas, best one yet”
Reviews.Author: Zena90
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at Summer Bay Resort May 13-17th. It was a girl's getaway weekend and this resort is available through my timeshare. It is about 1 1/2 blocks away from the strip, but there is a shuttle that runs about every 30-60 minutes. We had a two BR/ two bath condo and kitchen/living room. It was very nice, and as a diva who spends alot of time primping, it was great for each of us to have our own bathroom. My tub was so big I could have fit three people in it. (what happens in Vegas...) We went rock climbing one day, chilled at the pool one day--which was very nice--plenty of towels and nice loungers. The staff was fantastic--picking us up in the golf cart whenever we needed to get to the main building. I heard they are still building a sandwich shop ?and sundries-type store on the property, that will be really nice to have when completed. We spent our nights at O'Shea's and the Carnaval Bar. My only grievance is that the shuttle stops running around midnight---who goes home at midnight in Vegas???!!! Not us girls.!! Luckily, we were able to find a couple of protective chaperones to guide us back.... I would definitely stay here again. XOX Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the Prices. Roomy, clean and very close to the strip.”
Reviews.Author: ledd_16
Reviews.Content: Excellent for the prices we paid. We have 4 families with young children, teenager and seniors, stayed in 2-2 kings bed, w/sofa bed units. Very nice, roomy, clean and very comfortable. We have plenty of towels, and love their Mango shampoo and lotion. We didn't mind about the 10am check out. We arrived at 10am and Front desk allowed us to check in early that was Very nice of them. The staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Dont let the building work put you off”
Reviews.Author: LellyScotland
Reviews.Content: After reading several other reviews, I expected the entrance to look a bit of a bomb site. Dont let this put you off as our room was absolutely lovely! It was so nicely furnished and the kitchen had everything you could possibly need. You have your own washing machine and tumble dryer which was free. Read other reviews as they mention alot of the other great things about these rooms. The shuttle service was excellent, the buses run all day to several different destinations in Vegas and back to the Resort, its worth using but you have to be on time, if they are early they dont wait. Get to the pick up point at least 5 - 10 mins early. I do feel for the reviewer who had things stolen from his room and I think he/she was generous with their scores, it would have really put me off staying here, but this does seem like a one off. But personally if I ever went to Las Vegas again, I would go back to this resort, I cant really think of anything I didnt like, my only criticism I could give was that we only had a cleaner come on the 4th day of our stay, but we did have extra towels in the cupboards. The Welcome pack in your room does explain that cleaners dont come every day and only come half way through your stay. We were there for 6 days and expected the cleaner to come on the third day. Instead she came on the 4th day while we were having our lunch. She couldnt speak any english so I had to show her a pile of towels so we could have some fresh ones. Because she arrived when we were eating I told her not to bother doing the room. Also they dont change your sheets either unless you ring up reception and ask for clean sheets. No real problem, just a small criticism.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: tuffgirlreno
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews on this place, I was nervous. My husband and I, had flown my parents out for a 5 day trip for some gambling, golf, and lounging poolside. We were looking for a place not in a casino, that had at least 2 bedrooms and 2 baths that we could make a few meals in. My husband stumbled across Summer Bay on the internet of course. we paid $774.00 USD. We checked in on Monday and out on Saturday morning. Check-in was fairly simple.
