We actually were able to check in fairly early (noon), as we had to unload our stuff then go to the airport and pick up my parents. The lady helping us was nice and gave a room on the second floor. My parents are smokers, so I asked for a 1st floor room, so they wouldn't have to runup and down the stairs for a smoke. She said no problem and gave us a 1st floor room. They do hold a $100 security deposit on a credit card, which is understandable. Another guest who was checking in, didn't like the idea, and was arguing with the staff about it. Whlle walking back out from the registration desk, we were asked to participate in their time share pitch. We signed up as they offered a $100.00 gift card and show tickets, but more on that later. Our 2 bedroom place was pretty spacious. The bedrooms were on opposite ends of the "condo" it had a full size refrigerator, dishwasher, and stove, along with a washer and dryer. The internet ad advertised plasma tv's, but we had standard 27 inch tv's in each bedroom and one in the living room. Basic dishes and pots and pans were provided. They beds were fairly comfortable. The furniture in the living room was torn up a little. They was a small patio, with a table and plastic chairs. The outside table had a huge burn hole in the center of it. My husband took pictures of everything. No one came to the room to do a walk through with us. The "master" bedroom had a huge bathtub in it. 4 people could easily sit in it. but the tub had a weird color to it, they made it hard to tell if it was clean. The other bathroom was a little scarier. It was just a shower unit. The door on the shower was gross. It looked as if it was pulled from another apartment and the mold was painted over and re-hung in this bathroom. A vacuum and broom were provided in the place for clean up. I wished they would have had a swiffer wet jet or something similar. they did come in every day and refresh towels and start the dishwasher for you, if you needed it. They also did a quick clean up of the bathrooms. The pool and hot tub were a 1 minute walk away from our room. They were both very clean. Towels were provided there. It wasn't over crowded at any of the times we were there. Water was decent in the pool and hot in the hot tub. We did attend the time share presentation. The lady who was our salesperson, was from Mexico. She spoke English fairly well, but we still had trouble understanding some of her pronounciations. The presentation took about 1 and 1/2 hours. We had the opportunity to tour the new condos on the property. They were much nicer looking and had all of the ammenities shown on the website. We said no after the presentation, and only had to say no to one more sales person after our original lady. We received the $100 Visa gift card and a packet of coupons from the front desk. Here's a list of what I didn't like. Noise! The 1st morning the garbage dumpsters were picked up at 6am and it sounded as if they were right outside the window. Another morning, the workers were shoveling stones/gravel right outside our bedroom window, for what seemed like an hour. I ran the dishwasher one night after we went to bed. It was loud! I recommend turning it on, only if you aren't in the room. The hot water took forever to get hot in our shower. There were several times, that I didn't even turn the cold faucet on, because the water was luke warm. We didn't have both showers going at the same time, and we kept shower times down to a minimum. Pillows. There were 3 for each bed. But, everyone in our group is a pillow hog, and needs at least 3 per person. (we brought a couple from home). The sliding door to the patio. It seemed to weigh 1,000 pounds and took two hands to push or pull it. The screen was also torn. Luckily it seemed there weren't many bugs. Things I liked. There was a guard at the main entrance every time we came in or out of the property. The washer and dryer was really nice. They also provided soap and dryer sheets. The kitchen, we were able to have breakfast in our pajamas and take our time to get ready for the day. Grills, there are gas grills around the property. We took advantage of it and had steaks one night. It wasn't bad for the money, after seeing the new condos, obviously I would much rather have stayed in one of those. If you get a new one, I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and meet our needs just fine”
Reviews.Author: runmommierun
Reviews.Content: This off the strip place is a great place to stay if you want to escape the hustle of the strip of Vegas. We had no problem driving to a nearby casino and parking and then having our Vegas fun. It is quite a walk if you were to walk though. They do offer a free shuttle throughout the day (ending at midnight). They are still under construction but it was never a problem for us. Our room was comfortable and nice. The pool was relaxing and the music playing was an added bonus. They offer a ton of things for kids during the day. You can rent a movie and they even have free popcorn. They are starting to add services such as a full spa. We enjoyed having a fridge and kitchen (well appointed at that). The staff was great and friendly. Beds were super, super comfy and clean. The price was right and we will put it on our to-go-back list.

Reviews.Title: “WAY Better than what I had expected! =D”
Reviews.Author: MizzJosie
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews for this hotel i was kind of scared but it was a last minute booking and the price was great for a two bedroom suite. Although the entrance is still under construction, the service was great, the staff was very nice and our room was GREAT & BEAUTIFUL! All of our friends were amazed at how nice it was and all the service included! washer & drywer, iron & board, soap dish, slippers etc. The pool is open 24 hrs which was awesome for us but the only bad thing was the jacuzzi was luke warm, which made it not much warmer than the pool!

Reviews.Title: “My room was BROKEN INTO on 18 May 2010”
Reviews.Author: skwierczynski
Reviews.Content: My room was broken into while I was there the week of 16 – 23 May 2010 (Bldg 12 Room 301). Someone with a 3rd key came into my room while I was asleep at 1:00am and stole close to $500 of items from my nightstand. Items stolen included rental car keys, credit cards, cash, $200 MP3 player and my driver’s license. It cost me $145 to replace rental car keys. It’s obvious it was an “INSIDE JOB” but the security guards and Summer Bay Management were not very helpful and they didn’t seem to care. The security manager did print out a log of entry times into my room and there were a lot of suspicious entry times. But the security manager didn’t take it to the next level to see what was going on and didn’t seem to care. The security manager also told me that a 3rd person received a key on the 2nd day of our stay. That was odd because I never went to the office after I checked-in. And when I questioned the security guy about the issuance of the 3rd key he didn’t seem to care. The day after my room was broken into I set some boobie traps in the room before we went out. When we returned all the boobie traps were broken and it appeared there was someone checking our SAFE every time we exited our room. I was TERRIFIED the last 3 nights I stayed in Summer Bay. I stayed at Summer Bay as part of a military timeshare package (AFVC). Yes, I served my country for 20 years and got this great benefit to stay at Summer Bay for only $329 for an entire week. But after I got jacked it destroyed my entire vacation. I strongly encourage anyone who plans to stay at Summer Bay to secure there belongings at all times (even when sleeping). There are no security cameras on the property and security is similar to “Barney and Fife”. And also beware that you are being watched. Either the security guards are breaking into rooms or housekeeping maids when you let your guard down.

Reviews.Title: “All they could and more - Outstanding. May 6-12”
Reviews.Author: spudislandPEICanada
Reviews.Content: We loved it. This is our 3rd time to Vegas (first time staying here) and hubbie wants to go back to Summer Bay. How can you go wrong? Maybe we had the luck of the draw. Upon arrival we did see a bit of construction (messy front entrance-not appealing to some) but so what. It is just to make things better for everyone. Checked in at noon. No problem. They gave us our room # and I asked (nicely) to see a map of the property. I knew from TA that the pools were open 24 hrs so we didn't want over the pool. I asked if we could have Bldg 10, second floor and was it updated? They said yes,yes, and yes. They gave us a pass to use if we were walking in and out as the gate to property as security 24 hours. If you come in a cab they question you...which is fine by me. Just security for me. We were told Expedia, Air Canada ect get the rooms not upgraded. So we were lucky. From what I could see it wouldn't make that much difference. The layout is the same. OK, at check in they give you a layout of property, shuttle times, and tell you if you need to go from your room to front of property to call and they send down a golf car to pick you up. We didn't need this but if you have any mobility problems it would be great. Kitchen: - Walk into room...hum, awesome! Not big...not as big as I expected. But great. The usual, fridge (ice-maker), stove, over stove microwave, dishwasher, baking bowls, pot and pans, oven mitts and a starter pack...coffee ect. The beautiful glass table and chairs are a bit to big for the kitchen especially to get into the fridge. You could just push to side a bit. The fridge kept our oj, beer and ice cream just the right temp. Call for a number for wireless internet. Living Room: Open to kitchen, sofa probably a pull out but didn't check. It was comfie. Fireplace...why not, it is Vegas. They do have restrictions on when it can be turned on, time of year and so on. Maybe Nov-May, don't quote me here, forget what I read about it in the manual in living room. I must say it was one of the most detailed resort manual I have ever had in a room. SHOOT, almost forgot...Hugh flat screen, Hubbie loved it. The sound system (radio) was great. I am not very techinal but is was so clear. We often just had music playing. DVD player as well. Closet: Walk-in, quite a few hangers, place to store luggage, 4 draws, and a on the wall safe,it held my netbook and several other things. Bathroom: Toilet separate, one sink, lots of towels, toilet paper ect. once I found them, open doors under the sink...there they are. The hand soap and shampoos are VERY scented so if you have any allergies to scent...be careful. We thought the TV was big...nothing compared to the but. It was HUGH. No jets, that is ok. It is very long and very very wide. Bedroom: Big...king bed. Two night stands. Alarm clock. Two windows, nicely draped. Oh, guess what...ANOTHER big flat screen. I don't think we even turned it on. Balcony: Small but functional. We could see Harrahs, Wynn ect from it. One table, 2 chairs. I think the two bedrooms have a bigger balcony. I did see larger ones but never asked. It is a smoke free room property. You use the balcony if you smoke. Washer/Dryer: So neat. Full size in a room off your balcony. Iron and ironing board. Starter pack included. Pools: Gated entrance to pool. Right now there is 4. They are not big but do the job. Each pool has a great hot tub. Timer for the hot tub is on the wall by the bathrooms, I don't think alot of people know this. They place pools in each quarter section so you don't have far to walk. First pool we went to one day was full so went to the next pool, maybe 5minute walk. All have bathrooms and towels. You put your towel in laundry basket when you leave the pool. New towels are in a bench type seat. Grocery Shopping: Every morning at 8:30 sharp...I think every day of the week...be 10 minutes early...they take you to Vons grocery store and pick you up in 1 hrs time- sharp. Beer, wine, bread, deli, cookies, lots of ice cream, water, fruit...hours gone. Now, you could cook all your meals but we want breakfast and maybe lunch, so that is what we bought. Shuttle: To many,many places on the strip. Times and places are posted on a schedule you can put in your purse. They go to Freemont street, drop you off anf pick you up in 4hrs time. Final Note: Found the pools quiet but didn't go around them at night time. Probably forgot much...but this place has it all for us early mid 50 couple, can't wait to go back. It is a time-share property. We were asked on check-in if we would like to do the tour and be offered $100.00. We said no thank-you and never heard any more about it. This is our 3rd time to Vegas. Have never stayed on strip. We like coming back to quiet time and like a room with space, fridge, balcony and coffee pot and a great price. I couldn't find a negative...unless leaving counts. Actually, internet was spotty the last couple of days. Took pictures but that might take another week to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great layout for relaxation.”
Reviews.Author: eggtmt
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 nights here booking thru RCI as an exchange week. The condo was very well laid out and extremely clean. We had a 2 BR, (both rooms had king beds & a pullout couch in LR) Walk in closets, 2 BA unit in building 21 on the 3rd floor. This building was at the far end of the resort, less than a five minute walk to the front desk or you could call the shuttle anytime to pick you up. The unit had a nice balcony, 3 TV's, DVR player, fully equipped kitchen & washer and dryer. The baths were stocked with soap, shampoo and conditioner. The kitchen had dishwashing detergent, plenty of paper towels, laundry detergent, salt & pepper and a starter pack of coffee. The maid came by mid week and replenished everything. We did not mind being on the 3rd floor but there is no elevator so ask for 1st floor if stairs are a problem. Our building had wireless service and we used out laptops and ITouch no problem. Our location had a pool very close and also an outside and inside hot tub. The pool was very clean and one thing I really liked was that it got sun all day. I have been some places where the buildings block the sun for most of the day. There were 2 grills outside the pool area and we cooked out twice. Plenty of places to sit outside. The front entrance is under construction (no work done while we were there) and doesn't look great but you only pass thru on your way in and out. Who really cares? We did do a tour and were told that the reason no work is being done is because some work was done over a water main and things have to be reconfigured before they can move forward. I would not want a room looking over the construction area but for the right price I could get past it. The tour was informative and took about 2 hours. The sales rep we had was good and did not pressure us, just asked us to listen with an open mind. They gave us a $100 visa card and Summer Bay at the desk gave us a bunch of coupons for shows, ( I think most of those deals we could have got anywhere without doing a tour) The shuttle service at the resort was excellent. The drivers were very friendly and accomodating. The shuttles ran from around 9am till midnight. We usually walked one way and took the shuttle the other way. It is less than a 10 minute walk to Harrah's, sidewalk most of the way. I reccomend not wearing heels and you will be fine, it is fairly well lit. All the staff we met were very friendly. One time we did not get picked up at our building on schedule and the golf cart driver who did pick us up, grabbed a shuttle bus and brought us to our destinantion. That is good service. The pool area was always very clean and there were plenty of towels at all times. The pool and hot tubs are open 24 hours which is great. When the work gets done here we probably won't be able to exchange, as it will be fully booked at all times. I would go back again if I had the chance. It was nice to be a short walk from the casinos and not feel pressured to gamble at all times. Being steps from a pool was a huge plus. Everything we needed was close by. We rented a car for the week but didn't really need it. We drove to Zion Canyon one day and that was spectacular. If we did not take that trip I would not have gotten a car. the shuttle service from the airport is easier than taking a shuttle to the rental area to pick up a car. Our entire family really liked this resort and had a great week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation, Loved it”
Reviews.Author: kar1961
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas with my 2 children (22 & 24). It was my first time for booking through RCI and was not sure what I was doing. I had seen they where doing construction, but was not to worried about it. The resort was wonderful if you overlook the first site of the construction. We where very happy with our condo. The walk to the strip during the day is fine, you need to take advantage of the resorts shuttle service after dark. Everyone at the resort was very helpful and friendly. If you are going to take in a show try and make the Marc Sarvard show at the V theater in the Miracle Mile shopping center. Very good show. We would stay at the resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, total value for money”
Reviews.Author: Maanya
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a budget trip to Vegas and so the hotel pricing had to be low. I was booking only 3 weeks in advance so the deals weren't great. We wanted a nice place that was also close to the action on the Strip as well as low priced as well as well reviewed. Tall order, huh? But Summer Bay matched all our expectations and we were pleasantly surprised with the spacious living room and kitchenette. An added bonus was the massive twin tub!! All in all, we had a wonderful stay, thanks to Summer Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Do you like living on a construction site?”
Reviews.Author: gasmanj
Reviews.Content: First view of the place was a fenced off construction zone. The entire place was a disaster area. The view outside of the resort was a desolate wasteland filled with homeless people and criminals. It may be close to the strip, but walking to the strip is like walking through a minefield, "Do at your own risk." Upon arrival, we were hit with a $70 cleaning fee and the room was not cleaned once. We also requested a room near a pool. The nearest functioning pool was 300 yards away and we had a nice view of a parking lot. Of course, the desk clerks were useless and astounded that we were not satisfied. There is no place within two miles to get anything to drink. I paid a homeless man to go to the gas station for me and he delivered a six pack to my room. Apparently he did not require security clearance. I also informed the front desk of this as I checked out after my twenty four hours of torture at this place. They said nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Much higher end than the previous buildings but not quite there yet.”
Reviews.Author: onlywaytogo
Reviews.Content: I thought the growing pains would have been resolved by now but a couple of amenities were not available or broken. That said the location is still one of the best and the rooms are much better than the old buildings. Don't be put off - I would recommend staying - just be ready for a couple of little annoyances - broken patio door rollers, bbqs not working, one of the hot tubs out for repair, wifi problems, all little things that can be overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be when you need a break from the 'strip'.”
Reviews.Author: matbud
Reviews.Content: Although the resort entrance and clubhouse are still under construction, it in no way affected service or comfort (they just started to construct the clubhouse). The shuttle service is incredible. Golf carts to take you from the room to the front, small busses to take you to various points on the strip every hour, freemont street at night, and even a grocery store in the morning. The rooms were clean, modern, and very comfortable. The pool areas are excellent as well, with lots of lounge chairs, clean washrooms, great spa, heated pool, open 24hrs., music until 10pm, bbqs, picnic cabbanas, and no problem enjoying beverages (in non breakable containers of course). The Wi-Fi internet was difficult to get connected to, but we were informed on the info sheet that it still was being created, so it was not a surprise we had troubles. The resort is located two streets behind Imperial Palace, so about 10 min walk to the strip. You have to cross vacant land (still on a sidewalk and street), and the vacant land is a little messy, and can be a little intimidating, but no problems with it. My wife and I were very happy with the resort, and felt it was a great place to hang out while we were taking a break from the other activities that Vegas has to offer, and will return again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “You're in Vegas, you're here to gamble, it's a gamble to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: davidb6077
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Summer Bay in Vegas for 8 nights as part of a wedding/vacation trip. Should have listened to the negative reviews. The place is under construction which we didn't have a problem with, although in the 9 days we were there, there was no construction taking place. We were traveling with my daughter who has food allergies and a place to stay with a kitchen sounded ideal so we could monitor her food. We landed early, did our grocery shopping and checked in. The setup looked really nice. However after being in the room for a while we were able to tell how dirty the room was. The kitchen counters were discolored from not being cleaned, the ice maker didn't work, the hot water faucet in the shower didn't work, bulbs burnt out in the kitchen and a leak under the garbage disposal in the kitchen. All were fixed except the burnt out lights in the kitchen and the cleaning of the room. Housekeeping did a really lousy job cleaning. They didn't even make the beds, we did! The rug in the living area was filthy. The bottoms of my wife's socks were black after walking around for 10 minutes. The rollout couch was a joke. My daughter usually sleeps on a rollout queen when we travel together but this sleeper was a joke. We complained, our complaints were written down, but nothing was done. We explored the grounds one day with some friends looking for a gas grill that worked. Three out of the four we tried, didn't work. Walking over to the office one morning we overheard the people in front of us with some of the same complaints we had. They have stayed there the past few years and said his was the last time they would stay there. If we had not gone grocery shopping for the week we were there, we would have checked out and moved to a hotel on the strip. So if your feeling lucky, and your draw building 9 room 210, craps you lose.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DisneyLondon
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the Summer Bay Resort and had booked a 7 night stay through a RCI Exchange and then a further stay with a hotel booking company. Once we checked in the front desk clerk was able to combine both bookings so that we could stay in the same apartment for the whole week. That level of customer service shone through during our whole stay - from the front gate security, to housekeeping to the staff who offered you lifts in their gold carts. The helpfulness of the staff is one of the resorts best qualities! We were allocated an apartment towards the back of the resort and it was very peaceful. Just steps away from a lovely pool surrounded by lush landscaping. The apartment had everything you could want and need on a holiday including some complimentary slippers that we used around the pool. An easy 10 minute walk to the Strip but the resort also offered a free shuttle to various drop off points through out the day. Building work is still going on but did not impact on our stay at all. We infact had to extend our stay as our flight home was cancelled due to the Volcano in Iceland and once again the staff impressed us with their customer service - checked out as planned and then checked into our new apartmment by 10am - great service. We have been to Vegas many times and have now found our "home from home" - we look forward to returning. We really felt it was a hidden oasis away from the hustle and bustle of The Strip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: FehrLadyAllentown_PA
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 5 nights at this resort and I'd like to first say that the units are great, beds are comfortable and each unit is well-equipped. On the downside, there has been construction and reading reviews had prepared me for that. The entrance is truly an eye-sore and if I would not have had reservations through RCI, I would have left and looked elsewhere. Apparently they have done lots of work to make this resort up to date and attractive. I do NOT understand why they didn't start theremodel from the front back and give the resort an attractive entrance. Once in our two BR unit, our party of 5 was impressed and comfortable. We got a good nights sleep and we're all fitness enthusiasts so walking to the strip was welcomed exercise. What we didn't forsee was the part of town you walk through to get to the strip! At night, there's bums on the side walk and evidence of drug paraphanalia and questionnable people. It really did not feel like a safe walk and for that reason and that reason only, I personally would not return to this resort. If you're only taking shuttles and/or plan to rent a car, you should be fine getting around. I really don't recommend walking that area after dark. Their shuttles are great and you really should take advantage of them! When in the resort, you're in a whole different world and wouldn't imagine you're in a "bad" area. Landscaping is beautiful, pools are adequate, and service is fine. We were however surprised by a $55 fee for housekeeping with our 5 day stay. We've been timesharing for a long time and never had a fee like this. Unfortunately we left NO tip for housekeeping since we had that charge. All in all, a very nice resort - BAD location.

Reviews.Title: “Bad reviews not true”
Reviews.Author: luckycannuck
Reviews.Content: I don't know what some of the people are talking about this resort is GREAT. Just off the strip,shuttle courtesy of the resort. They are not quite done everything they plan to do but even the stage their at it is truly a GEM away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. If you are thinking of staying there don't think just do it. The staff are pleasant and helpful and go out of their way to help if they can. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. VIVA LASVEGAS!!!!!!!!!! 4 STARS SOON TO BE FIVE

Reviews.Title: “Quality Time Share”
Reviews.Author: dds18
Reviews.Content: This is a time share complex it is not a hotel! They have three buildings that are rented out as hotel rooms and I don't think they are as updated as the time share owner units. We stayed in a 2B 2B time share unit and it was excellent. Everything was as good as we could have expected or better. Both rooms had king beds and there were three large flat screen tvs. We had some problems with the gas fireplace and they were jolly on the spot with repairs. The shuttles are great but they are shuttles and have definite time restrictions (they go as specific times to specific places). The pool chairs were limited but it was spring break! Make sure you know what you want regarding show tickets. The concierge told us there were no bad seats at the Flamingo and believe me there certainly are terrible seats! We were extremely lucky as one of the ushers asked us if we could see. When we said no he took us downstairs to some excellent seats. I felt like I should have tipped him more! It was great to have a washer and dryer. We used them several times during the week. If I could find something negative it was the construction or lack there of on the front entry and club house. I asked several people about this and got a number of different stories which makes me wonder what is really going on. We did the sales presentation and I was amused at the prices as we purchased our unit on E Bay for almost nothing. If you want the gift card then you need to decide how much your time is worth. The presentation was not too high pressure but did last a lot longer than they said it would.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem -- Timeshares and Rental Units”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Steve
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a Fabulous Week in Las Vegas. This resort is top notch. The front is still under construction, getting a new entrance, Clubhouse, and main pool. That being said, once you go past this construction and through the resort, you don't see or hear the noise and dirt. The place is huge--we stayed in the back, in Building 17. We took the free golf cart ride to and from the building to the front entrance every day. There are four open pools, located in the quad area between each group of buildings, so the guests are spread out and not all congregated in one pool area. The units have 2-3 flat screen plasma TV's and a cool fireplace. We stayed in the two-bedroom unit, so we had two king beds. This was a first for us -- almost all of our 2 BR units have had twin beds in BR #2 so this was a real treat for me! The kitchen and eating area well laid out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, when it isn't Spring Break!”
Reviews.Author: IwannaECOthat
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here, great room and great location. The problem is that the pool was open 24/7 and it was right outside my door, and there were drunks in the hot tub during those late hours, yelling. But hey, it's Vegas, right? The shuttle to the different casinos was great and very helpful. Staff was so-so, the guard was nice and helpful, but I entered the office to ask a question and it took forever for the staff to help me. The resort was still under construction, but that really didn't bother me during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in town....”
Reviews.Author: eagleenterdb
Reviews.Content: This resort was clean and the staff very helpful..It was located with easy access to the strip or downtown if you were driving..If no car, the shuttle was always ready.. The grounds were lovely.. there is some construction but it was not a bother with noise or anything...I will tell all my friends and family about this resort and will return in the future..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Complex and a Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: stabrtPittsburgh_PA
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week's stay at Summer Bay. What a great value and excellent accomodations. We had an upgraded suite in Bld. 10, right in the middle of the resort and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Room was great, full kitchen, fireplace, flatscreen TVs, walk-in closet, very very comfortable. It is located one block behind Imperial Palace/Harrah's parking garages. We did walk to and from the strip in the day, not bad, a 10 minute walk. You can take either of the two roads right outside of the main entrance that lead up to the backs of the casinos. The shuttle service is great and on time. I suggest you use them as much as possible. We didn't rent a car so we either took taxis (to not have to put up with trying to learn where on to go and turn), walked or took the shuttle. Either way, you will be walking alot, whether in casinos, the strip, or even in old downtown, there is no way arround it. The resort was just perfect, great rooms, pools are nicely laid out (if it is warm enough to swim), hot tubs, and of course the shuttle service, plus golf cart pick-up and drop-off at your room if you so desire. The front entrance is still under construction which leaves a lot to be desired, although while we were there, we didn't even hear a nail being hammered let alone see any construction workers working. Must of had a few setbacks$$$$. Very friendly service, great location since you are not in the mad 'thick of things' on the strip. No problem with transportation at all. We will definitely stay here again on our timeshare points. No problems with being approached for a timeshare presentation, we were, we declined, and that was it. Great, helpful staff, who are willing to assist at any time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This place was so great, it was a shame I was there alone”
Reviews.Author: djsmoky
Reviews.Content: I used a RCI exchange to stay at Summer Bay in a 2 bedroom condo for a convention at the beginning of February. First of all, because of a snowstorm I couldn't get into to town until a day later than my reservation. I called to tell them this and the person who I talked to was very pleasant and took care of the change with no problem. Arriving at the resort the security guard greeted me with a warm smile and directed me to the office to check in. Check in was fast and easy. I requested a 3rd floor room so that I wouldn't hear anyone walking above me. And also got on in the back of the resort away from any construction. At check in I got the info packet with the instructions for the wifi, which they warn can be spotty but I had no problems. Also they give you there shuttle schedule. The shuttles take you to the strip, grocery store, and Fremont Street. I had a car, but they did have golf carts to take you to your building or to the shuttle stop if you needed one. As I said I was on the 3rd floor and they have no elevators, but it's only 3 floors. The condo was amazing! As I said I was in a 2 bedroom, but since my friends had to back out at the last minute I was in it alone. There was a LCD tv in the living room (52"), and 1 in each bedroom (42"). The one in the living room is over the fireplace, which since it was cold and raining I did use and it was a nice touch. Next to the fireplace was a basket with bedroom slippers for you. The kitchen was big with modern appliances. The dining room had a small table with 4 chairs around it, but also 2 extra chairs beside it. The bedrooms were big and the closets in each room were walk ins. The bathrooms had showers with the big showerheads and lots of pressure. In the master bedroom there was a big sunken tub. 4 people could probably fit. The condo also had a balcony with a table and 2 chairs. There is no smoking in the condo, but the give you an ashtray for the balcony, plus a receptacle for you butts. I had a view of the pool area from my balcony. The pool has 24 hour access, a hot tub, and shuffleboard court. On the outside of the pool was a picnic area with a big gas grill, tables and little huts for shade. They are still doing construction, but I didn't hear anything from it and it looks to be in the final stages. They only 2 bad parts of the resort was 1) I heard airplanes a few times while there. But in 5 days I may have heard 5 planes for less than 30 seconds each and not early morning or late at night. 2) The washer and dryer (which are full size and comes with detergent and dryer sheets) is in a room that has the door out on the deck. Which means if you are used to doing your laundry in your underwear, that's not going to work! Haha! That's a small price to pay to be at a great resort in a great location (1 Vegas block from the Strip). The highest praise I can give a resort is that I told my mom she should stay there when she goes to Vegas. Especially if I go with her!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing get away from the hussle and bussle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: jldh09
Reviews.Content: I went to the Summer Bay resort in January with 4 of my closed friends for a joint bachlorette getaway! Everything was wonder and everyone was wonderful! It was all of our first times to Las Vegas so whenever I called down to the front desk they were very helpful. It was really nice for all of us to be able to stay together and get ready together!! The condo was gorgeous; everything about it was new and shiny. It was nice having the two bathrooms to get ready in, and it was really nice have a dishwasher. The only thing that would have been nice, would be to have had more dishes and glasses. If you do order pizza you have to go to the gate to get it, they don't let anybody into the gates without a resort card. Taxes however do come right to your room, and you don't have to wait outside because they will call your cell phone when they are downstairs. The shuttle to the outlet mall and fremont street is awesome, you leave at 10:30 in the morning and are picked up at 3:15 to go back to the resort. Shuttle's run to the strip every hour and to the grocery store in the morning at 8:30. I would definitely go back to Summer Bay, it will be nice to go when the weather is warmer so I can go in the pools!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: AmberB5
Reviews.Content: Resort was still under construction when we stayed, but it didn't bother us one bit. This resort is definitely 5 star quality, and if it is available the next time we go to Vegas, we will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: NWAFayetteville
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, rented 2 rooms. Check in was quick. We got an excellent price and the rooms were very clean. The guys at the front gate where awesome. They hailed a cab for my son and his girlfriend in the rain! The pool was warm and the hot tub was hot. There was construction but the noise was minimal. Very quite! Very near the strip and if you have a rental car parking at the major hotels is always free. The Décor was outdated but the bed was comfortable. We had the older rooms. Each room had a kitchen and a washer and dryer. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it ! !”
Reviews.Author: Aprilia_Motogp
Reviews.Content: I cashed in a ResortCert/Getawayweek certificate for a week at Summer Bay Resort. If you want to stay at a quiet, non-casino area, but still close to all the action on the strip..this is the place!! Check in was easy, and everyone was very nice. The staff was very helpful with answering questions, and informing you of all the services and ammenities. These are timeshares with full kitchen, living room and bedroom with a full bathroom. The kitchen was equipoed with gas stove/oven, fridge, coffeemaker, cookware and dishware and dishwasher. Granite counters and a dining room table were in the eating area (see pictures). There is a full walk in closet, 2 large LCD TV's (one living room, one in bedroom, and a large guarded bathtub/shower in the bathroom. To say the least...it WAS SWEEEET !! It was unseasonably chilly during our stay, so the gas fireplace came in handy The property is located a block and 1/2 from Flamingo/Harrahs on Koval Rd. Transportation to those casinos, as well as Rio, Circus-Circus, MGM, and Freemont Street was provided for FREE !! (They have a printed schedule which has a list of every stop and pickup site every hour. When you get back to Summer Bay, they will take you back to your room via golf cart...free! You can also call and be picked up from your room to the front where the buses pickup. Also, the property is gated, so security was never an issue! Swimming pools were heated and there are jacuzzis at each pool area. Each place has a balcony with it's own connected private laundry room. The balcony is smoker friendly, as I enjoyed a few cigars during my stay. I cannot stress enough how friendly and helpful the staff was at this resort. If you have the opportunity to stay here, I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jazatlanta
Reviews.Content: I have no idea what these other people are talking about when they say this place is terrible. I had a great stay, and the staff was very helpful. In addition, the rooms are awsome, with big screen tv's, full kitchen, sunken tubs, granit counter tops, Free WIFI, and much more. What else could you possibly ask for? It is also located in a perfect spot... I could walk to the Sands Convention center, or any of the following casino's... Harrah's, Venetian, Imperial Palace. And if you wanted to get someplace else, the Monorail is attached the Imperial Palace, so it was very easy to just go get a day pass. The only draw back is that there is no food attached to the hotel and any delivery is very expensive. They shuttles do have a schedule if you want to go to the grocery store, and if you are staying more than a couple of days, I highly recommend it. I will definitely be staying there for all my future Vegas business. PS... the construction is no big deal because it is just up at the guard gate, and won't effect you at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyblackjack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid-January during the big rain storm that hit California, Nevada and Arizona.. The weather did not dampen our stay at the Summer Bay Resort. The units were modern (2 big flat screen TVs), comfortable, clean and roomy with a large walk in closet. My wife loved the closet and it was so large she even let me have some space! The resort is located a couple of blocks off the Strip. You can walk to the strip easily although you have to walk through the Imperial Palace parking lot and I'm not sure you should do it at night. The area around the resort is quiet. If you don't mind walking up steps I recommend getting a unit on the third floor. We were on the first floor and could hear the folks walking around in the unit above us. The only reason I did not give this place a perfect score was that they advertised a work-out room and they don't have one. It will abe in the club house that is under construction and it will probably be under construction for some time. They've only completed the foundation and they've been working on it for several months now. There were only two guys working on the building when we were there. Anyway, outside of that, it is a great place and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here every time I go to Vegas!! :)”
Reviews.Author: JOC15
Reviews.Content: I dont know what the person below me is talking about. I had such an AMAZING time at this resort while in Vegas from 1/8/10-1/15/10 that I had to write a review. This Resort is WONDERFUL!! I cant express that enough. From the moment you head into check in (make sure you try the free popcorn) you will feel at home. Every worker we came across was friendly and fun. The staff helped us transport our bags up to our room.... and the rooms are Huge! The balcony, flat screen tvs, fireplace, huge bathtubs, comfy king size beds, etc. We were 6 people and had plenty of room while staying in our 2 bedroom suite. The Shuttle they offer to locations on the strip is very convenient... although the Resort is only 1 block away, we would often walk to the strip instead. Its right across the street from Harrah's Hotel and the Venetian. The shuttle also takes you to the supermarket, Downtown Las Vegas, and Ellis Island! Anything else you need, just Press 0 on your room phone and the staff is ready to help. I would def recommend this place for your Vegas Vacation! Good Value, Amazing Location, and Great convenience!! Just FYI- There was some construction going on while we were there because they are adding a convenience store/gift shop, coffee shop,deli, poolside bar and bbq, new game room/arcade by Summer.. but this did not interfere with our stay at all!

Reviews.Title: “quiet stay just off strip”
Reviews.Author: tofdel1
Reviews.Content: This resort is at least a 3 star property. I would give it 4. Only problem I had with it is it doesn't have all the amenities/activities of most resorts. If you know what to expect, you won't be dissapointed. I make it a rule to research before I go on a trip. I believe the owners and timeshare rentals recieve better units. I didn't see the older buildings, so can't compare the two. we had a 2 bedroom in building 14. It was toward the back of the property, and walking would be long for most people to the strip. Problaby 2-3 blocks. Nice if you have a car. Building 14 has a rectangular pool, with an indoor and outdoor hot tub. I was the only one in the pool at 7 am! lol it was also only 55 degrees, but I had no problem going from hot tub to pool to hot tub. It was a short walk to them from room. golf carts to take you to front gate. Security, and employees were all nice. Not hard to get a taxi. Concierege was helpful and printed boarding passes for return. they are still building and remodeling , so keep in mind. didn't bother me any. Our unit was clean and nice. Would recommend to everyone, who is not concerned with construction and landscaping.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Las Vegas in 11 years!”
Reviews.Author: contactleong
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th trip to Vegas in 11 years, and our 2nd consecutive year, 2-weeks' stay in Summer Bay. It's the cheapest, best place to stay for those attending the CES. It's only minutes walk to Sands and from there take the free CES shuttles to LVCCs. You can be back for a nap and return to CES all freshed up without missing anything. Amenities inside the apartment are complete. I especially love the 90 plus channels satellite TV. The unit was clean and well stocked with fresh towels for a week's use. The Resort provides regular free shuttles to strategic points on the Strip up to mid-night. Lots of savings on transportation. Even picks up from unit to shuttle waiting area. And free popcorn and coffee while waiting! How can you beat this? Staff were friendly and accomodating. Especially like that some of the shuttle drivers are very knowledgeable about Vegas and provided great advices. By far, a much better option than staying in expensive hotels on the Strip. This is a hidden gem in a much explored and hyped Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ABTravelLady
Reviews.Content: Although there are renovations going on, we found the resort to be quiet. We were in a suite that had been redone and it was clean and beautiful. It's a great place for families as there is kitchen and laundry. There is also several pools. There was ample parking. It is close to the strip (1-2 blocks). We felt safe walking both day and night (we were walking as late as midnight).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful!”
Reviews.Author: amandaashley2003
Reviews.Content: This "resort" was a joke. First of all, it is located well off the strip, next to a power plant, in a very seedy neighborhood. We were apporoached by numerous bums as we walked the 20 minute walk to the strip. We were even followed by one! The best part of the walk was the dead bum we had to walk past as the cops were investigating. NOT A NICE LOCATION! Luckily we had our car, so we drove from then on out. The next thing I would caution you against is that the resort pictures online look NOTHING like the actual resort. It is what the resort "will" look like when it is completed. Right now, hardly any pools are open and they are all tiny. There are no covered cabana-looking structures as pictured. There's an abundance of construction equipment and non-paved roads. I understand that Vegas is often under construction, but we never saw anything being worked on and we were there both on a weekend and weekdays. We were given two room keys and of course only one worked. The room was nice; however, the beds were uncomfortable and the sheets were a rough, low thread count that didn't feel pleasant on the skin. Additionally, upon check-in, we were given an inventory sheet and asked to verify the count on ALL of the linens, glasses, dishes, utensils, appliances, etc. and compare it with what housekeeping said we had. This took almost 20 minutes and we found numerous discrepencies that we probably would have been charged for if we didn't catch them right away. (When did vacation become work?) When my husband took the inventory sheet and the key that didn't work to the office, he said he couldn't really get anyone to help because no one in the office spoke very much English. They just said, "OK. Thank you" over and over.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!! Just look BEYOND the entrance...”
Reviews.Author: TravelBabyD
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Las Vegas for the Thanksgiving holiday and I stayed at the Summer Bay Resorts. We took a cab from LAS to the resort - it took about 7 minutes.. cost us maybe $15 bucks. When we pulled up to the entrance... My heart dropped into my stomach and my eyes began to swell up - the front of this property looked like Beirut!!! Chunky dirt mountains as tall as a tree, exposed pipes, excavation machines, gaping holes in the ground... wow!!! There was a security station with a guard inside and he asked us what we needed and then he directed us to the check in. This place was obviously an old apartment that was in the process of being remodeled.. so the check in was like the rental office. Check in's at 4 p.m. so we waited. There was a small area in and out to wait, the bellman was willing to store our bags and there was free popcorn. Our attitudes were very skeptical and I had the feeling I had been tricked and deceived... it was boiling. All those feelings went away when we opened the door to our room. Beautiful livingroom with a flat screen tv, fireplace, dvd player, stereo.. kitchen fully upgraded with granite counters, black appliances, fully stocked with pans & dishes, dining room, separate bedroom with a flat screen, walk in closet, bathroom with a huge jacuzzi tube, separate water closet.. patio with a laundry room.. stocked with vacuum, washer & dryer, iron, laundry basket and even the Tide & Downey! It was great! There is also a spa on the premises, but I didn't get a chance to indulge. There was a shuttle that came every hour on the half hour and also a shuttle to the grocery store, outlet malls and other places of interest. The golf cart could be called to pick you up and take you to the front of the complex to catch the shuttle or to catch a cab. This resort was VERY quiet, a lot of seniors... come to think of it, we were the only younger people there and I am 30, my hubby is 40. My only few little complaints was the construction, fitness facility wasn't complete and the rental car place they refer you to are crooks. Get on line and rent from Fox.. they are the cheapest. It was absolutely awesome. So peaceful.. this place is right behind the Flamingo and also near Ellis Island. Perfect for peace and a party. You are very close to the strip, but not too close! Just don't walk anywhere... the area gets a little skanky at night. The trip from the 7Eleven was like Nightmare on Elmstreet. All in all, I would recommend this place, and I plan on returning!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Thanksgiving Stay”
Reviews.Author: parforthecourse
Reviews.Content: We spent our Thanksgiving week at Summer Bay Resort Las Vegas and had a wonderful time. We exchanged for the week through Trading Places International. Check-In on Sunday was a breeze and we were very pleased with our one-bedroom first-floor condo. The accomodations were newly renovated and decorated and quite comfortable. King-size bed, two wall mounted plasma TV's, huge tub and shower, and all of the appliances and utensils one could need. The location to the Strip was convenient for everything from early morning runs along the strip, to nightly strolls. We did have our own transportation for the week, but noticed non-stop shuttles from the resort for those without their own transportation. The pool and hot tub jacuzzi were right outside our door and were clean, practically vacant every time we used them, and very enjoyable. All of the employees that we encountered were very pleasant and helpful. The only negative experience that I can even comment on was that the wireless internet became unavailable at mid-week, and was out the rest of the week. The construction issues were minimal and not disruptive in the least way. If you are looking for a quiet and comfortable place to stay, and still within easy access to the Strip, Summer Bay Resort would be high on my list of places to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at SUmmer Bay”
Reviews.Author: NYtrips
Reviews.Content: Stayed here through RCI points. We stayed in a brand new 1 bedroom on the third floor. Everything was brand new - granite countertops, nice appliances, washer/dryer. To have all the comforts of home was great. There was even a huge walk-in closet and a bathtub that could fit an entire family! The staff was very friendly and helpful when we needed directions. They also helped us get a good deal on a rental car. The location was convenient to the strip. You could walk if you want but the street there seemed a bit shady and I would not have wanted to walk through that way at night. However, the available shuttle's to Harrah's were great because it let you off mid-strip and you could walk wherever else. The pool was open 24 hours which was awesome. Parking is readily available. The balcony was great too.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Getaway Vacation”
Reviews.Author: PaddyCakes206
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this RCI Extra Vacation Getaway 8/21-28/09 with my grandson- what a great surprise! Management offered a clean, efficient 2 bedroom/2bath full granite kitchen, dining area, laundry area & living room w/granite fireplace & outside balcony overlooking one of the several pools. Coffee ready at the office every A.M. - the view of other casinos was great, especially at night. Shuttle & room service provided, could not have been better - so friendly, especially Steve. We walked to Ellis Island - good food - best buffet in Vegas is The Wynn (excellent) See "The Supranos" & don't miss the shuttle to downtown to see the light show! We are returning in 2010 - can't wait - I rate this as a 10........

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: marierika
Reviews.Content: I had a seminar in vegas and we got to this resort by a Time share offer I got in miami. I was a afraid it will be horrible...but i was so surprised! it was amazing, very close to the strip but still quite. the room was so great and clean. We loved it!!! great location and great value!! Good future when they finish the construction.

Reviews.Title: “Rate resort highly on everything!”
Reviews.Author: AudreyMD
Reviews.Content: Spent October 18-25 in a one bedroom, second floor unit. Was able to walk to Sands Expo Center for AARP convention; shuttle bus service to the Strip throughout the day and for scheduled shopping trips. We did not want to rent a car and, fortunately, found that a car was not needed while staying at this resort. Unit was new in appearance, clean, comfortable with working a/c, flat screen tvs, appliances, etc. Staff drove guests in a golf carts to their units and carried the luggage into the unit. Staff friendly and helpful, guest oriented. Yes, renovations have slowed down because of the economy but I can overlook that as the resort offered so much more (location, conveniences, comfortable accommodations, service, wi-fi connection) that I would come back at a drop of a hat. I have traveled personally and professionally for decades, staying in pensions to five star hotels. I was quite happy with this property and recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: margsalady
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week stay in a two bedroom apartment. Coluld not fault anything fromroom, staff, transport, swimming pool, booking shows and general helpfulness. would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway near the strip”
Reviews.Author: engrnfwb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Summer Bay Desert Club as a timeshare exchange and had a great time. The resort is a couple blocks from the strip which makes it very cozy and not as hectic. The resort offers bus trips to a few of the casinos, but we walked half the time. And when we did go driving in our car, all the casinos have free self-parking. The resort was still under construction, but our room was facing away from the construction site and convenient to one of the five pools/jacuzzis. Eventually the resort will provide much more amenities and activities, but its pretty close to completion already. Our room was decorated very nicely with almost all new furnishings and appliances. The kitchen had very nice countertops and large flat screen TV's in the living room and both bedrooms. The bedrooms each had a King-sized bed and walk-in closet. And the master had a very nice large garden tub and separated toilet. It was a comfortably warm time for us to visit, but there was a working fireplace to use for the winter. Wireless internet was always available and fast. And housekeeping kept the rooms clean and neat a few times in the week we stayed there. We would definitely recommend the Summer Bay to all our friends and family when visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “All one could want”
Reviews.Author: jasmcp
Reviews.Content: A 10 min walk into the back of Harrahs or the Imperial Palace. No point in me repeating all that has been said about the rooms. All our luggage (6 cases) were lost on way out by USAirways and we had to go shopping for clothes. Had we been in a hotel it would have been a nightmare. What a godsend the washer and dryer turned out to be, I learned you can survive in Vegas on two pair of shorts and shirts if you have the home comforts. Viva Summer Bay. All night pool and jacuzzi were great for unwinding in the early hours on return from the Strip. The only downside was the Internet connection problems that were ongoing. We were told this was due to the construction work interfering with the automated phone password system. Why each room has to have a different password that has to be changed on a daily basis? I do not know. Excessive security, they should just give a generic password to guests on arrival. I think this was the thing that annoyed most guests during my stay. I would certainly stay at the place again if in Vegas with Family, will be truly wonderful when construction work is completed. They should have set aside an area with some fitness equipment that would suffice until they get the Fitness Centre completed. I have used the diner buffet in the Imperial Palace, Harras and The Paris would rate them in that order. Was a bit disappointed with the Paris. The prime Rib in the Imperial Palace was quite possible the nicest piece of meat I have ever eaten (I have been eating a lot of meat for 50 yrs). That Good, I ate it twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: gentileam
Reviews.Content: Our vacation at Summer Bay Resorts Desert Club Las Vegas was a very enjoyable one. I was expecting much worse, from the reviews I read on Trip Advisor, then what I saw when I arrived at Summer Bay on Sunday 9/13/09. There was no main entrance only a canopy for the security guard to stand under, the main pool and amenities were still under construction. However, when we checked in the staff was extremely friendly and accommadating. I requested a room on the first floor with a view of the pool, I didn't want to see any of the construction. The woman at the front desk gave me a map with a few different room numbers so I could see for myself where I wanted to stay. I decided on building #17, which was at the end of the resort on the first floor with a view of the pool and the grounds. We stayed there for 7 nights along with my cousin and his wife . The four of us enjoyed sitting outside under the huts for lunch or cocktails, we also took advantage of the barbeque grills. Everyone at the resort was extremely friendly. Also, everyone morning the grounds were manicured, pool cleaned and the barbeque grills were also cleaned, which I was very impressed by. The only suggestion I have is for the resort to hurry up and finish the construction, it would be that much better once this is done. Also, there are no umbrellas by the lounge chairs at the pool. It is very sunny and you cannot sit there for very long. The room we had was very nice, granite counter tops, fireplace, bedrooms were a nice size with huge closets. Everything was very clean and new. It was a good long block from the strip, directly behind Imperial Palace and Harrahs, it was convenient to area restaurants and shops. I would definitely recommend the resort, if you want something away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay but must walk or ride to get to the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Gram72
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds even though the main entrance, clubhouse and pool are still under construction. The 1 bedroom condo was small but very comfortable. Flat screen TVs in bedroom and living room, DVD player and stereo unit also. The kitchen was well equipped too......if you plan to cook on vacation (not me!). It's great to have a refrigerator and microwave though. There were 4 very nice pools to choose from even though the main pool was not finished yet. The resort is a very nice place to stay but if you plan to spend a lot of time on the strip you'll have walk or use a car. It's a pain when you plan to eat all your meals out. I did enjoy not having to trapes through the hotel/casino to get to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt Ask For Better!!”
Reviews.Author: ahotelemployee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Summerbay resorts and it was by far the best place off of the strip. The resort was only a block and a half away from the strip.Very peaceful for being so close!!! So it was a perfect location. We were a little scared of staying there because of the reviews on the internet. But we did not have any problems at all. They offered a shuttle service that goes all over the place. The shuttle was GREAT!!! The drivers are a little scary, but I suppose that is "city folk" and the way they drive. We expected the front desk personel to be aweful like how they were on the phone, but that was not true either. They were kind and helped us with everything and anything they could. The 2 bedroom place was not one of the updated rooms, but for it not be updated, it was also GREAT!!! We had a dishwasher, washer and dryer, a private patio, full fridge, pots and pans and dishes. They housekeeping came almost everyday to give us new/ fresh towels, dish soap, laundry soap, etc. I would recommend this place to ANYONE!!!! Best bang for your buck!!!! Now its time for some advice for anyone who is thinking about going there, or already booked a stay there.... Request second floor, request pool side, and make you sure during your stay you go to the grocery store and stock up on a few things.... The only bad thing about this place, Summerbay is not for younger people! Alot of older and retired people staying there, so there is no eyecandy at the pool. If you are loud and looking to have parties!!! Please dont stay there and ruin it for the ones who go to Vegas to relax!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BUYER - BEWARE.......”
Reviews.Author: DeeDeeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I purchased a week at Summer Bay Resorts on Koval and was very disappointed with the "resort". Be careful when you book this trip because their Internet site photos are not what the resort really looks like. When we arrived by taxi there were tractors in front of the resort, and the main pool with what was suppose to be a waterfall had a chain link fence around it. It was very hot, and the air-conditioning in the main reception area which is another condo, wasn't working properly. The taxi driver was told to put our luggage under a patio umbrella by some lawn chairs in front of the building. After we registered, there wasn't anyone around to take our luggage to our condo which was quite a distance to walk in the heat. When we finally found our condo, our key would not open the door - so we had to go back to the main (condo) which is a make-shift office, for another key that did work. It was quite a hassle. The condo was very small, but nice and clean. There were two flat screened TV's, but the one in the bedroom was too close to the bed. The air-conditioning in the condo would not shut off and ran the entire night. It was very noisy. In the morning, I called the front desk and was told someone would take a look at it. After another night of little sleep because of the loud air-conditioner, I was assured that someone would take a look at it that day. When we returned in the evening, a message said the conditioner was fine. Since it continued to run, we turned it off and opened the patio door for air in the late evening when it cooled down. The grounds were torn up. We went for a swim in the only pool that was open and there were two patio umbrellas to provide shade which were unfortunately taken. We complained that there wasn't any shampoo or coffee in our condo. We were told they would bring some --------------- they never did. My friend and I got really disgusted with the noise, lack of shade at the only pool that was open, and the construction. We were so unhappy we left after only staying 3 nights. We checked into Harrahs and were much happier with their facilities. This was a major disappointment. Perhaps when the "resort" is completed it will be nicer. For now, if you need taxi service you sit under a couple of patio umbrellas outside where it is hot. The patio furniture is mismatched, there's no lobby to relax in, and you feel like your in a 3rd world country. BEWARE of this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: travelN2s
Reviews.Content: We travel two or three times a year. Mostly - All-Inclusives to the carribean. This was our first time share experience. Things we liked - The resort: The staff is very polite and helpful. The resort is a block or two from the Strip and has shuttles that take you everywhere - Harrahs, Planet Hollywood, Fremont Street and the outlet stores, just to name a few. You are supposed to sign up for the shuttle to the grocery store and Fremont Street. Everytime we called to reserve a spot on the shuttle the front desk said it was full, but it was never full. So, don't go by what the front desk says, just show up for the shuttle. There is no resturant there,but the condos have fully equipped kitchens. The pool is open 24hrs a day. Fremont Street was favorite among the guests. It is fabulous. Defending the Caveman was hilarious. Sin City Comedy Show was also hilarious. Things we did not like: Tony Romas on Fremont Street. Food was awful, bordering on gross. Premium Outlets - worst shopping experience I have ever had. It has very few stores. It is open air and with the temp being near 100 degrees - YUCK!! Prices were higher than most Outlet Malls. Food court had only four or five choices and they were all junk. We very few exceptions we had a great time on our trip to Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but little else going for it.”
Reviews.Author: nicksim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Summer Bay from Aug 24-31, 2009 on an RCI exchange (but they rent on a retail basis also). In a nutshell, only a great deal on pricing would bring us back—at least until the place is finished. Pros. Staff was uniformly friendly and helpful when possible. (Maintenance came to fix our microwave 10 minutes after calling—even though it was about 1 AM!). Our two BR unit was nicely furnished and looked recently renovated. I’d rate it a 9 out of 10. Grounds nicely manacured and floral. An hourly shuttle service takes you to various locations on the strip or you can simply walk to the nearest Hotel (Harrah's) in about 12 minutes. Golf carts will shoosh you around the resort if you call, but it was small enough to walk in. It was certainly quiet if that's what you came to LV for. Cons. No curb appeal at all. The front area is a construction eyesore of half chewed demolished buildings and dusty pavement (but oddly, there was not much actual construction activity while we were there). The ‘resort’ is actually a recently converted residential condo cluster of some 600 units. We’re told that the resort had been across the street but was bought and demolished by a nearby big hotel and SB took over and renovated these residential condos. Thus, sitting between this new resort and the strip is one LONG block of desolate no-man’s-land: fenced in dust and debris, some employee parking, scrub weeds. Big plans for development we’re told, but no construction as of yet. (The economy?) We walked to the strip day and night (Harrah’s) numerous times, feeling no unease, but when it’s 107 degrees and an ugly nothing, you might want to wait for the shuttle--if it's going where you want at that time--plan well. There is no gym, no club house, no spa, no consistently functioning internet, and no welcome activities. They do their best to back fill (in-room spa treatments, for example), but it’s simply an apartment you’re getting--not a resort. Lacking a finished office area, all the check-in and other resort services are handled in converted guest rooms—cramped and un-inviting. The shuttle goes to different spots at different times and is often too small for the number of passengers. There is only one shuttle per day to Von’s supermarket. The three pleasant pools/hot tubs are nestled among groups of condo buildings but are small and un-interesting (but were uncrowded). Remember, these were apartment pools, not luxurious hotel or resort pools. (But their proximity and fences would be ideal for families with young children.) The construction sign says “Gold Crown Rating” (an RCI standard of excellence) but it is not. A Summer Bay internal “Crown Club” is in the making, which will allow SB owners to get into the other 9 or so SB properties (Missouri, Tennessee, Florida…) Bottom line: If you can snag a 2-BR $249 RCI last-minute RCI special here it’s a comfortable, if a bit out of the way, place to nest for the Las Vegas strip experience. Shuttles (common everywhere in LV) make up somewhat for the heat and distance. If you’re spending many hundreds, however, look at discount packages at strip hotels. The older properties start at $39/nite. You’ll only get a cheap room, but you’ll be in the thick of the action. In 2010 there should be some relief from the dust and lack of facilities.

Reviews.Title: “a good place for a relaxing vacation (only a few inconveniences)”
Reviews.Author: lnj4boogie
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at summer bay August 10-16, 2009. I had been to Vegas the previous Nov, and was switched to Tahiti Village because the Summer Bay grounds weren't done, so I was interested to see the renovations. We got there late the night of the 10th,taking the $12 round trip shuttle from the airport (dont take a cab folks not worth it). Check itnwas uneventful, except it was at check in that they told us the internet was out and wasn't expected to be turned back on until the 14th. It was at this point we signed up for the shuttle to the grocery store at 8:00am the next morning. We were in room 13204. Beautiful apartment, huge tub,king size bed two flat screens and all of the kitchen utensils you need including blender, toaster, microwave, full stove with oven, full washer dryer, broom, vaccum, dishwashing liquid, washing powder, paper towels. We took the shuttle to the strip. Keep in mind the shuttle runs every half hour but to diferent hotels on the strip. The strip is close enough to walk to but I'd suggest only doing so in the day time. A cab to the mandalay bay cost us about $17 (far south of the strip) to Harrahs it cost $5) day 2 got up took shuttle to grocery and brought a ridiculous amount of food. We were back to the apartment by 10. day 2&3 we didn't leave the grounds, but sat by the pool which is equipped with shower, and towels, so no need to bring one from your hotel room. the pool is minimally shaded but nice and goes to about 6 feet deep. There is a little putting green attached to the pool and they played some nice reggae music.... if it wasn't for all the sand I would have thought I was in the carribbean. Cleaning crew comes in on your 3rd day of stay to refresh your linens and apartment. day 4 our toaster broke and we were promplty brought a working one.the ac cut out, called a maintenance guy and he fixed it within the hour. Our tv went out for about an hour and there was still no internet. day 5 we took the 11:00 am free shuttle to the outlets came back about 3 (4 hours) we passed on the massuse to come to our room and opted to get a massage at the Imperial Palace. day 6 we left the flat (sadly saying goodbye) one of the grounds crew took us to the front with luggage and all. So all in all then place has a few kinks (construction, no club house or gym built yet, internet and TV going out because of construction) but I'd highly recommend it if your looking for a home like relaxing environment in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: moomoonz
Reviews.Content: Very cheap, great staff, tidy and attractive room. Close to walk to strip but with a free shuttle as well, PERFECT. Only issues were minor, chlorine issue with the pools, changed the colour on some of our jewellery and hurt our eyes quite badly. Also the best pool with the waterfall was closed during our whole stay. Very very small issues, otherwise totally recommended. A+++

Reviews.Title: “Our new Vegas go to!”
Reviews.Author: Darkdivine
Reviews.Content: Summer Bay was exactly what we were looking for. My husband and I booked on Expedia and paid about $100 a night including taxes. This is a fantastic deal! They do NOT charge for overnight parking, they do NOT charge the standard LV resort fee or any other rip off fees that you WILL encounter at the other resorts. But if you do book through Expedia... make sure you call Expedia for the local resort phone number. The number provided on the Expedia website and confirmation is a corporate number and if you don't call during office hours you are not able to reach anyone. ;) We called ahead to inform them of our late check in and were pleased with their welcoming customer service. We were happy to be greeted by the 24 hour guard at the gate and directed to the check in rooms. At this point they have 2 rooms set up for check in as their main reception/clubhouse area is under construction. We were greeted several times by the friendly staff and check in was simple. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom unit as the 1 bedrooms were full. We were also given a helpful welcome packet that contained maps and information that we found useful during our stay. The resort itself is an apartment complex. The units are large enough to live in! Our unit had 2 bedrooms (both with TV's), 2 bathrooms, a large walk in closet, a decent size living room area (with another TV), a dinning area with table seating for 6, a full kitchen (dishes, blender, microwave, full refrig. ect), a laundry room (washer, dryer, iron, full ironing board, and detergent) and a nice size balcony with a table and chairs. My husband loved the giant bathtub as it was big enough for 2. I loved their mango soap, lotion and shampoo. It's perfect for an extended stay, 2 couples and/or a family with children. I was told that most of the units are time share units and others are reserved for Expedia, Hotwire and other Internet bookings. Our room has decent standard decor and was clean. We noticed that the time share rooms were the posh rooms. They had modern decor and flat screen TV's. So when looking at the pictures... you can expect the less attractive rooms. We were only slightly disappointed. The grounds are well maintained and quiet. We spent time at the pool closest to our room. The pools are not overcrowded like every other LV pool I've been to. I believe that 4 of the 5 pools were open so there were options. The main pool looks beautiful but was not open due to the clubhouse construction. We were told that they plan to complete construction by October. They do not have food on site but offer a free shuttle to the grocery store and many other LV locations. We drove so we just went out and bought our own food and drinks to stock the kitchen. There are also many nice restaurants near by. They do offer a room service menu which I assume is delivery from somewhere near by. We were not interested. The resort location is a short walk from the strip. From the resort we walked about 1 city block on a road between 2 vacant lots. From there you are in a parking garage area with access to the strip. Or from the parking garage you can grab the metro rail for $5 a trip or $13 day pass. We did NOT want to stay on the strip. We did NOT want to walk through a casino every time we left the hotel or returned. We did NOT want to be surrounded by noise, lights and drunk people all the time. Summer Bay was our Oasis. My husband and I have been to Vegas more times than we can count. This was by far the most relaxing and enjoyable trip. For the first time ever we actually look forward to our next Vegas stay. I assure you that we book at Summer Bay for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A real Las Vegas winner !”
Reviews.Author: BargainBuyer
Reviews.Content: This was probably one of the nicest time share resorts we have been to. Our one bedroom unit was lovely and clean and newly renovated. It was a little smaller than some of the units we had been in, but was perfect for two adults and a small family. I think it would be a tight fit for four adults. The resort is only a few miles from the airport and is easy to locate. You may hear planes flying overhead occasionally. That would probably be true at almost any location on or near the strip as the airport is so close. Arriving at the gated resort, a security guard checked our name on a list and directed us to the office. The “front desk” is a small, crowded (and warm the day we were there) room that was filled with people when we arrived. (The front desk is to be moved to a different location once construction is complete.) We had to wait on line in the hall. The line moved at a reasonable pace. When our turn came, the attendant was pleasant and professional. When I asked for a room in a quiet location away from the construction areas, he offered me three choices and pointed them out on a map of the large facility. We chose a unit away from potential noise of the (open 24 hours) pool. Our one bedroom unit was on the second floor of building 2 which turned out to be a very convenient location. We had absolutely no problem with construction noise, or with sounds from the units above and below us. After check-in we had to proceed across the hall to receive our parking pass and “welcome gift.” We were politely asked if we would like to attend a time share sales presentation and we said no. Our welcome gift was actually pretty nice, containing granola bars and health and beauty aid samples. There was ample parking available in front of the units. We dragged our bags up the stairs (NOTE: the buildings range up to three floors and none have elevators). The front door opened into a living room on the left and a kitchen on the right. The living room featured a 50 inch flat screen tv across from a sleeper couch. There was a cocktail table and end table with a lamp. All of the rooms were nicely furnished with plants and paintings and decorative mirrors and dark (cherry or mahogany) wooden furniture. A large entertainment unit with a DVD player inside and a stereo unit on top with iPod dock was adjacent to the tv. There was also a fireplace with a granite border which matched the granite in the kitchen and bathroom. It also had a large ceiling fan. To the left of the living room was a small outdoor patio with table and two chairs. A door off the patio led to a utility room which contained a full sized washer and dryer with samples of detergent and dryer sheets.
